loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ella es propietaria de 2 motocarros, los que desde hace 5 años son fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia. Estas herramientas de trabajo son manejadas uno por su esposo y la otra por su hijo, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros, y Eliana se encarga de la administración de las ganancias diarias, que lo que le gusta de este negocio, que puede ver los ingresos cada día.  Adicionalmente, Eliana se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, la que lleva a vender de casa en casa por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe mucho compañerismo y hay responsabilidad en sus pagos, por lo que nombraron a su banco, “Trabajando Juntos”. Mil soles del dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la reparación y mantenimiento de sus motocarros, con el resto comprará más ropa de segundo uso para la venta.
texts.en:
Eliana is 50-years-old. She lives with her husband and her two children in their own home. She owns two motorcycle rickshaws, which for five years have been the source of income for her family. These vehicles are driven by her husband and her son, who transport passengers in them. Eliana is in charge of managing their daily profits. What she likes about this business is being able to see their income every day. Additionally, Eliana sells used clothing, which she takes from house to house to sell in different places in their area. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She likes to work with her communal bank because there is a lot of camaraderie and responsibility to make their payments. This is why they named their bank, "Trabajando Juntos" (Working Together). One thousand soles of this money will be invested in repairing and maintenance of the motorcycle rickshaws. The rest will go towards purchasing more used clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle rickshaws

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert K. is married and has four dependants. He has received schooling through junior high. Since 1999, Robert has been a radio mechanic at Kakasi near Elmina. His wife is a trader. Robert uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Robert will use the loan to purchase more and better tools and equipment to enhance his repair work. Robert plans to reinvest the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more and better tools and equipment to enhance his repair work.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.en:
Dmitriy is married with one child. He owns a retail business selling men's clothing. Dmitriy has three business locations at different markets. He works at one kiosk and has two employees that sell clothing at two other kiosks. His total monthly revenue is 10,000 UAH.

Dmitriy lives with his family in a small apartment. His relatives helped him chose his business direction and develop the business. Dmitriy is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working young man. He wants to develop his business even further, open new locations, employ more people and make even more profit.

Dmitriy would like to borrow 7,700 UAH to increase his inventory. He would spend the extra income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Asafo

texts.en: Asafo N. is an electrical repairer with a junior high education living at Comender Junction near Elmina. He is married and has 2 children; his wife is a farmer. A repairer of electrical and electronic devices since 1994, Asafo is responsible for paying the family's rent and utility bills, his children's school fees, and other financial expenses. His loan will be used to buy more and better tools and equipment to enhance his repair work. He hopes to reinvest the new profits from his business into expanding his trade and also save towards a house he wants to construct, so he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: To buy more and better tools and equipment to enhance his repair work.

loans.name: Marguerite Assiba

texts.fr:
Née le 06 juillet 1975, D. Marguerite Assiba est mariée à BRYME Kabirou. Marguerite Assiba est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Marguerite Assiba est installée depuis une dizaine d’années à Gbégamey un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Marguerite Assiba vend des serrures et de plastiques. D. Marguerite Assiba est à son troisième crédit et s’est toujours montrée crédible. Actuellement D. Marguerite Assiba éprouve de difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits. C'est la raison pour laquelle D. Marguerite Assiba sollicite un prêt afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d’élargir son champ d’activité.    

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born on July 6, 1975, Marguerite Assiba D. is married to Kabirou Bryme. Marguerite Assiba has three children who all attend school. Marguerite Assiba has been living for roughly 10 years in Gbégamey, a densely populated neighbourhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Marguerite Assiba sells locks and plastics. This is her third loan and she has always shown herself to be trustworthy. Right now Marguerite Assiba is having difficulties acquiring her products, which is why she is asking for a loan. This loan will allow her to satisfy her customers' demands and expand her own business reach. The word "Alidé" in Fon, the native language of Benin, means "there is always a way for the poorest". Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria; its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita is $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to very vulnerable persons and the organisation is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance program to beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 crates of locks and 5 dozen of each category of plastics

loans.name: Arim

texts.fr: Mme Arim B. est née en 1954 à Pya. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle manque de moyens financiers pour bien mener son commerce de vente de pâte de maïs appelée "kon". Elle sollicite donc un financement pour stocker du maïs et tous les ingrédients entrant dans la préparation de cette nourriture. Ainsi elle pourra régulièrement veiller au mieux être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arim B. was born in 1954 in Pya. A married mother of five children, she lacks the financial means to run her business of selling corn meal called “kon.” She is therefore seeking a loan to stock up on corn and all the ingredients necessary for the preparation of this food. She will thus be able to regularly watch over the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on corn and other ingredients

loans.name: Jesus Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
Es un Banco D. Emprendimiento compuesto D. 18 personas, el cual pertenece a la Localidad del Km.:13 Urbanización arco iris la mayoría D. los clientes se dedican a la venta D. chancho, frutas, servicio D. peluquería, chofer y venta D. comidas, ropa, pan, otros.
Lidia Irene C. Mamami.- es la líder del banco, vive en el Km.13 en la urbanización arco iris, cuenta con casa propia, su actividad es venta D. comida, su esposo se desempeña como chofer en la Ciudad D. Santa Cruz.
Hernán L. H..- es el tesorero del banco D. emprendimiento, se desempeña como chofer en la línea D. micros No 35, D. la Ciudad D. Santa Cruz, su esposa se dedica a la venta D. pan, en la urbanización arco iris, tienen 2 hijos, viven en vivienda alquilada. Su deseo es llegar a obtener su propia herramienta D. trabajo, tener una vejez digna.
Ingrid V. A..- Vive en la urbanización arco iris, se dedica a la peluquería, su esposo se desempeña chofer en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, con el cual tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa propia, en el banco D. emprendiendo se desempeña como secretaria, su deseo es llegar a tener un centro D. belleza en la urbanización arco iris, para poder ayudar a su esposo en la educación superior D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
This village bank is maD. up of 18 members of the Km. 13 Arco Iris Neighborhood. The majority of the members sell pork, fruit, proviD. hair or taxi service, sell food, clothing, bread and more. Lidia Irene C. Mamami is the leader of the bank, lives in the Km. 13 Arco Iris Neighborhood, has her own home, and she sells food. Her husband works as a driver in Santa Cruz city. Hernán L. H. is treasurer of the bank and works as a micro bus driver on line #35 in Santa Cruz city. His wife sells bread in the Arco Iris Neighborhood. They have 2 children and live in a rented home. His wish is to obtain his own tool business and have a dignified old age. Ingrid V. A. lives in the Km. 13 Arco Iris Neighborhood and is a hair stylist. Her husband works as a driver in Santa Cruz city. They have 2 children, live in their own home, and she is the bank’s secretary. Her wish is to have a beauty store in the lives in the Arco Iris Neighborhood in order to be able to help her husband with the higher education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy needed items for their respective businesses

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel S. is married and has 4 dependents; his wife is a seamstress.  He has received schooling through the junior high level. Since 1990, Samuel has sold TV motherboards and other electrical parts at Kisi near Elmina.  Samuel uses his income to pay his family's rent and utility bills, his children's school fees, and other financial expenses. Samuel will use the loan to meet customers' growing demand by increasing the inventory of TV motherboards and other electrical parts for sale in his shop. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to continue building the house he started for his family.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of TV motherboards and other electrical parts available for sale in his shop.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Mme Adjoa A. est née en 1974 à Vogan avec quatre (04) personnes en charge dont son mari licencié abusivement. Elle est donc seule à faire face aux charges du ménage avec son commerce de vente de riz blanc préparé. Afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et avoir un rendement meilleur, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker  du riz, faire un apâtame et mieux s'équiper. Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle subviendra mieux aux charges de sa famille et aura contribué à soulager leur peine.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjoa A. was born in 1974 in Vogan and has four people to take care of, including her husband who was improperly fired. She thus is the sole caretaker of her family with her business of selling cooked white rice. In order to increase her profits and increase her productivity, she seeks a loan to stock up on rice, build a hut and get better equipment. With the profits, she will better meet the needs of her family and help relieve some of their suffering.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier, de 54 años es padre de 4 hijos, vive junto a su esposa quien le da la mano en todo lo posible. La casa que habitan es propia, y es el resultado de su trabajo. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a vender comida por las noches en la fachada de su casa, Javier elabora toda clase de platillos, según nota la demanda de sus clientes y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien. Para su negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y sus hijos y eso le alegra mucho, le agrada su trabajo porque se siente bien y es una forma de relajarse porque durante el día trabaja en una institución pública desde hace 20 años, y todos los días regresa muy cansado, pero la venta de comida lo anima, ya que sus comensales lo entretienen con sus conversaciones y carisma particular. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal debido a que fue una oportunidad de salir adelante y continúa integrado porque todos son muy unidos y coordinados. El dinero que está solicitando en esta oportunidad lo invertirá en su negocio comprando víveres e ingredientes para preparar sus comidas, además de sillas, mesas, y otros utensilios necesarios.
texts.en:
Señor Javier is 54 and the father of 4 children. He lives with his wife who helps him in every way possible. The house they live in is their own, as a result of his hard work. For 4 years, he has sold food at night in front of his home. Javier makes all kinds of dishes, according to the demand of his customers. This business has gone very well for him. He has the support of his wife and children, and this makes him very happy. He likes his job because he feels good doing it, and it's a way to relax because during the day he works at a public institution, which he has done for 20 years. Every day he returns home very tired, but selling food livens him up since his dinner companions entertain him with their conversations and individual charisma. This is his seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he likes to work with his communal bank because it was an opportunity to get ahead. He continues as a member because they are all very united and coordinated. The money he is requesting will be invested in his business. He will buy supplies to prepare his food as well as tables, chairs, and other necessary utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make his food

loans.name: Lely

texts.es: La señora Lely tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar, viven todos juntos con su esposo quien siempre la apoya en la realización de sus objetivos. Gracias a su trabajo la casa que habitan es propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la costura, a razón de haber estudiado este oficio y de ser una de las mejores de su localidad. Lely confecciona ropa para niños y adultos en todos los modelos y gustos, sus trabajos los realiza sola y dentro de su casa, y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar lo mejor de ella en cada prenda, para que sus clientes estén satisfechos y regresen siempre, además de recomendarla a otros por el buen trabajo que realiza. En el futuro Lely quiere tener una tienda de ropa elaborada por ella misma. Son cerca de 4 años los que viene trabajando con MFP, este es su 7mo préstamos, y le gusta participar con su grupo porque existe mucha comunicación entre ellos, y para ella eso es muy importante para un buen trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero que solicita en esta ocasión comprará materiales de costura; telas, hilos, broches, etc., haciendo un gasto de 1500 soles; lo restante lo invertirá en el negocio de su esposo quien es técnico dental.
texts.en:
Señora Lely is 47. She is the mother of three school-aged children. All of them live together along with her husband, who always supports her in reaching her goals. Thanks to her hard work, the house that they live in is their own. For five years, she has made a living through sewing. She studied this trade, and she is one of the best seamstresses in her area. Lely makes clothing for children and adults in all designs and styles. She does her work alone inside her house. It has gone very well for her. What she likes about her job is doing her best on each article of clothing so her customers will be satisfied and always return and recommend her to others because of the good job that she does. In the future, Lely wants to have a clothing store with clothing made by her. She has worked with Microfinanzas Prisma for close to four years. This is her seventh loan, and she likes to participate in this group because there is a lot of communication among the members. For her, it is very important to work as a team. With the money she is requesting, she will buy sewing materials: fabric, thread, fasteners, etc. She will spend 1500 soles on this. The rest she will invest in the business of her husband, who is a dental technician.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Kadévi

texts.fr: Mr Kadévi A. est né en 1958, il est marié avec dix (10) enfants en charge. Menuisier de formation, il manque de fond de base pour bien démarrer ses activités. Très courageux, il est déterminé à s'exprimer par son travail. Il sollicite ainsi un financement pour ouvrir un atelier, s'équiper en outils de travail et acheter des planches. Des fruits de son travail, il pourra désormais faire face aux problèmes de son ménage et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Kadévi A. was born in 1958 and is married with ten children. A carpenter by trade, he is lacking some of the basic necessities required to start up his business. A very brave man, he is determined to express himself through his work. He is therefore asking for a loan to open a workshop, to kit himself out with the tools of the trade and to buy some planks of wood. In the future, the fruits of his labour will allow him to confront the problems of running a home and ensure his childrens’ education.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a carpentry workshop, buy tools and planks of wood

loans.name: Taïbatou

texts.fr:
D. Taïbatou est née vers 1947 et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. D. Taïbatou réside  depuis une vingtaine d’année au quartier Gbégamey, un quartier populaire de Cotonou Capitale économique du Bénin. D. Taïbatou exerce son activité de vente de gari(farine de manioc) et de maïs dans ce même quartier où elle habite. D. Taïbatou s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays plus précisément dans les marchés locaux.  D. Taïbatou sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé pour satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. D. Taïbatou a déjà deux crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé avec ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Taïbatou D. was born around 1947 and is the mother of two children who attended school. Taïbatou has been living for about 20 years in the neighbourhood of Gbégamey, a densely populated area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Taïbatou sells gari (cassava flour) and corn in the same neighbourhood she lives in. Taïbatou gets her goods from the interior of the country, specifically in local markets. Taïbatou is asking Alidé for a loan in order to meet the ever-increasing demands of her customers. Taïbatou has already had two loans with Alidé which have been repaid. "Alidé" means "there is always a way for the poorest" in Fon, the native language of Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, where the GDP per capita is $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest rate loans to the very vulnerable and the organisation is part of a group which will soon launch a micro-health insurance programme to the beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of corn and of gari (cassava flour)

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 21 años, vive con su pareja, su hermana y su prima, personas que la apoyan mucho en su negocio. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año y cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y prima, con quienes atienden la bodega durante todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que conoce a muchas personas y tiene amenas conversaciones, además le es rentable porque en el lugar donde está ubicada es el único negocio de abarrotes que hay, por lo que sus productos se venden a diario. Su anhelo a futuro es tener un minimarket. Es la segunda vez que Luz tiene un préstamo con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos son responsables y existe mucho diálogo entre ellos, además que aprende mucho de su asesor de crédito. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes; sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, entre otras cosas de consumo constante.
texts.en:
Luz is 21 years old and lives with her partner, her sister and her cousin, all of whom support her a lot with her business. She sells groceries and other household necessities in a part of her house which she remodeled for her business. It's been a year since she was able to achieve this, and she has the assistance of her sister and cousin who also help look after the store during the day. What she likes about her business is that she gets to know many people and have pleasant conversations with them. Moreover, the business is profitable because it is the only grocery store located in the area and as a result they are selling their products every day. Her hope for the future is to have a mini-mart. This is the second time that Luz has taken a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She likes working with her communal bank because everyone is so responsible and they have a lot of dialog among themselves. And she has also learned a lot from her credit advisor. The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of groceries such as sacks of rice, sugar and boxes of milk, among other such constantly consumed items.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Joseph Y

texts.en: Joseph Y A. sells plastic products, which he makes himself, at Kisi near Elmina. Joseph Y, who has a junior high school education, is a single parent and has 4 dependents. Joseph Y has been selling plastics since 2005. He is responsible for paying his family's rent and utility bills, his children's school fees, and other financial expenses. His loan will be used to meet growing customer demand by increasing the inventory of plastic products he makes and sells. He hopes to reinvest the new profits from his business into expanding his trade and also to save toward building a house so he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: As additional capital so he can make and sell more plastic products.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Mme Akou S. est née le 31/12/1944 à  Dalavé. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec cinq (05) autres personnes en charge, elle a toujours fait preuve de bravoure et de bonne gestion. Son mari menuisier n'arrive plus à couvrir toutes les charges du ménage. C'est avec la vente de shampoing, basam et démêlants que Mme S. assiste son mari dans les charges du ménage. Afin de préserver cette tranquillité, elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir son étalage. De la vente de ses produits, elle tirera profit et veillera à la bonne marche de la famille.
texts.en:
Akou S. was born on December 31, 1944 in Dalavé. Married and the mother of five children and with five other dependents, she has proven time and again her spirit and her good management. Her husband, a carpenter, is no longer able to pay for all the household expenses. Mrs. S. helps her husband pay the family's expenses by selling balsam shampoo and conditioner. In order to maintain her peace of mind, she is asking for a loan to expand her display area. From the sale of her products she will make a profit and ensure all goes well with her family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy balsam shampoo and conditioner for retail

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en su casa propia, resultado de su trabajo. Su dedicación por la costura la aprendió de su madre, ahora Maria es una gran costurera, ya que para ella no existe prenda que no pueda confeccionar. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 18 años en forma constante en su casa, que es su taller. Lo que le gusta de su labor es relacionarse con varias personas quienes son sus clientes, además le es muy rentable porque ella misma lleva a vender la ropa que confecciona por los diferentes lugares de su localidad, también cuenta con una fiel clientela quienes confían en su buen trabajo y la buscan constantemente, y esta temporada ha tenido gran demanda por el inicio de las clases y para la elaboración de uniformes para los estudiantes. Más adelante a Maria le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales textiles, así podrá confeccionar más ropa que pueda llevar a vender.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 and lives with her husband and two children in her own house, which she worked to buy. She sews for a living, which she learned from her mother, and now she is a great seamstress, and there isn't a garment she can't make. She's been doing this continuously for 18 years in her house, which she uses as her shop. What she likes about her work is that she gets to interact with lots of different clients. It's also profitable because she can sell the clothes she makes to different places in her area. In addition, she has loyal clientele who trust her good work and seek her out all the time, and demand has been high because the school year is starting and she needs to make uniforms for the students. In the future Maria would like to have a clothing store. This will be her eighth loan with MFP. She plans to use the money to buy textiles so she can make more clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter N. sells television sets, fridges, DVD players and other items at Comender Junction near Elmina. Peter has received senior high education. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a trader. Peter has been selling television sets, fridges, DVD players, etc., since 1998. He is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills, children's school fees, and other financial expenses. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him to increase his sales to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest in the expansion of his trade and also to save towards a house that he wants to put up so that he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase sales to meet the increase in demand

loans.name: María

texts.es: La señora María tiene 61 años de edad, es soltera, vive con su madre, su hija, su yerno y su nieto. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una línea cosmética por catálogo muy reconocida. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es buscar clientes y la técnica para vender sus productos es dar una muy buena atención a las personas interesadas, eso es lo primordial nos dice. Este negocio le es rentable porque con el paso de los años se ha ganado una gran gama de clientes y sobre todo trabaja a pedidos, por lo que le va muy bien. Posteriormente le gustará poner una tienda de ropa. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, aun no sabe a fondo de cómo es el trabajo de un banco comunal, pero tiene muy buenas expectativas al respecto, además ha notado en sus compañeros responsabilidad. María invertirá la cantidad que requiere en la compra de productos de belleza, porque como vendedora le dejan a un precio especial, y no quiere desaprovechar esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old, single, and lives with her mother, daughter, son-in-law, and grandson. For the past 10 years she has made her living selling beauty products from a well-known line of catalog cosmetics. She is a very active woman who dreams of succeeding. What she likes about her work is looking for customers, and her technique for selling her products is to provide good customer service to women who are interested in buying from her—that is crucial, according to María. This business is profitable for María because she has developed a large customer base over the years, and above all, because she takes custom orders. She eventually wants to set up a clothing store. This is the first time María has requested a loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she does not yet really know how a communal bank works. She does, however, have high expectations for it, since she has noticed that the other members of her bank are responsible. María will invest the amount she needs in purchasing beauty products, since a saleswoman is giving her a special price, and María does not want to miss out on this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her volume of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise poultry

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi M. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Esi sells cookies and soft drinks; she has also been a baker at Kisi near Elmina since 2000. Her husband is a Taxi driver. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in paying the housekeeping expenses. Esi will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the production and sale of cookies by buying more ingredients (like flour and margarine) to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards a house she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: For bakery supplies

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two sons – one is 20, the other one is only 3. Her family lives in Stryi. Galina sells food items in the local food market and offers commercial trade training to individuals and groups. Some of her customer services include: home delivery, wholesale discounts, and business training. Galina handles this enterprise with the help of her family: her husband and a brother who works in Lvov – a big city in Western Ukraine. They have been running this business for 19 years. Currently, Galina has 25,000 Grivnas in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 35,000 Grivnas. 

Galina is requesting a loan of 12,800 Grivnas to purchase different kinds of cereal and other grocery items for retail sale. She is hoping to open a wholesaling business in the future and believes this current step in consistent expansion lays a firm foundation for implementing her dream. Galina has a toddler to care for and has just moved to a new place with her family – but this busy life matches her natural enthusiasm and energy. Galina is planning to use a portion of the generated profit to pay her son’s college fees.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Dassigan

texts.fr: Mme Mme Dassigan A. est née en 1959 à Lomé, avec huit (08) personnes en charge. Après le décès de son mari, elle est la seule face aux charges du ménage. Très dévoué et entreprenante, elle initia la culture des champignons. C'est un produit alimentaire utilisé dans l'art culinaire tout comme le poisson ou la viande dans la préparation des sauces. Actuellement, la demande dépasse l'offre  mais elle n'a les moyens suffisants pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour acheter les outils de travail et tous les éléments qui entrent dans cette culture. Les bénéfices tirés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions d'existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Dassigan A. was born in 1959 in Lomé and has eight people to support. After the death of her husband, she is alone in coping with household expenses. A very devoted and enterprising woman, she began growing mushrooms. This a food used in the culinary arts just like fish or meat is when making sauces. Currently, the demand exceeds the supply, but she lacks the means for responding to the requirements of her customers. This is why she's requesting financing for buying work tools and all the elements associated with this kind of farming. The profits derived will enable her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow and sell mushrooms

loans.name: Fatima Adoké

texts.fr:
F. Fatima Adoké est mariée à SOTON Robert et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. F. Fatima Adoké est née vers 1966 et réside depuis 25 ans au quartier Fidjrossè de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. F. Fatima Adoké vend des tissus, chaussures, sacs, mèches, produits de beauté et tenues. F. Fatima Adoké s’approvisionne au marché international du Bénin et à Lomé Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier du Bénin. Dans le souci de répondre au mieux à la demande de ses clients, F. Fatima Adoké sollicite son troisième prêt à ALIDé.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
F. Fatima Adoké is married to SOTON Robert and is the mother of two children, who are both in school. She was born around 1966 and for 25 years has been residing in the Fidjrossè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She sells fabrics, shoes, bags, hair extensions, beauty products, and clothing. Fatima supplies herself at the international market of Bénin and in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Bénin. Concerned about improving her response to the demands of her customers, she's requesting her third loan with ALIDÉ.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, shoes, bags, and clothing for children

loans.name: Moraima

texts.es: La señora Moraima tiene 46 años D. edad, es madre soltera y vive con su única hija quien la apoya mucho. A causa D. su separación conyugal, y para sostener las necesidades D. su hija, emprendió el negocio D. la venta D. comida, y hasta el momento todo le ha ido muy bien. Una D. las causas D. su éxito es que no tiene que alquilar ningún local, porque ha convertido su casa en una pensión, donD. brinda el menú diario a un grupo D. trabajadores D. una línea aérea, ya que su casa se encuentra muy cerca al aeropuerto. Y para incrementar sus ingresos, por las noches venD. salchipollos (platillo a base D. pollo con papas fritas). Con este negocio lleva un periodo D. 10 años y le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se siente útil y sobre todo se relaciona constantemente con muchas personas. En el futuro desea tener un restaurante muy bien implementado donD. pueda acoger a muchos comensales. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, hace dos años que conoció D. esta institución y D. la metodología D. los bancos comunales, y en su experiencia le gusta el trabajo con su grupo porque son activos y demuestran compañerismo unos con otros. Invertirá el dinero que está solicitando en la compra D. utensilios D. cocina como; ollas, platos, tazas, etc., haciendo un gasto D. 800 soles, el resto lo invertirá en mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
Moraima is 46 years old, a single mother, and lives with her only daughter who supports her a lot. Due to her marital separation and in order to support the needs of her daughter, she launched a business selling food, and it has been going well so far. One of the reasons for her success is that she does not need to rent a location because she has converted her house into a pension, where she offers a daily menu to a group of airline workers since her house is close to the airport. To add to her income, she sells salchipollos (a dish with chicken and fries) at night. She has had this business for 10 years and has enjoyed it a lot because she feels useful and above all, she constantly interacts with many people. In the future, she hopes to have a very nice restaurant where she can welcome many dinner guests. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP and it has been two years since she found out about the institution and of the communal bank methodology. In her experience she likes to work with the group because they are active and demonstrate friendship with one another. She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of kitchen utensils such as pots, plates, cups, etc. that cost 800 soles. The rest she will invest in tables and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of kitchen utensils, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Growing cassava and corn

loans.name: Diana Silvia

texts.es: La señora Diana Silvia T. ha pagado dos préstamos con FVP los cuales pago puntualmente. Desea nuevamente el apoyo para la colocación del vitropiso en un cuarto de su vivienda. Tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus papas que son personas ya grandes de edad. Planea pagar este préstamo con los ingresos de su empleo como auxiliar administrativo de una línea de trasportes.
texts.en:
Señora Diana Silvia T. has punctually paid back two loans with FVP. She hopes to receive their support again to put tile in a room of her home. She is responsible for caring for her parents, who are elderly. She plans to pay for this loan with the income from her job as an administrative assistant for a transportation company.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To tile a room of her home

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es: Noemí es una madre soltera, tiene 67 años y actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos quienes ya son profesionales y de familia. Todos viven en su casa, la cual es propia, que pudo ir construyendo poco a poco con el esfuerzo de toda su vida. Su actividad diaria es dar una buena atención a sus clientes, porque ella vende frutas regionales y gaseosas, en las instalaciones de su casa desde hace 10 años, durante todo el día, Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es relacionarse con muchas personas y tener un trato directo con sus clientes, que es lo más importante, porque según el trato que ella les brinde, regresarán o no a comprarle, por eso Noemí esta siempre dispuesta a darle una gran sonrisa a toda persona que se acerca para comprar sus frutas o bebidas. Y como ese fue su pensar durante muchos años, cuenta con una gran gama de clientes, quienes no dejan de comprarle ni un día, debido a su buena atención, y así sea una pequeña fruta, le compra a diario. Adicionalmente, ofrece productos de belleza por catálogo y también le va bien. En adelante, Noemí quiere refaccionar el espacio donde tiene su negocio para que se vea más acogedor a sus clientes. El dinero que solicita es para su negocio de venta de frutas regionales y bebidas, y lo restante lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Noemí is a single mother, is 67 years old and she currently lives with her two sons who are already professionals with families. All of them live in her house, which she built herself, bit by bit, as her entire life’s effort. Her daily activity is to provide a good service to her customers, because she has been selling regional fruits and soft drinks at her house all day long for ten years. What she likes about her job is interacting with so many people and dealing directly with her customers, which is very important because, based on the treatment she gives them, they will or will not return to buy things. That is why Noemí is willing to give a big smile to everyone who comes to buy her fruit and drinks. And this is why she thinks that for so many years she has had a wide range of customers, who continue to buy a little fruit or a newspaper from her every day, thanks to the good treatment. Additionally she offers beauty products from a catalog and this also does well. In the future, Noemí wants to repair the area where she has her business so that it is more welcoming to her customers. The money that she is asking for is for her regional fruit and drinks business, and the rest will be invested in the purchase of beauty products to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon at Kisi near Elmina. Betty has received junior high education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a Taxi driver. Betty has been a hairdresser since 2003 and is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of different hair products to meet the demands of her customers who come to the salon. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different hair products to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Marfa

texts.en:
Marfa is married with a grown son. She sells retail items in the central market of Novomoskovsk, eastern Ukraine. Marfa has been in this business for 15 years. Currently, her net profit is over 4,000 Grivnas a month.

Marfa’s business is constantly growing. One of the advantages she has in the competitive market is affordable prices and regular inventory additions. Her little vending kiosk is very popular in the marketplace where she works. Marfa realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business as loans allow her to increase her turnover and expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 6,200 Grivnas. One of Marfa’s further plans is to continue expanding her trade and eventually generate enough profit to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise goats

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. José es viviente de la comunidad de la planchada el cual vive hace aproximadamente unos quince años por esta zona.
Su actividad principal es la agricultura actualmente se encuentra en plena siembra de papa, además de esto siembra también maíz, maní y poroto de acuerdo a la época de siembra, también cuenta con 15 cabezas de ganado vacuno.
Su esposa la Sra. Isabel Rojas Toledo le ayuda en los quehaceres de la casa con la cual tienen tres hijos, los cuales estan en edad escolar, pero que colaboran en la agricultura como en el cuidado del ganado.
texts.en:
Mr. José C. S. has been living in the La Planchada community for the last 15 years. His main economic activity is agriculture and he is currently in the middle of potato planting season. In addition to potatoes he plants corn, peanuts and kidney beans depending on the season. He also has 15 head of cattle. His wife, Mrs. Isabel Rojas Teledo helps with household chores and their three school-age children, who help with the farming and cattle

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant Potatoes

loans.name: Urpicha Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal denominado “URPICHA”; está ubicado a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, en la provincia de Quispicanchis en el distrito de Ocongate; considerado como uno de los distritos más altos de la provincia  de Cusco; dentro de su extensión se encuentra altitudes que oxidan entre los 3,300 y más de 6,000 m.s.n.m. Sus características corresponden a las del grado de “extrema pobreza”, de clima desfavorable para las actividades agrícolas.

Los socios de este banco, tienen entre sus actividades del hogar y sus otros trabajos eventuales, la crianza de ganados vacunos y la elaboración de quesos y quesillos, yogurt natural y la crianza de animales menores como (cuyes y aves de corral), los pocos socios que se dedican a la agricultura, sólo puede ser la siembra de cebada para consumo de sus animales.

Estoy socios están sumamente agradecidos con el préstamo que será otorgado y expresan su compromiso de devolución del préstamo en el tiempo programado, ya que ellos están muy concientes de que la banca financiera para estas comunidades no es accesible.
texts.en:
The village bank “URPICHA”; is located three hours form the city of Cusco in the province of Quispicanchis in the district of Ocongate; considered one the highest districts in the province of Cusco; where there are heights of between 3,300 and more than 6,000 meters. The area is characterized by extreme poverty; with a climate ill-suited to agricultural activities Bank members, in addition to taking care of their homes and any other work they can get, raise cattle and produce cheese and natural yogurt. They also raise smaller animas. The few members who farm can only grow barely for animal consumption. The members are very grateful for the loan that will be granted and give their promise to repay the loan in the time required. They are very aware that they have no access to commercial banks in their region.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and raise cattle and buy animal fodder

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa sells jeans in the central market of Novomoskovsk. She offers a wide variety of assorted merchandise and regularly re-stocks it which helps her keep a loyal clientele and attract new customers. Larisa’s inventory is always good quality, durable and affordable to an average buyer. Larisa has been in this trade for 12 years. Presently, her income amounts to 4,000 Grivnas a month.

Larisa is hoping to keep her business sustainable and support her family. She enjoys working with this type of inventory. She has always been very responsible with her liabilities and paid all her loans back promptly. This time Larisa is requesting a loan of 16,400 Grivnas to purchase additional clothing for her vending location. She is hoping to repay it in 3 months.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is single and has no child. She has received schooling through junior high. Sarah sells fabric; she is a seamstress who specializes in sewing ladies’ wear at Kisi near Elmina, which she has done since 2005. Sarah uses her income for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more and greater variety of fabrics and other sewing materials for her sewing work. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other sewing materials

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 58 años, es natural de Iquitos (ciudad de la selva peruana) vive con su pareja, quien es mecánico y sus hijos Goldi de 39 y Henry de 37 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la costura, ya que le gusta mucho elaborar prendas con su máquina de coser y a cada prenda le pone todo su ingenio y creatividad; por su vecindario son muy solicitados sus servicios, debido a que es muy buena en su trabajo, obteniendo buenas ganancias para su hogar. Pero este negocio tiene demanda esporádicamente, e Hilda quiere una actividad que le genere ganancias diarias, es así que ha pensado invertir en un restaurante donde se prepare gran variedad de platillos. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado encontrar el lugar apropiado para su nuevo negocio, lo alquilará y comprará lo necesario para echarlo a andar. Hilda tiene puestas muchas esperanzas en esta actividad, pues confía en su buena sazón e instinto para los negocios, pero también seguirá trabajando en lo que más le gusta, que es la confección de prendas. Este es su préstamo número 14 con MFP, actualmente viene integrando un grupo con dos de sus amigas, quienes trabajan muy bien juntas, siendo muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará muebles y utensilios para implementar su restaurante, espera que en el futuro le sea muy próspero.
texts.en:
Hilda is 58 years old, is from Iquitos (a city in the Peruvian jungle), and lives with her partner who is a mechanic and her sons Goldi, 39, and Henry, 37 in a home she owns. Since she was 25 years old she has been working in sewing. She likes very much to make clothing with her sewing machine and she puts all her ingenuity and creativity into each garment. Around her neighborhood her services are in high demand, because she is very good at her work, and obtains good earnings for her household. But this business has sporadic demand, and Hilda would like an occupation that would generate daily earnings, and this is why she had the idea to invest in a restaurant which would offer a large number of dishes. Thanks to her efforts, she managed to find an appropriate location for her new business and to rent and buy that which is necessary for getting started. Hilda has placed great hope in this enterprise, trusting in her good timing and business instincts, but also continuing working on that which she likes the most, which is making clothing. This is her 14th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is currently forming a group with two of her friends who work well together, to be punctual in their payments. With the money she is asking for she will buy furniture and utensils for starting her restaurant. She is hoping for a very prosperous future.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in a new food sales business

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El Sr. Justo C. tiene 7 años con su negocio venta de tacos, entre él y su esposa la señora Antonia Zarate son los que atiende el negocio.
Están solicitando un préstamo para poder reparar una camioneta y acondicionarla para vender tacos en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. 
Planean pagar este crédito con las ganancias de su nuevo puesto de tacos ya que su esposa se encargara de atenderlo y el estará atendiendo el otro puesto. La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Antonia ya que don Justo se encontraba surtiendo la mercancía para la venta de los tacos.
texts.en:
Mr. Justo C. has had his taco selling business for 7 years. He runs the business with his wife, Mrs. Antonia Zarate. They are asking for a loan to be able to fix and air condition a truck. They want to sell tacos in different parts of Nuevo Laredo (city). They plan to pay for the loan with the earnings from their new taco stand, which his wife will run. He will be seeing to the other stand. The person in the photo is Antonia. Justo was stocking up on goods for taco sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs for taco sales

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
El Sr. Wilber C. es nacido en la provincia de Manuel Maria Caballero de la cuidad de Santa Cruz, actualmente vive en la planchada localidad del Torno, hace aproximadamente unos quince años que vive en el lugar.Esta casado la esposa e hijos le colaboran en las tareas culturales durante todo el año. 
El se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, además también se dedica a la ganadería cuenta con 15 cabezas de ganado vacuno.
Quiere seguir aumentando capital en la ganadería.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilber C. was born in the province of Manuel Maria Caballero in the City of Santa Cruz and now lives in the La Planchada area of Del Torn where he has been for the past 15 years. He is married and his wife and children help with the work throughout the year. He works in agriculture and raises livestock and has 15 head of cattle. He wants to add to his livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting Kidney Beans

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Rebecca sells footwear and soap at Kisi near Elmina, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a taxi driver. Rebecca uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses.

Rebecca will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase her sales of footwear and soap to meet the increase in demand of her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to save toward a house she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase sales of footwear and soap

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos; Esteban de 11 y Katherin de 10 años. Actualmente espera otro bebé y está muy feliz por ello, ella y su familia viven en su casa propia. Siempre ha sido emprendedora para realizar todo tipo de negocio, pero ya que sus hijos aún estan pequeños y viene otro en camino, ha optado desde hace 3 meses por trabajar en la venta de productos de belleza desde su casa, gracias a su buen trato y su capacidad de persuasión ha obtenido una gran cantidad de clientela en su vecindario. Es así que muchas vecinas y amigas suyas vienen a solicitar los productos que ofrece por catálogo. Desde hace 10 años atrás tenía un puesto en el mercado de venta de jugos, pero por los cuidados que debe tener en el embarazo lo dejó y se dedicó netamente a la venta de productos de belleza, pero cuando su bebé nazca y ella se encuentre mejor poder reiniciar su negocio de venta de jugos pero en un local mucho más grande y estable para generar mayores ingresos a su hogar. Juana tiene varios años con MFP, pero este es su primer préstamo en un grupo más pequeño conformado por ella y con dos amigas, con las cuales se lleva muy bien y son muy puntuales en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, y quiere aumentar las ventas para generarse mayores ingresos, ya que su bebé está pronto en llegar.
texts.en:
Juana is 36 years old, married and has two children, Esteban, 11 and Katherin, 10. She is currently expecting a new baby and is very happy about it. She and her family live in their own house. She has always been entrepreneurial and in many types of businesses, but since her children are still young with another on the way, she decided 3 months ago to work selling beauty products from her house and thanks to her good customer care and persuasion abilities she has managed to obtain a large client base in her neighborhood. Many neighbors and friends of hers come to request the products that she offers via catalog. Ten years ago she had a booth in market selling juices, but due to her pregnancies she stopped and dedicated herself solely to selling beauty product, but when this baby is born and she finds herself better able she wants to restart the juice business but in a larger and more stable locale to generate higher income for her household. Juana has been with MFP for several years, but this is her first loan in a smaller group consisting of herself and two other friends, with whom she gets along really well and are puncual in their payments. With the requested loan she will buy a larger quantity of beauty products and would like to increase her sales to generate more income, since her baby will be arriving soon.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise of beauty products

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mme Adjo L. est née en 1969 à Kpalimé. Elle est mariée avec six (06) personnes en charge. Très dévoué et dynamique, elle initia la culture du champignon. C'est un produit alimentaire naturel utilisé dans l'art culinaire pour substituer au poisson ou à la viande dans la préparation des sauces. Actuellement, la demande dépasse l'offre  mais elle n'a les moyens suffisants pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour acheter les outils de travail et tous les éléments qui entrent dans cette culture. Les bénéfices tirés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions d'existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo L. was born in 1969 in Kpalimé. She is married and has six people to look after. She is very dedicated and energetic, and has started growing mushrooms. This is a natural food product used in cooking as a substitute for fish or meat when preparing sauces. Demand now exceeds supply, but she does not have the means to meet customer requirements. This is why she is requesting financing so that she can buy the tools of her trade and all the elements involved in mushroom growing. The profit will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing and selling mushrooms

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 42 años, vive con su pareja quien es obrero. Tienen 3 hijas; Hilda de 21, Margaret de 16 y Pilar de 9 años, que es con la única con la que viven. Se dedica a la atención de la bodega que puso hace 2 años, gracias a su gran esfuerzo, ya que no fue nada fácil, tuvo que sacrificar muchas comodidades para lograrlo, felizmente el negocio le ha resultado rentable, debido a que por la zona en la que vive son muy escasas las tiendas, siendo su negocio muy concurrido. A ella le gusta su trabajo porque puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y ser independiente, pero abastecer su tienda se le hace difícil, ya que el mercado queda lejos de su hogar y el acceso a su casa es muy limitado, aún así Martha le pone todas las ganas, y sus hijas son su principal fuente de apoyo especialmente la última, que con su alegría y carisma atrae gran cantidad de clientes apoyándola mucho en la atención de la clientela. Con todo el esfuerzo que le pone a su trabajo espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y le resulte mucho más rentable. Martha ha tenido varios préstamos con MFP y este es su primer préstamo individual, y promete ser tan puntual como lo fue con su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar más mercadería para abastecer su tienda, comprando útiles escolares, que son muy cotizados en este periodo escolar.
texts.en:
Martha is 42 years old, and she lives with her partner who is a workman. They have 3 daughters; Hilda is 21, Margaret is 16, and Pilar is 9. Pilar is the only daughter that lives with her parents. It was not easy, and it took great effort, but two years ago Martha started a store. She had to sacrifice many comforts to do this, but happily the business has been profitable. Her store is popular because stores are scarce in the area where she lives. She likes her work because she can take care of her household expenses and be independent. But it is hard for her to keep the store stocked. The market is far from her home, and access to her house is very limited. Even so, Martha puts forth all of her will and effort. Her daughters are the principal source of support. Her youngest is especially supportive. With her joy and charisma she attracts and helps lots of customers. With all of the effort that she puts into her business Martha hopes that her business will grow and become more profitable. Martha has had several loans with MFP. This is her first individual loan. She promises to make her payments on time just as she has done with her community bank. With the loan she will buy merchandise to stock her store. She will buy school supplies. They are much in demand in this part of the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilliam Mayela

texts.es: Doña Liliam  tiene 42 años de edad con un hijo de 11 años que estudia la primaria, reside en el barrio 380 en ciudad de Managua, su negocio es un cafetín que administra desde hace veinte años, el cual inicio vendiendo ropa, en el cafetín vende comida, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas y variedad de productos que este al alcance de sus clientes. Sus planes es poder dar estudio a su hijo  para que sea un joven de bien. Con este crédito quiere comprar productos variados como granos básicos, comida chatarra, jugos y otros para ofertar siempre a sus clientes. Su anhelo es importar mercadería de ropa y zapatos para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Liliam is 42 years old and has an 11 year old son who is in primary school. She lives in district 380 in the city of Managua. For twenty years she has run a café that sells food, refreshments, soda, candy and a variety of other products to her customers.

Her cafe will now start selling clothing as well. She hopes to be able to give her son an education so that he can become a good boy.

With this loan she would like to buy products such as basic grains, snack food, juices, etc. to offer to her customers. Additionally, her goal is to import merchandise like clothes and shoes to secure even better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kerrie Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and food to sell.

loans.name: Abadatou

texts.fr:
Née vers l'année 1977 et résidant à COTONOU, Capitale économique du BENIN, GBADAMASSI Abadatou est mère de sept enfants tous scolarisés. Abadatou est mariée à DJAKPATA Ali et mène comme activité la vente de de tubercules d'igname, de céréales et de fromages de boeufs.  GBADAMASSI Abadatou sollicite son troisième prêt à ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire la forte demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born around 1977 and a resident of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, Abadatou Gbadamassi is the mother of seven children, all at school. Abadatou is married to Ali Djakpata and runs a business selling yams, cereals and cheese. Abadatou Gbadamassi is requesting her third loan from Alidé to boost her working capital in order to better satisfy the high demand of her customers. In Bénin’s local language, Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest.” Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to the most vulnerable and is part of a group that is about to launch a micro-health insurance program for beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereal, yams and cheese

loans.name: Odiney

texts.es:
Odiney S. G.  es una señora de 56 años de edad que vive en la zona norte de Costa Rica en una pequeña comunidad llamada San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos. San Rafael es una comunidad rural en la cual la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la cría de ganado tanto para carne como para leche. Es una zona de clima caliente, la cual también es muy visitada por turistas que viajan a ver lugares el volcán Arenal, ríos con agua celeste, aguas termales, lagunas, montañas y otras bellezas naturales que se mantienen en la zona.  Cerca de la zona también se produce agricultura, principalmente el cultivo de piña, yuca, naranjas y frijoles.

Doña Odiney es madre de cuatro hijos. Su esposo la abandonó hace algunos años y ella quedó sola con la responsabilidad de cuidar a sus hijos. Por esta razón, desde hace seis años comenzó un negocio de cultivo y venta de orquídeas y otras variedades de plantas. En este negocio le ayuda su hija mayor.

Hace tres años doña Odiney tuvo que ser operada del corazón por lo tanto no puede realizar trabajos que demanden mucho esfuerzo físico, por lo tanto disfruta del cuidado de las orquídeas. Ella dice que verlas crecer, florecer y después poder compartir con otras personas toda esta belleza es algo que le llena de alegría. 

Actualmente doña Odiney está solicitando ¢600.000 para poder ampliar su vivero, obtener nuevas especies de orquídeas, comprar insumos para la reproducción y cuidado de las plantas. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y con esto mejorar su calidad de vida.

Doña Odiney forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Florencia (ECCSAR), una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita. El primero fue por un monto de ¢125.000 y lo canceló de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Odiney S. G. is a 56 year old woman who lives in the northern zone of Costa Rica in a small community called San Rafael de Florencia de San Carlos. San Rafael is a rural community in which the majority of its inhabitants raise cattle, for both beef and milk. The climate is hot, and is also visited by tourists who travel to see the Arenal volcano, rivers with crystal blue water, thermal springs, lakes, mountains, and other beautiful natural places that can be found in this area. Agriculture is also near the zone, primarily the growing of pineapple, yucca, oranges, and beans. Odiney is a mother of 4 children. Her husband abandoned her a few years ago and she was left with sole responsibility to take care of her children. For this reason, 6 years ago she began a business growing and selling orchids and other varieties of plants. Her oldest daughter helps her with the business. Three years ago Odiney had to have an operation on her heart so she couldn’t do the tasks that demanded a lot of physical effort, so she enjoyed taking care of her orchids. She says that seeing the flowers grow, bloom and then to be able to share with others all this beauty is something that fills her with happiness. Today Odiney is asking for 600,000 colones loan in order to expand her home, obtain new species of orchids, buy consumables for the reproduction and care of her plants. With this she hopes to grow her business and in this way improve her quality of life. Odiney is part of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Florencia (ECCSAR)” (Florence Community Credit Business), one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is the second loan that she seeks. The first was for 125,000 colones and it was repaid punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her home, buy consumables, and buy new species of orchids.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar M. hace quinces años que vive por esta zona, el es nacido en Montero de Santa Cruz, ahora vive en este lugar llamado Jardín de las delicias con su esposa la Sra. Lidia Arias Chávez y sus tres hijos, la actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, con la cual mantiene a su familia, generalmente se dedica a la siembra de maní, maíz, y arroz. El cuenta con una parcela en este lugar de 38 hras. De tierra en la que ahora debido a la época quiere sembrar papa. La esposa realiza las labores del hogar ademas colabora con el esposo en las labores agricolas.
texts.en:
Edgar M. was born in Montero de Santa Cruz and for the past fifteen years has lived in a place called Jardín de las Delicias with his wife, Lidia Arias Chavez, and their three children.

He works on his family farm, which cultivates peanuts, corn, and rice. He has a 38 hectare plot of land. According to the season, he now plans to plant potatoes. His wife completes the household chores but also helps her husband with the farm work.

Translated from Spanish by Kerrie Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seeds

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es: Macaria tiene 41 años, vive con su pareja y con sus 4 hijos; Jhon de 16, Ricardo de 11, Gisel de 7 y Emerson de 4. Hace 10 años que tiene una tienda de abarrotes, además de realizar otras actividades como la venta de ropa, elaboración de adornos para fiestas, entre otros. Pero la que ha sido más estable es su bodega, por ello que empezó a vender cerveza, con lo que ha logrado buenos resultados y han ido en aumento sus ingresos económicos. Macaria es una mujer muy activa, ya que siempre está pensando en alguna manera de incursionar en un nuevo negocio. Ahora quiere poner un kiosco de golosinas al frente del colegio de su hijo Ricardo, donde espera generar muy buenas ganancias y en el futuro tener un salón de belleza en su propio hogar ya que ella es cosmetologa de profesión. Las ideas de una nueva oportunidad de negocio siempre están presentes en la cabeza de Macaria, y espera poder realizarlas todas para brindarle mejores oportunidades a su familia. Se encuentra trabajando con MFP hace varios años, empezó en un banco comunal, pero este es su primer préstamo de manera individual y espera ser tan puntual como lo fue en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para su kiosco, ya que por estas fechas las ventas son muy buenas, pues ya comenzaron las clases y los niños consumen golosinas en el recreo y a la salida.
texts.en:
Macaria is 41 years old and lives with her partner and their 4 children; Jhon, 16, Ricardo, 11, Gisel, 7 and Emerson, 4. For 10 years she has had a grocery store aside from other activities such as selling clothing and making party decorations, among others. But the one that has been most stable is her small grocery store. For this reason she began to sell beer, achieving good results and an increase in income.

Macaria is a very active woman who is always thinking about how to start a new business. She now wants to put a candy stand (kiosk) in front of her son Ricardo’s school, where she hopes to generate very good sales. In the future she wants to have a beauty salon in her own home as she is already a cosmetologist by profession. Macaria is always thinking of ideas for new business opportunities and she hopes to be able to realize all of them in order to give her family better opportunities.

She started working with MFP several years ago, beginning with a communal bank, but this is her first individual loan. She hopes to be as prompt as she was in the communal bank. With the money she is requesting she will buy merchandise for her kiosk; sales now are very good as classes have already begun and the children eat candy while at recess and when they leave.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gabriela Del Carmen

texts.es: La Joven Gabriela vende frutas y verduras, granos básicos, gaseosa, golosinas y mucha variedad. Desde hace cinco años, empezó solo vendiendo golosina y leña. Tiene 22 años de edad, habita en el Edgar Mungia, en la ciudad de Managua. Tiene dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad, con este crédito va a comprar variedad de productos para ofertar a sus clientes. Sus planes es poder incrementar su negocio y poder terminar de construir su casa para dar a sus hijos una casa digna. Ya que su casa es humilde es hecha de tabla.
texts.en:
The young Gabriela sells fruits and vegetables, basic grains, sodas, candies and many other items. She began five years ago, selling only sodas and firewood. She is 22 years old and lives in the Edgar Mungia neighborhood of the city of Managua. She has two children who are 4 and 5 years old. With this loan she will buy a variety of products to offer her clients. Her plan is to increase her business and finish building her house so that she can provide her children with a proper home. Her current home is humble and made of planks.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 31 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, el mayor de 11 y sus gemelas de 8 años, en su casa propia en el distrito de Ventanilla en la ciudad de Lima. Desde muy joven ha venido trabajando en diferentes oficios para mantenerse, pero al conformar su familia, estas labores disminuyeron ya que tener hijos pequeños hizo que deba dedicarse más a ellos, lo cual le encanta, ya que como dice; educarlos es su mejor labor. Aún así Rosario a buscado las maneras de ejecutar una labor para ayudar con los gastos del hogar desde su casa, incursionando en la venta de cosméticos, entre otros oficios. Pero hoy en día optó por dedicarse a la administración de su carro, pero primero debe refaccionarlo para poder brindar un buen servicio; este carro lo utilizaba su esposo para desplazarse al trabajo ya que la distancia de donde vive es muy lejana, pero ahora trasladaron a su esposo cerca a su casa, así que ya no lo utilizará, entonces los usará para el negocio del trasporte de pasajeros.  Rosario y su esposo tienen grandes esperanzas de lograr buenos ingresos con su carro, ya que la zona por la que viven es de dificil acceso y las personas que ahí habitan necesitan trasladarse a sus centros de trabajo o estudios y optan por hacerlo en motocarros, los cuales cobran precios muy elevados en muchas ocasiones, es así que ellos esperan ofrecer el servicio de taxi colectivo donde podrán trasladar a más personas a un menor precio, logrando buenos ingresos y de paso ayudando a sus vecinos. Rosario ha tenido varios préstamos con MFP en un banco comunal, pero este es su primer préstamo individual, y siempre ha demostrando gran puntualidad en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado espera dejar en óptimas condiciones su carro para trabajar cuanto antes y así mejorar los ingresos de su hogar, ya que sus hijos van creciendo y ella quiere brindarles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Rosario is 31 years old, is married and lives with her husband and their three kids (the oldest is 11 and her twin girls are 8 years old) in their own home in the district of Ventanilla in the city of Lima. Since she was very young, she has been working in different trades to support herself. But when she had her family, her work diminished as she dedicated herself to her young children, which she loves doing. As she says, educating them is the most rewarding job. Still, she has looked for ways to carry out a job from her home to help with home expenses, entering into the sale of cosmetics, among other professions. Now she is working in the management of her car, but first she has to repair it to be able to provide a good service. Her husband was using the car to get himself to work because they lived far away, but now his job has been moved closer to their home, and therefore he no longer uses the car. Therefore, they will use the car as a business to transport passengers. Rosario and her husband have great hopes of earning a good profit from the car, as the zone in which they live is difficult to get around and the residents need to get to their centers of work or study. The residents often opt for transportation in three-wheeled motor vehicles, which usually charge a very high price. Rosario and her husband hope to offer their taxi service to transport more people for a lower price, earning a good profit as well as helping their neighbors. Rosario has received various loans with MFP in a communal bank, but this is her first individual loan, and she has always been extremely punctual with her payments. With the money she is requesting, she hopes to make repairs to her car before using it to increase her family income, since her children are growing up and she wants to give them a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to her car

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Mme Akouwa A. est née le 13 juin 1955 au Ghana. Elle est mariée avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. C'est une femme très dynamique qui exerce comme activité la culture des champignons. C'est un produit alimentaire très apprécié dans l'art culinaire et utilisé dans la préparation des sauces comme du poisson. Actuellement, la demande dépasse l'offre  mais elle n'a pas les moyens financiers pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients. C'est pourquoi elle demande un crédit pour acheter les outils de travail et tous les éléments qui entrent dans cette culture. Les bénéfices tirés lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions d'existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouwa A. was born on June 13, 1955 in Ghana. She is married with four children to look after. She a very energetic woman and runs a business growing mushrooms. This is a food much valued in cooking and is used in the same way as fish to make sauces. Demand now exceeds supply, but she does not have the financial means to meet customer requirements. This is why she is requesting a loan so that she can buy the tools of her trade and all the elements involved in mushroom growing. The profit will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Growing and selling mushrooms

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila R. tiene ya más de 11 años dedicada a la venta de juguetes nuevo y usados, este es el ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales están estudiando y quiere lo mejor para ellos. 
Actualmente tiene poco inventario y sus clientes de años le están haciendo varios pedidos pero ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir en su negocio y cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes por ese motivo esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía que le están solicitando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila R. has been selling new and used toys for more than 11 years. This is the source of income for her family, since she is a single mother and has two children who are in school, and she wants the best for them.

Currently she has very little inventory to meet the needs of her clients, and this is why she is asking for a loan to be able to stock up on merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 41 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con sus 4 hijos; Victor de 23 años, Esther de 14, Estrella de 11 y Franco de 6 en su propia casa. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, su buen humor ha logrado que se desenvuelva en variedad de oficios; como en la venta de ropa, actividad que dejó de realizar porque la alejaba del contacto con los niños, con los cuales le encanta trabajar, es así que actualmente gracias a lo ahorrado tiene un puesto de golosinas cerca de un colegio muy conocido del distrito de Ancón en la ciudad de Lima. Muchas veces se pone una nariz de payaso y así atrae la atención de los niños vendiendo su mercadería entre bromas y juegos, haciendo que su puesto siempre esté repleto de niños a la hora del recreo y a la salida. Además, también tiene un negocio paralelo que es la animación de eventos infantiles, labor que mayormente realiza los fines de semana con gran alegría ya que a Rosario le encantan los niños, pues para ella son seres llenos de energía que te transmiten alegria y ganas de vivir, no como los adultos que siempre paran preocupados y serios, es por eso que todos su trabajos siempre tienden a ser para niños. Rosario quiere, en el futuro, tener más puestos de golosinas en los otros 4 colegios de la zona y así generar trabajo a otras personas y mejores ingresos para su familia. Hace varios años que viene trabajando con MFP, pero este es su primer préstamo individual y espera ser tan puntual como lo fue en su banco comunal.
