Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas y con la otra parte quiere ayudar a su hijo Victor en el negocio que tiene de venta de CDs.
texts.en:
Rosario is 41 years old, separated from her partner, and lives in her own home with her four children: Victor, 23 years old; Esther, 14 years old; Estrella, 11 years old; and Franco who is 6. She is a very happy and charismatic woman, and her good sense of humor has helped her get by very well in a variety of activities, such as selling clothing. She stopped selling clothes because it kept her too far from contact with her children, who she loves to work with.

Now, thanks to her savings, she has a little candy shop close to a very well known school in the district of Ancón in Lima. She often puts on a clown nose in order to attract children, selling her candy with jokes and games, making sure her shop is always full of children at recess time and when school lets out. She also has another business, which is animation for children's parties, which she primarily does with great joy on the weekends. Rosario loves children, and for her they are beings full of energy that transmit joy and a thirst for life, unlike adults who are always worried and serious. This is why her work always tends to have something to do with children.

Rosario wants, in the future, to have more candy shops near the other four schools in the area to be able to create jobs for other people, as well as a better income for her family. She has been working with MFP for a number of years, but this is her first individual loan and she hopes to be as punctual with her payments as she was with her group loans. With the money she is requesting she will buy more candy, and with some of the money she wants to help her son with his CD sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La Sra. Rufina V. es una cliente antigua anteriormente ha estado trabajando con Créditos de bancos de emprendimiento, ahora solo trabaja con el crédito individual rural que generalmente saca para sus cultivos.
El lugar donde siembra es la comunidad de San Pedro entrando 10km. De puerto rico, es el lugar donde siembra y donde ahora quiere producir yuca y perejil.
Ella vive en Puerto rico con su esposo el Sr. Ciprian Andia y sus dos hijos. Todos los dias se desplazan a sus sembradios recorriendo aproximadamente, entre ida y vuelta 20 Km. distncia que lo realizan caminando.
texts.en:
Rufina V. is a long time client of Creditos de Bancos de Emprendimiento (Kiva Field Partner). She now acquires only the rural individual credit that she generally uses for her plantations.

The place where she cultivates is the community of San Pedro, about 10 Km from Puerto Rico. This is where she can plant and harvest yuca and parsley.

She lives in Puerto Rico with her husband, Mr. Ciprian Andia, and their two children. Every day they go to their plantations, travelling about 20 Km to get there and back, covering this distance on foot.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the production of parsley and yuca.

loans.name: Zadit

texts.es: Zadit tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos; Jackeline de 27, Cristian de 26, Franchesca de 24 y Steffany de 14 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la preparación de buffets, pastelería y bocaditos para eventos; ya sean matrimonios, fiestas de 15 años, bautizos, etc. Para lo cual trabaja con todos sus hijos, ya que es un negocio familiar, donde participan todos. Ellos trabajan por pedido y mientras más grande es la fiesta mayor es el esfuerzo de Zadit y sus hijos, ya que tienen que cocinar mayor cantidad de platillos, y es muy cansado. A pesar de todo el trajín a Zadit le gusta su trabajo porque mantiene unida a toda su familia. Felizmente los ingresos recompensan su trabajo y toda su familia puede vivir tranquila. Pero los deseos de todos es mejorar y hacer de su pequeño negocio algo mucho más grande y más rentable. Para el futuro, quieren alquilar un local para poner una fuente de soda y tener un negocio más estable. Zadit tiene varios años trabajando con MFP y ha sido muy  puntual en sus pagos, actualmente esta en un grupo con 2 de sus amigas. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en la comprar de una cocina industrial, ya que son mucho más potentes para poder preparar mayor cantidad de platillos, mejorando su capacidad de servicio.
texts.en:
Zadit is 48 years old, and lives in her own home with her husband and four children: Jackeline, 27 years old; Cristian, 26 years old; Franchesca, 24 years old; and Steffany, who is 14. For five years she has been catering, preparing buffets, cakes, and appetizers for functions such as weddings, quinceaneras, baptisms, etc. All of her children work alongside her in this family business, and everyone participates. They work by request, and the bigger the party, the harder they work, since they need to prepare more dishes, and it can be quite tiring.

Despite all this hustle and bustle, Zadit likes her work because it keeps her family united. Happily, the income from this work allows her family to live worry-free. But all of them still would like to improve and grow their business, making it even bigger and more profitable. For the future, they want to rent a little space in a market to house a soda fountain and have a more stable business.

Zadit has been working for several years with MFP and has been very punctual in her loan payments. Currently she is in a group with two of her friends. She will use the money she is requesting to buy an industrial stove, because they are much more capable of preparing large quantities of food, which will improve her business capacity.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an industrial stove

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina O. is a single parent and has 6 dependents. She has completed schooling through junior high. Christina has been selling bread, which she bakes herself, at Kisi near Elmina since 2002. Christina uses her income to pay for her childrens' school fees, as well as for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Christina will use the loan to increase her capital in order to purchase flour and other baking materials, which will enable her to increase production. With the profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to save towards building a house with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase flour and other baking materials in order to increase production.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María S. tiene poco que adquirió su vivienda por medio de un crédito gubernamental el cual FVP le presto para la diferencia que tenia y así le pudieran  entregaran su casa  mas pronto, este crédito lo pago puntual mente.
Está solicitando un préstamo para poner  las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas ya que solo viene en esa casa ella y su hija y no tiene nada de sugerida y temen que les pueda pasar algo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa María S. recently acquired a home thanks to a government loan. FVP lent her the difference between her government loan and the cost of the house, so she could have her house sooner. She made her loan payments on time.

She is asking for this new loan to install security grates on her doors and windows, since she lives alone with her daughter and they have no security, and fear that something might happen to them.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Placement of protective grates on the doors and windows of her house

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur réside dans le quartier d’Ablogame, il est marié et père de 01 enfant. Il a pour activité le commerce d’appareils electro ménagers tels que la télévision, les fers à repasser, les frigos. Son stock de marchandises est pratiquement épuisé, aussi il souhaite associé à ce commerce la vente de cartes de recharge. Voulant rehausser son stock afin de réaliser de meilleurs bénéfices et mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, monsieur kokou N. sollicite de WAGES un crédit, pour s’approvisionner et commencer le commerce de carte de recharge avec 50 cartes MOOV et 50 cartes TOGOCEL.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who reside in the Ablogame district. He is married and the father of one child. His work involves commerce in household appliances, such as televisions, irons, and refrigerators. His stock of merchandise is practically exhausted, and he would like to include into this business the sale of recharge mobile phone cards. Wanting to replenish his stock, so as to realize better profits and to provide for his family better, he's requesting a loan from WAGES. It will be used to stock up and to begin commerce in recharge phone cards with 50 MOOV cards and 50 TOGOCEL cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household products and mobile phone cards

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel B. S. is 26 years old. He is married and is a native of the city of Tecpan, Guatemala. For several years he was employed as a blacksmith in Guatemala City where he learned his craft, but then he decided to start his own workshop closer to home. Starting up was difficult because he only had basic tools, but his wife has helped to support their family by selling shoes. Daniel would like to expand his workshop by purchasing materials such as metal sheets, poles, hinges and welding materials. He works with some institutions that pay him monthly, but he doesn’t have enough capital to purchase the necessary materials for his clients.

Daniel’s children are currently in elementary school and they have a home, but he needs to find a place to rent for his workshop. His dream is that his children can continue to study, that he will be able to improve their home, and that he can provide a good life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Daniel B. S., de 26 años de edad, casado, originario del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, desde hace varios años, era empleado en una herrería, en la capital de Guatemala, luego consigue un trabajo, en el municipio, logra aprender su oficio, inicia su trabajo con dificultad porque tenia solo herramientas básicas, esta apoyada por su esposa con venta de zapatos, de forma ambulante; ahora quiere amplear, mas su taller en la compra de laminas, barrillas diagonales, materiales que le sirven para soldar, bisagras; ya que trabaja con instituciones, que le pagan cada mes, y el no cuenta con capital para poder satisfacer, a sus clientes, Tiene a sus hijos estudiando en la primaria, cuenta con casa, pero necesita, un local para su taller, su sueño es tener, a sus hijos estudiando, mejorar su casa, y un tipo de vida digna para toda la familia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and materials for welding

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Don. Juan Carlos Varga, vive en la zona de Quebrada León, a 300 mts. Pasando la escuela cuenta con parcela propia, a la corta edad que tiene ya ha demostrado tener prioridad en acomodar su patrimonio, actualmente cuenta con 5 hras. De tierra y ahora con este crédito quiere comprar una motocicleta para trabajar los fines de semana de mototaxista. 
Su objetivo es seguir creciendo económicamente, quiere seguir trabajando con créditos para aumentar aun más su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos Varga, lives in the zone of Quebrada León, at 300 meters. Having finished school, he has his own plot of land. At his young age, he has demonstrated that his priority is taking care of his property, he currently has 5 hectacres. With this loan he would like to purchase a motorcycle so that he can work weekends as a motor taxi. He wants to continue to progress economically and wants to use loans so that he can increase his net worth.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a Motorcycle

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Mme Antoinette N. est née à Sotouboua au centre du Togo en 1955. Elle est veuve avec cinq (05) enfants à charge. Son activité principale est la préparation et la vente de boisson locale appelée "Tchoukoutou". Cette boisson très appréciée par les consommateurs est fabriquée à base de maïs et du mil. Actuellement sa clientèle augmente et pour mieux répondre à leurs exigences, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du maïs et du mil. Les bénéfices tirés de ce commerce seront utilisés pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Antoinette N. was born in 1955 in Sotouboua in central Togo. She is a widow and has five children to support. Her main work involves making and selling a drink locally called "Tchoukoutou". This drink is highly appreciated by consumers and is made from corn and millet. Right now, her customer base is growing, and to respond better to their demands, she's requesting financing to stock up on corn and millet. The profits derived from this business will be used to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell a non-alcoholic beverage

loans.name: Luisa Margarita

texts.es: La señora  Luisa Margarita R. tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el barrio Dennis Larios ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su mamá y dos hijos , doña Luisa trabaja como domestica y encargada de la casa desde hace diez años  , él apoyo de ella son sus hijos los cuales trabajan y estudian para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , ella siempre a luchado con sus hijos desde pequeños y los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda ya que le hace falta gran parte de materiales ; por lo cual ella solicita un financiamiento de seis mil córdobas para la compra de los materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa Margarita R. is 44 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Dennis Larios located in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her mother and two children. Mrs. Luisa has worked as a maid and head of household of a home for ten years. Her support is her children who work and study in order to help her with the household expenses. She and her children have struggled since they were young and the plan for the future is to improve their housing condition for which they lack many materials. This is why she is asking for a loan of 6000 NIO to purchase construction materials to do the improvements.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve living conditions

loans.name: Minana

texts.en: Minana Y. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received no formal education. Minana buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sells them at the market. Her business, which she has run since 2004, is located at the Elmina sea shore. Her husband is a fisherman. Minana uses her income to assist her husband with house keeping expenses. Minana will use the loan to increase her capital in order to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Minana plans to save towards buying a house, which she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio H. a tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual lo pago puntual mente y fue para la diferencia de su casa. 
En este momento esta solicitando un préstamo para poder poner las protecciones en las ventanas y puertas de su vivienda, ya que su trabaja es de guardia de seguridad es en el tuno de la noche, y quiere la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Marco Antonio H. has had one credit with FVP already, which he repaid punctually and which went towards his home. Now he is requesting a loan to be able to put protective bars on the windows and doors in his home. Since he works the night shift as a security guard, he wants his family to be safe.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put protective bars on the windows and doors of his home.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda B. is 54 years old and a widow with 6 children. Her two youngest children help her with household expenses since her husband died ten years ago. Her business is selling tortillas and selling firewood out of her home, but she also sells some on the street with the help of a few people. Amanda belongs to a solidarity group of women and has a small loan with the group, but is requesting an individual loan as well in order to invest more in her business and to increase her sales and earnings. Amanda’s dream is to see her business grow and to provide a better future for her children.  


***********************************************************************
Translated by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow
***********************************************************************


Amanda B. es viuda tiene 54 años de edad y 6 hijos. Los dos hijos mas pequeños son los que le ayudan con los gastos de la casa ya que su esposo murio hace diez años. Su negocio es venta de tortillas y venta de leña en su casa, pero tambien sale a vender a la calle ya que tiene dos personas que le ayudan a tortiar y a vender la leña, ella pertenece a un banco de mujeres de confianza. El prestamo lo solicita porque necesita invertir mas en su negocio para poder vender mas y tener mas ganancia. Su sueño es ver su negocio mas grande y a sus hijos con un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Purchase of bulk ingredients for tortilla production

loans.name: Mario Jeronimo

texts.es: El Señor Mario Jerónimo S. tiene la edad de 62 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Jerónimo tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Mario es venta y reparación de relojes. Hace más de 24 años que se dedica a este negocio, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Los propósitos de Don Jerónimo son de obtener más herramientas para la reparación de los relojes de sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de relojes nuevos, repuestos de reloj y herramientas. Los sueños de Don Mario son de proporcionarle a su familia las condiciones adecuadas para vivir. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 5.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Señor Mario Jerónimo S. is 62 and married. He has 6 children, who all work. Don Mario sells and repairs clocks. He has done this work for 24 years, and his business is located in his home. His goals are to obtain more tools to repair his customers' clocks. This loan will go towards working capital to purchase new clocks, parts, and tools. His dreams are to be able to offer his family adequate living conditions. He is requesting 5,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo Ysais

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo O. Gutiérrez tiene la edad de 26 años habita en el barrio Pablo calero junto a su esposa, ella de dedica al comercio y le apoya en la agricultura, ya que ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos un varón de doce años que estudia segundo años de secundaria y una niña de siete años que estudia su primaria, los planes hacia su familia es apoyarlo con su estudios para que gocen de una mejor vida , el desde hace nueve años se dedica a trabajar como agricultor para poder mantener a sus hijos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio su vida como agricultor por sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de reforma agraria que le dirigió una capacitación a algunos pobladores , pero sin financiamiento , los planes hacia su negocio o cultivo es mejorarlo para poder tener mayor ingreso , el financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para tener una producción buena.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo O. Gutiérrez is 26 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Pablo Calero with his wife. She is dedicated to commerce and he supports her with agriculture as they have two children in their charge, a boy of twelve years in his second year of middle school and a girl of seven years who is in elementary school. Reynaldo’s plan for his family is to support their studies so that they may enjoy a better life.

Reynaldo has for nine years worked as a farmer to be able to support his children with the greatest difficulty being the lack of finances. The start of his life as a farmer was for his own efforts and the support of agrarian reform which gave him training as a settler, but without financing. The plan for his business or farming is to improve it to be able to have better income.

The financing he wants is for the purchase of fertilizers and consumables to have good production.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables for the improvement of the farm

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. is married and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Esi sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preservation, and then sells at the market. Her business is located at the Elmina sea shore. Her husband is a fisherman. Esi uses her income to assist her husband with house keeping expenses. Esi will use the loan to increase her capital in order to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to save towards buying a house, which she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities for processing and for sale.

loans.name: Nestor Ali

texts.es: El Señor Néstor Ali G. tiene 29 años de edad, su estado civil es casado. La actividad económica de Don Néstor es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de doce años que se dedica a este negocio, sus primeros clientes fueron sus vecinos de su barrio y posteriormente decidió ofrecer sus productos al crédito. Los propósitos de Don Néstor son de establecerse en un local para que sus clientes puedan localizarlo en un determinado lugar. Es por eso que Don Néstor requiere de la ayuda de un financiamiento para su capital de trabajo y así comprar productos como ropa interior, camisetas, shorts, pantalones y faldas. El deseo de Don Néstor es de ofrecer sus productos a otros departamentos y alcanzar establecerse como un expendedor mayoritario. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 20.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Néstor Ali G. is 29-years-old and married. He started selling a variety of merchandise over 12 years ago; his first customers were his neighbours and he eventually started offering products on credit.

Néstor is now planning to set up a store in a fixed location so that his customers can easily locate him. This is why Néstor is requesting a working capital loan. He will use the money to purchase products like underwear, T-shirts, shorts, trousers and skirts.

Néstor hopes to offer his products in other regions and establish himself as a leading supplier. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora I. Q. tiene la edad de 32 años, habita en la comunidad el edén, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen a su cargo tres hijos un varón de un año, una niña de cinco que estudia su primaria y un varón de dos años; los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que donde ellos habitan es en casa del papá y sus cultivo están establecidos en el mismo , ella quiere legalizar a su nombre ya que solo son palabras, ella desde hace veinte años ha trabajado con la agricultura y el comercio ya que era las actividades de sus padres y ella las continua doña Teodora también tiene el sueño de tener una pequeña finca para un futuro de sus hijos la trabajen , con el financiamiento ella va a compra fertilizantes e insumos para tener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora I. Q. is thirty-two-years-old and lives in Eden, which is located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband who is a retail merchant and helps her with the costs of maintaining their home, as they are responsible for their three children: a one-year-old boy, a five-year-old girl enrolled in elementary school and a two-year-old boy. She plans to improve her family's living conditions, as they currently live in her father's home where their crops are located, and she would like to legally acquire the property. For over twenty years she has worked in agriculture and commerce with her parents and continues to do so. Teodora also dreams of having a small farm where her children can work in the future. With this loan she will purchase fertilizers and other raw materials and supplies to yield a good harvest and sell her crops at a good market price.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and supplies for cultivation

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet M. is a forty five year old divorced mother of four children, two of whom are males. Two of her children have completed junior high school and are into trading, while the rest are still in basic school. She is the sole provider for her children. Janet lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  She works very hard as a food vendor in the evenings, in order to provide for the family. Janet prepares and sells a local dish called “Ga-Kenkey” which is produced from corn dough that is balled in a corn husk and cooked again. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish.  Janet has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda P. sells clothing at Kotokoraba, which is the heart of the Cape Coast. Matilda has received junior high education, is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Matilda has been selling clothing since 2005. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Her loan will be used to purchase additional goods in order to increase the sale of fabrics and other clothing to meet an increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business in order to reinvest and ensure the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods in order to increase the sale of fabrics and other clothing.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M., forty-nine, is a widowed mother of six children, four of whom are males and two females. According to her, she lost her husband three years ago. One of her children is in the university and two are learning trades. The rest are in the junior high and the basic schools. She says she is the sole provider for the children. Ama lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Ama works very hard to provide for her family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called “Ga-Kenkey”. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. The cooked dough is balled in corn husk and cooked again. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish. She sells by the street in the evenings. Ama has been in this business for three years. She wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Erving Manuel

texts.es: El señor Erving Manuel A. C. tiene la edad de 23 años habita en el barrio San José los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus padres , el es soltero , los planes hacia su familia es mejoras las tierras introduciendo diversificación de cultivo , para que en futuro logre tener mejor ingreso y apoyar mas a su papá , el desde la edad de doce años trabaja como agricultor , los rubro que le da mantenimiento es el cultivo de piña y el  plátano , los planes hacia un futuro en su negocio es conservar su pequeña finca con obras de conservación de suelo . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para que sus cultivo den una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Erving Manuel A. C. is twenty-three years old, single, and lives with his parents by the river in San Jose, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He plans to improve his family's harvest and further support his father by diversifying the cultivation so that it yields a higher income. He has been working as a farmer since he was twelve years old. The area that he maintains the most is that of pineapple and banana. His future plans are to preserve his small farm with soil conservation methods. The loan will be utilized for the purchase of fertilizers and raw materials in order for his cultivation to produce a good harvest that he may sell at a good market price.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and supplies for a better harvest

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa M. sells groceries like milk, Milo, canned products and others at Pedu near Cape Coast. Theresa has received senior high education, is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Theresa has been selling groceries since 1994. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Her loan will be used as additional capital and will enable her to increase the sale of groceries in order to meet an increase in demand from her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business in order to reinvest back, ensuring the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: As additional capital in order to increase the sale of groceries.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama F. is a fifty two year old divorced mother of four children, one male and three females. One of her children is in senior high and another is in junior high school. The rest are learning trades. She is the sole provider for the children and lives with them in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Ama works very hard to provide for her children and the entire family. She sells both washing and toilet soap, which she procures from big shops in her community and sells at a small kiosk. Ama says she also approaches houses to sell her products. Ama has been in this business for two years. She wants a loan to procure more cartons of soap and hopes to give her children all the financial support she can offer them.

loans.use: To buy cartons of soap

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort O. is a twenty six year old single mother of one daughter who is currently in primary school. Comfort lives independently with her daughter in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town.  Comfort sells ready-made textiles such as ladies’ dresses, fabrics, etc. She buys from Kumasi and treks to markets in nearby areas to sell. She also sells soap to the people in her community. Comfort has been in this business for two years. She wants a loan to procure more cartons of soap in bulk so can expand her business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure ready-made textiles

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate K. is a single parent with two children. She has received schooling through the junior high level. Kate is a hair dresser who owns a beauty salon at Adisadel near Cape Coast, which she has operated since 2003. Kate uses her income to pay for her children's school fees, rent, utility bills, and other living expenses. Kate will use the loan to purchase a variety of hair products to meet the demand of her salon customers. She plans to reinvest the profits from her expanded business into her salon.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her hair salon.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa G. is 33 years old and married with three children, a boy and two girls. Two of her children are in primary school and the other is still too young to attend school. Her husband is a commercial driver and Yaa works to help supplement the family's income. They live in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Yaa sells smoked fish, which she buys from Yeji in the northern part of the country. She sells in the local market square and in nearby areas. Yaa has been in business for 2 years and would like a loan to buy more goods for resale. Yaa's hope is to give her children all the financial support they need to succeed academically.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and other goods for resale in the market.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua F. is 40 years old. She is a married with seven children, five boys and two girls. All her children are in school--from the primary level to senior high school. Her husband is a steel bender and Akosua works to help supplement her family's income. The family lives in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Akosua's business is in second-hand textiles. She buys bales of second-hand clothes from Kumasi and sells them in her community. She has been in business for 5 years. Akosua would like a loan to procure more clothing and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elfego

texts.es: El señor Elfego S.  tiene ya más de un año con su negocio de ventas de tacos en un lugar muy bien ubicado. Él desea tener más variedad de comidas para ofrecerles a sus clientes que tiene muy buena demanda y también quiere acondicionar un nuevo puesto pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para esta inversión, portal motivo nos está solicitando un préstamo, planea pagarlo con las ganancias de su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Elfego S. has had his taco selling business, situated in a very good location, for over a year now. He would like to offer his customers a bigger variety of foods, as they are in high demand. He also wants to set up and open a new stand, but currently he doesn’t have the necessary money to invest in this. For this reason he is requesting this loan, and plans on paying it off with the earnings from his new business.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise purchase for his business

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina B. is a single woman, with no children, who has received a senior high education. She prepares a variety of fast food to sell at Pedu Junction near Cape Coast and has been running her business since 2008. Faustina is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to buy food items and ingredients so that she can increase her sales. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business to expand her trade further.

loans.use: To buy food items and ingredients to increase sales

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail T. is a 26-year-old divorced mother of two children (a boy and a girl). Her children live with their aunt in Kumasi, the regional capital. The eldest child is in the basic school whilst the younger is yet to start. Abigail lives alone in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Abigail has been a maize trader for two years. She buys bags of maize from village farmers and treks to markets to sell it to customers, most of whom are food vendors. Abigail wants a loan to procure more bags of maize to be able to supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To procure maize in bulk

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is a 31-year-old divorced mother of three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She says she opted for divorce due to her husband's infidelity.

Linda works in order to support her children and has been in business for eight years. She buys footwear in Kumasi and treks to markets to sell it. She deals in all kinds of footwear – plimsolls, shoes, slippers, etc. for both men and women. Linda wants a loan to procure more goods. Her hope is to give her children all the financial support they need to succeed academically.

loans.use: To buy footwear for resale

loans.name: Affia

texts.en:
Affia P. sells fabric and clothing in Kotokoraba, which is in the heart of Cape Coast. Affia has received a senior-high education. She is divorced and has one child. Affia has been selling fabric and clothing since 2004. She is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase sales of fabrics and other clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back in the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Additional capital to enable her to increase sales of fabrics and other clothing

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis K. is 30, married and has given birth to two children. Both of her sons are in the basic schools. She says she works to make some income to support her husband financially in taking care of the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a teacher at one of the local schools.

Phyllis trades in jute sacks and all other kinds of sacks. She buys them from Kumasi and Takoradi and sells to market women and traders in the market square. According to her, the market women pack their goods such as cereals, vegetables, etc., in the sacks for easy and convenient transit. She has been in business for 10 years.

Phyllis wants a loan to procure more sacks. She is hoping to expand her business and make more profit to support the family.

loans.use: To buy sacks

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is 32 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have two sons, both of whom are in basic school. The family live in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Comfort trades in food stuffs, such as cassava, and has been in business for three years. She buys cassava from farmers in nearby villages and sells it in the local market square. Her customers are mostly food vendors and retailers. Comfort wants a loan to procure cassava in bulk so that she can supply more customers. She hopes to sponsor her children to high levels in school.

loans.use: To procure cassava in bulk

loans.name: Kuami Yves Elom

texts.fr: Monsieur K.  a exercé pendant une année la profession de comptable, mais il a finalement cessé d’exercer parce ce qu’il n’arrivait pas à couvrir ses charges, il s’est lancé depuis 2007 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, ce commerce lui réussit très bien parce qu’il a la notion de gestion. Voulant agrandir son stock afin de profiter d’un nombre plus élevé de clients il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 8sacs de riz, 1 cartons de tomate, 1 bidons d’huile  et des pâtes alimentaires.
texts.en:
For a year's time, Mr. K. worked as a professional accountant, but he has in the end stopped because he was unable to meet his expenses. In 2007, he got started in the grocery business, which is very successful for him because he has the right idea about managing. Wanting to expand his inventory, so as to take advantage of a larger number of customers, he's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying eight sacks of rice, one box of tomatoes, one drum of oil, and some pasta.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Pablo D. y su esposa la señora María Esther Ortiz tiene dos pequeños hijo a los cuales quieren lo mejor para ellos. En esté momento están pagando renta donde viven  y desean ya tener su propio patrimonio y darles un lugar más estable a sus niños. Don Juan Pablo se dedica a la reparación de autos, este es el ingreso de su familia. 
Están solicitando este préstamo para pagar la diferencia de una casa por medio de un crédito gubernamental, así tener su propia casa y dejar de pagar la renta.
En la foto aparece su esposa la señora María Esther y uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Pablo D. and his wife, María Esther Ortiz, have two small children for whom they wish to provide the best. Currently, they are paying where they live and wish to own their own home so they may provide their children a more stable place to live. Don Juan Pablo repairs automobiles for a living, which is his family’s source of income. They are requesting a loan so they can pay the balance on a house through a government loan program. This way they will own their own home and won’t have to pay rent anymore. This is a photo of Mrs. Maria Esther and one of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Balance on a down payment for a home

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja como capataz en la localidad de de San José de Chiquitos, su negocio es la venta de verdura en el mercado Central El Torno, tienen cuatro hijos, todos en edad escolar, su domicilio en el barrio 27 de Mayo, hace 8 año que se dedica a dicha actividad, solamente esta trabajando con nuestra institución, su objetivo a corto plazo es de emprender junto con su esposo un negocio para que deje de ser empleado.
texts.en:
She is the mother of 3 children, and her husband works as a foreman in the San José de Chiquitos locality. Her business is selling vegetables at the central market of El Torno. Their children are of school age, and they live in the 27th of May neighborhood. She has dedicated herself to her enterprise for 8 years, working only with our institution. Her short-term goal is to start a business with her husband so he can work independently.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es: Desde que dejó su amado Ayacucho (ciudad de la sierra, al sur de Lima), Aquilina  no tuvo otra opción que buscar las mejores condiciones para vivir. Junto a su pareja y sus hijos lograron adquirir una casa donde habitan desde hace 12 años. Su meta al salir de su tierra natal fue ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro próspero. Y el esfuerzo de varios años de dedicarse al comercio la ayudaron, ya que en su inicio solo vendía algunas frutas en la puerta de su casa, pero poco a poco fue ganándose la simpatía de las personas quienes la motivaron en instalar una tienda y así hace 8 años tuvo la oportunidad de abrir una pequeña bodega que está creciendo por la gran acogida que tiene con sus vecinos. Aquilina espera seguir creciendo porque la meta que tiene es terminar de construir su casa y ampliar su local para incrementar su mercadería y surtir su negocio con nuevos productos, con la finalidad de que sea un negocio sostenible en el tiempo, para el bienestar de sus hijos. Es cliente de MFP hace 6 años, se encuentra en su onceavo crédito y siempre se mostró comprometida con el grupo, pues la organización que tienen es muy buena. Aquilina tiene la necesidad de ambientar su tienda y ampliarla con el fin de adquirir más productos y bajo estas metas solicita 3000 soles en préstamo.
texts.en:
Ever since leaving her beloved Ayacucho (a mountain city, south of Lima), Aquilina had no other choice than to look for better living conditions. Together with her partner and their children they managed to obtain a house where they’ve lived for 12 years. The purpose for leaving her native home was to offer her children a more prosperous future. Many years of hard work in commerce have paid of. She began selling a few fruits from her home, but little by little she gained the sympathy of some people who motivated her to open up a store, and 8 years ago she had the opportunity to open a small store, which has been growing due to the relationship she has with her neighbors Aquilina hopes her business continues to grow, as her goal is to finish construction on her home and to expand her store so she can increase her merchandise to stock it with new products, ultimately making it a sustainable business for her children’s benefit. She’s been a client of MFP for 6 years, is on her 11th credit cycle and has shown herself committed to the group, as her organization is very good. Aquilina needs to improve her store and expand it in order to get more merchandise, which is why she is asking for a loan of 3000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise increase and improvement to her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: A Carmen tener una familia la embarga de felicidad, pues vivir con su esposo y su hija en una casa muy acogedora era el sueño que deseaba realizar hace mucho tiempo. Se dedicó a estudiar desde muy joven, siendo muy aplicada, y con el tiempo acabo su carrera de técnica en farmacia y trabajó en diversas boticas o farmacias de su ciudad. Pero conoció a un químico farmacéutico quien le enseñó diversos conceptos esenciales dentro de su carrera y con el tiempo el destino los unió y juntos buscaron la manera de tener algo propio, e instalaron en su casa una farmacia. Desde hace 13 años viene funcionando su negocio y gracias a sus habilidades se ha convertido en una de las farmacias más concurridas, a quienes se les garantiza una eficiente atención de esta dulce pareja. Sin embargo, desean aprovechar la acogida del público para instalar una sucursal en otro sector de su ciudad, convirtiendo este servicio de salud en un negocio duradero para su familia. Carmen viene trabajando con MFP hace tres  años, este es su cuarto préstamo y espera seguir trabajando de una manera organizada junto a las socias que conforman su banco comunal. Invertirá los 1000 soles que solicita en la compra de medicamentos necesarios para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Having a family fills Carmen with happiness. Living with her husband and daughter in a very cozy house was the dream that she had hoped to accomplish for a long time. She studied when she was younger and was very dedicated. She finished her studies as a pharmacy technician and worked in various pharmacies in her city. She met a pharmaceutical chemist who taught her various essential concepts throughout her studies and with time, fate united them, and together they searched for a way to have something of their own. They started a pharamacy in their home. For thirteen years, they have run their business, and thanks to their abilities, it has become one of the most frequented pharmacies among those who are guaranteed efficient service from this sweet couple. They hope to make the most of being accepted by the public and start a location in another part of the city, making this health service a lasting business for their family. Carmen has worked with MFP for three years, and this is her fourth loan. She hopes to continue working in an organized manner with the members that make up her communal bank. She will invest the 1,000 soles that she is requesting in purchasing necessary medications to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es: Celinda tiene 54 años, a lo largo de su vida ha procurado brindar lo mejor a sus seres queridos y con esfuerzo obtuvo su casa donde vive con su esposo y su hija quien sufre de síndrome de down. Celinda siempre pensó en tener una familia en la cual ambos, como pareja, trabajen para cubrir los gastos del hogar y no tener que pasar necesidades. Ahora, junto a su esposo trabajan en diversas actividades, una de ellas, es la venta de bebidas en algunos eventos sociales que realizan diversas empresas, quienes la contratan como vendedora. Estas fiestas no son frecuentes pero son muy rentables, ya que la concurrencia es sumamente grande y cuando tiene que atender le hacen falta ayudantes. Esta actividad le dio la posibilidad de obtener un kiosco hace 2 años y ahora se encuentra vendiendo gaseosas todos los fines de semana en los balnearios cercanos, y tiene mayor posibilidad de incrementar su venta. Con el trascurso del tiempo anhela  tener un carrito de comida, el cual se caracteriza por su fácil desplazamiento a diversos lugares, con la finalidad de trasladar tu negocio a lugares estratégicos de venta. Celinda trabaja con MFP hace tres años, está en su cuarto préstamo y en el trascurso fueron compartiendo grandes experiencias junto a sus compañeras que la motiva a seguir junto a su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para comprar mayor cantidad de gaseosas, pues el verano beneficia su negocio, lo cual tiene que aprovechar de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Celinda is 54 years old, and over the course of her life has been able to provide the best for her loved ones, and with great effort bought her house, where she lives with her husband and daughter who has Down's Syndrome. Celinda always thought about having a family in which both, as a couple, work in order to cover the household costs, and never have to go without anything. Now, together with her husband, she works in a variety of activities. One of them is beverage sales at social events that are put on by various companies who contract her as a vendor. These parties don't happen that often but they are very profitable, because the number of people who attend is quite large, and when Celinda goes to work, she doesn't have enough helpers.

This job allowed her to buy a little store two years ago and now she spends weekends selling soft drinks in nearby resorts, and which helps her increase her sales. In the future she dreams of having a food cart, which will make it easy for her to go to different places, with the goal of hitting the best strategic spots for sales.

Celinda has been working with MFP for three years, and this is her fourth loan. Over this time she has shared great experiences with her fellow borrowers, which motivates her to continue with her communal bank. The money she is asking for es to buy a greater quantity of soft drinks, since summer time is the high season for sales, and she has to take advantage of this opportunity to the maximum.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell (soft drinks)

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Para Erika, en sus 34 años no ha resultado fácil salir adelante, pero con mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir la casa donde vive con sus dos hijos. Con la responsabilidad de velar por la integridad de sus hijos, sale a vender en las calles de su localidad, grandes cantidades de ropa que compra en el mercado central de su ciudad para luego vender en los distritos donde el costo de venta es mayor, y gracias a la gran demanda de las personas, sobretodo de las señoritas, quienes son las que desean vestir a la moda, Erika obtienen grandes ingresos, aunque estar todo el día expuesta al sol o al frío la agota. Por ello está iniciando una nueva forma de vender, que consiste en distribuir las prendas de vestir en algunas tiendas o clientes para luego salir a cobrar todos los días, actividad que realiza junto a su hija, quien la apoya todas las tardes cobrando. Sin embargo, ambas tienen la meta de poner un stand de ropa para dejar de caminar y tener un lugar estable. Durante estos 4 años Erika tuvo la oportunidad de acceder a nueve créditos con MFP, con los que poco a poco ha mejorado su situación económica, tanto de ella como del grupo, quienes son muy responsables y comprometidos. El deseo de progresar la está motivando en incrementar su mercadería y con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará grandes cantidades de prendas para distribuirlas a sus clientas.
texts.en:
For Erika, who is 34 years old, life has been a struggle, but with great effort she managed to buy the house where she lives with her two children. With the responsibility of taking care of her children and their integrity, she goes out to sell clothing, which she buys in the central market of her city and sells in areas where she can get a higher price for it.

Thanks to the great demand that exists, primarily from young women who want to dress in the latest fashions, Erika makes a lot of money, although being out in the sun or the cold all day wears her out. For this reason, she is using a new sales technique, which consists of distributing the clothing to some stores or customers, and later going out to collect payments every day, which she does with her daughter who helps her each afternoon. However, both of them have the goal of getting a little shop, so they can stop walking and have a stable location.

During these four years, Erika has had the opportunity to take out 9 loans with MFP, with which she has, little by little, improved her financial situation, just like the rest of the group, who are all very responsible and committed. The desire to get ahead is motivating her to increase her merchandise, and with the 2000 soles she is asking for, she will buy greater quantities of clothing to distribute to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, pues el afán de mantener a su familia lo impulsó a brindar a sus seres queridos una casa propia donde vivir. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de comida, pues la cocina es una de las habilidades más resaltantes de su persona, ya que fue muy exigente con la comida que degustaba y con el tiempo se animó a especializarse como cocinero, y al descubrir sus dones en la cocina abrió un restaurante de mariscos en las playas del sur de su ciudad. A este lugar, los turistas suelen visitar para pasar un fin de semana junto al mar, siendo los clientes más frecuentes en el restaurante de don Julio. Pero como atiende solo los fines de semanas instaló en su casa un pequeño restaurante que atiende su esposa y él cocina durante la semana. Pero sin duda, lo que desea es adquirir un local más amplio para que su restaurante en la playa sea uno de los más acogedores para los extranjeros, quienes son sus clientes más frecuentes y a quienes desea brindar una mejor atención. Juan está en su cuarto préstamo con MFP y espera seguir trabajando junto al grupo de personas que le enseñaron cómo trabajar en equipo. Invertirá los 2500 soles que solicita, en la compra de utensilios, mesas y demás muebles que puedan dar mejor apariencia a su restaurante.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man, and his eagerness to take care of his family motivated him to provide his loved ones with their own house to live in. For 20 years he has been selling food, since cooking is one of his most outstanding skills. He has always been very demanding about the quality of food, and with time he decided to specialize in becoming a chef. Once he discovered his gifts in the kitchen, he opened a seafood restaurant in the southern beaches of his city. In this place, tourists spend weekends at the sea, and are don Juan's most frequent customers. But since he only works there on weekends, he put a little restaurant in his house which his wife takes care of, and he cooks there during the week. Without a doubt, though, what he would like to do is get a bigger location so his restaurant becomes one of the most welcoming to foreigners, who are his most frequent customers and for whom he wants to provide the best service.

This will be Juán's fourth loan with MFP and he hopes to continue working together with the group that has taught him how to work as part of a team. He will invest the 2500 soles that he is asking for in the purchase of utensils, tables, and other furniture which will improve the appearance of his restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of utensils and furniture for his restaurant

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
El Sr. Porfirio Pérez vive en la localidad de Santa Martha en casa familiar con su esposa y su hijo, que lo colaboran aportando con sus negocios a la manutencion de casa. 
El se dedica a la actividad de transporte urbano, es presidente de su sindicato, es una persona muy trabajadora. La esposa, Alcira Cruz, se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa. Ellos cuentan con una vagoneta propia con la cual vienen trabajando hace 4 años. 
Su objetivo es colocarle un puesto dentro del mercado a su esposa para la venta ropa, ya que ahora es vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
Mr. Porfirio Pérez lives in Santa Martha with his wife and son. They both contribute to the maintenance of their home through their respective jobs. He works in public urban transportation, is president of his labor union, and is a very hard worker. His wife, Alcira Cruz, sells clothing for a living. They rely on their own car, which they've been using for the past four years. His objective is to place a stand for his wife within the marketplace in order for her to sell her clothing, as she is now a mobile vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marlene tiene 26 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en la casa donde instalaron su negocio. Cocinar no era una de las cosas que le agradara realizar, pero con el tiempo la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar la impulsaron a aprender a preparar variedad de comidas para vender. Luego notó que la demanda de personas era mayor cada día y fue creciendo, con este trabajo no tiene que dejar su hogar, debido a que instaló su pequeño comedor en la puerta de su casa, facilitándoles sus labores como madre y como vendedora. Además pudo percibir que su sazón fue mejorando y que las personas la felicitaban por el exquisito menú, lo cual la motivaba  y la llenaba de satisfacción. Desde entonces su negocio fue tomando nuevas perspectivas y ahora tiene el interés de tener un gran restaurante que acoja a grandes cantidades de personas y que logre ser un restaurante de prestigio. Marleny está en su cuarto préstamo con MFP y espera seguir trabajando así porque tuvo la posibilidad de descubrir sus habilidades y capacidades, no tan solo en su negocio, sino también en su relación con las personas. Marlene  tiene  pensado invertir los 2500 soles que solicita en la ambientación del espacio que tiene para su negocio y comprar algunos utensilios para mejorar la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marleny is 26 years old and lives, along with her husband and her two children, in the house where her business is located. Cooking was not one of the things that she was pleased to do, but for the time being the need to help her spouse with the costs of the household forced her to learn to prepare a variety of foods for sale. Then she saw that the demand for her food grew every day and in this line of work she did not need to leave her home because they installed a small countertop in the doorway of their house, facilitating her work as a mother and as a saleswoman. She could see that her cooking skill was improving and that people welcomed her gourmet menu, which motivated her and gave her satisfaction. Since then her business has given her new perspectives and now she is interested in opening a large restaurant that could hold a large number of people and which would be a restaurant of prestige. Marleny is in her fourth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and hopes to continue working in this way because she has had the opportunity to discover her skills and abilities, not only in her business, but also in her relations with people. Marleny plans to invest the 2500 soles that she is asking for in the decoration of the space that she has for her business and to buy some utensils for improving the interest of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her place of business and to buy utensils

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es: Rocío es muy optimista y trabajadora, pues el hecho de vivir con sus padres, quienes son negociantes le enseñaron lo necesario para tener un negocio propio, lo cual le ayuda para solventar sus gastos de educación y apoyar en los gastos de casa. Sus deseos de independizarse la llevaron a ir mejorando el grado de socialización con las personas y a perfilar sus actitudes para ser comerciante, con el tiempo pudo adquirir ciertas habilidades para las ventas y ahora viene trabajando 2 años en la venta de ropa interior, lo cual es muy rentable, sobre todo con las madres de familia quien compran grandes cantidades de prendas para toda su familia. Así, desde las nueve de la mañana sale a los mercados de su distrito para ofrecer sus productos a las personas que transitan por ahí.  Actividad que solo puede realizar en las mañanas porque en la  tarde se dedica a estudiar diseño grafico, y mientras estudia su tía le brinda apoyo vendiendo sus productos en el stand de ropa que tiene en la ciudad. Pero aun teniendo el apoyo de su tía, Roció requiere incrementar su mercadería e ingresos para solventar sus estudios y realizar sus sueños de ejercer su carrera, sin dejar su negocio, pues con el tiempo desea tener un stand donde vender. Rocío se encuentra en su treceavo crédito con MFP y espera seguir junto a este grupo de trabajo, pues el dinamismo y el carisma son aspectos resaltantes dentro de ellas. Tener grandes cantidades de mercadería le ayudaría en incrementar sus ingresos económicos y espera que los 1000 soles que solicita le ayuden a tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rocío is very upbeat and hardworking, since she lives with her parents who are business people who have showed her the necessity of having her own business. This is useful to settle her educational expenses and to help out with household expenses. Her desire for independence has propelled her to increase her social interaction with others and to highlight her attitudes in order to become a salesperson. Over time, she has acquired certain abilities for making sales, and now has two years experience selling underwear. This is very profitable, especially with mothers who buy large quantities of garments for the entire family. Thus, at nine in the morning she leaves for the markets in her district in order to offer her wares to those who are passing by. She can only do this in the morning because her afternoons are devoted to studying graphic design, and while she is studying her aunt assists her by selling her products in the clothing stand that she has in the city. But even with this assistance, Rocío needs to increase her inventory and income in order to finance her studies and realize her dreams of practicing her career. She won’t abandon her business either, but hopes over time to have her own stand to sell from. Rocío came across credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA at age 13 and she hopes to continue working with this group because of the outstanding dynamism and charisma within them. Having large quantities of merchandise would help her to increase her revenues and she hopes that the 1,000 Sols she is seeking will help her to have greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Increase her Inventory of Merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 36 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en la casa de su suegra, quien dio en herencia a su hijo un cuarto donde vivir con su familia. Ser madre y negociante son dos actividades que tiene que desarrollar todos los días, sin descuidar ninguna de ellas. Se levanta de madrugada para preparar los alimentos y los útiles de sus hijos a quienes acompaña todas las mañanas al colegio, para luego salir a su puesto dentro de una galería donde vende ropa. Esta actividad es muy agotadora por la gran concurrencia de personas, pero en estos dos años ha tratado de adaptarse a este negocio, el cual es muy rentable, pues el precio con el que adquiere su mercadería es cómodo y le da la facilidad de vender a un costo mayor que cubran sus gastos de inversión, sin la necesidad de elevar los costos por prenda, siendo accesible para las personas de escasos recursos económicos. Con el tiempo, Rosa tiene planeado tener una cadena de tiendas para vender y administrar  su negocio en diversos lugares de su ciudad. Ella es cliente de MFP desde hace 7 años, este es su treceavo crédito, y le agrada el equipo de trabajo que conforman en su grupo. Solicita este dinero porque quiere mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para venderlas y tener gran diversidad de modelos que llamen la atención de sus clientas, quienes cada vez son más exigentes por la moda que es tan cambiante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old, married and lives with her two children in her mother-in-law’s house. Her mother-in-law included a room in her will for her son and family to live in. She must be mother and businesswoman every day without neglecting either activity. She gets up at dawn to prepare the food and school materials for her children. She takes them to school every morning and then goes to her stall inside a mall where she sells clothes. It’s a very tiring job dealing with a large number of people but she has tried to adapt to it in the past two years. The business is very profitable since she gets the merchandise at a convenient price to easily sell at a higher price and cover her investment costs. She doesn’t need to increase the cost of the clothing so it is accessible to people with few economic resources. Rosa plans to have a chain of stores to sell clothes and run her business in different parts of her city. She has been a client of Microfinanzas Prisma for 7 years. This is her thirteenth loan and she likes the team that makes up her group. She is requesting this money because she wants a larger amount of clothing articles to sell and a greater diversity of styles to get the attention of her customers. They are more and more demanding with fashion that is always changing.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana B. R. vive en la localidad de Santa rita cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, tiene la actividad de venta de comida, hace 6 años que viene trabajando con dicha actividad, su esposo el Sr. Alberto Toledo trabaja de sereno en la chancadora de Santa Rita, además de esto el le ayuda también en el negocio de la venta de comida.
El crédito que esta solicitando, es exclusivamente para aumentar su capital de negocio quiere para la compra de  vajillas, sillas y mesas, además también quiere invertir en la compra de un frisser.
Su objetivo es agrandar mas su negocio, quiere ampliar y ya no solamente atender a pensionados si no también al publico en general.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana B. R. lives in Santa Rita and owns a home whom she shares with her husband and five children. She has been working in food sales for the past six years. Her husband, Mr. Alberto Toledo, works as a watchman in Santa Rita's grinder and also helps her with her food sale business. The loan she requests is exclusively reserved for her business and will go toward the purchase of dinnerware, chairs and tables, and a freezer. Her objective is to grow her business and expand to serve the general public and not just retirees.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital and purchase a freezer

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León la señora Juana Orozco M. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su actividad de ganadería el cual posee en su propia comunidad donde a diario se dedica a invertir en ella para salir adelante en su actividad.

Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la de obtener un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de las vacas paridas y por esta razón es que ha acudido esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma dar lugar a la compra de la vaca para mejorar su condición y proceder a su crianza para extraer la leche y de igual forma comercializarla en su municipio.
texts.en:
In the town of El Sauce in León, Juana Orozco M. works with much effort at her cattle ranch which she owns in her own community. She works daily at investing in it to get ahead.

Nowadays her greatest need is to get a loan at Ceprodel to buy calved cows. That’s why she came, hoping her loan might be granted. She could then buy the cow and improve her condition. She would proceed to raise it for milking and market it in her town

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Autonomos Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Este banco de emprendimiento se encuentra en su quinto ciclo esta conformado de 10 personas las cuales viven en la localidad de la Guardia.
MARISELA C. AÑEZ.- Es la presidenta del banco, vive en la localidad de la Guardia, en el barrio Victoria al frente de la guardería, vive encasa familiar.
Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos es promotora de; (yanbal, ebel, esica). Y además de eso también se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
su objetivo es aumentar su capital de trabajo y seguir estudiando quiere salir profesional para poder trabajar en su área, 
AURELIA C. F..-  Es la tesorera del banco de emprendimiento, de igual manera que las demás compañeras se encuentran en su quinto ciclo. Vive en el Barrio Victoria de la Localidad de la Guardia a 8 cuadras de l colegio nal. Cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con sus 4 hijos.
La actividad a la cual se dedica es la venta de comida con el que viene trabajando hace aproximadamente 5 años con lo que mantiene a su familia.Quiere colocar una licorería.
MARY AÑEZ C..-  ella tiene el cargo de secretaria de actas en el banco comunal la cual de igual manera que las anteriores se encuentra en su quinto ciclo. 
Se dedica a la actividad de venta de cosméticos es promotora de la línea yanbal, ebel, esica. Lo cual realiza su actividad ambulando.
Vive en el Barrio Victoria de la plazuela en plena esquina alquila un cuarto el en cual vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo.
El esposo se dedica a la actividad de soldadura en la misma dirección de su domicilio actualmente solo es ayudante, pero están acumulando su capital apara colocar su propio taller se soldadura.
texts.en:
This entrepreneurial bank is in its fifth year of operation and composed of ten people who live in La Guardia. MARISELA C. AÑEZ is the president of the bank and lives with family in La Guardia in the neighborhood of Victoria in front of the nursery. She sells cosmetics for a line of products from Yanbal, Ebel and Esica. Aside from that, she also sells pop soda. Her objective is to increase her work capital and continue studying, as she'd like to be a professional and work in her area. AURELIA C. F. is treasurer at the bank, and like her colleagues, has been working there for five years. She lives in the neighborhood of Victoria in La Guardia, eight blocks from the school. She owns a home which she lives in with her four children. She supports her family through her food sale business, which she has been managing for approximately five years. She would like to open a liquor store. MARY AÑEZ C. is secretary at the communal bank and as her colleagues, has also been working there for five years. She sells cosmetics door-to-door for a line of products from Yanbal, Ebel and Esica. She lives in the neighborhood of Victoria and rents a small room in a corner home in which she resides with her husband and three children. Her husband is a welder by trade but currently assists in the house in which their home is located. However, they are saving money to open up their own welding shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their work capital

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Este grupo resulto de la reestructuracion de un banco de emprendimiento, las cuales ahora ya forman un grupo solidario ellas son: Reina O., Leocadia S. y Genara C..
La Sra. Reina O. es la coordinadora del grupo es una persona muy trabajadora, ella es nacida en el departamento de Chuquisaca, y actualmente vive en la localidad del Torno en el Barrio Las Palmas, cuenta con casa propia en la que vive con sus 2 hijos, 3 hijastros y sus esposo.
El negocio que tienen es familiar todos se dedica al comercio de medicinas naturales y paran constantemente viajando.
Su objetivo es colocar su negocio fijo en la que pueda a tender al publico de las misma zona.
texts.en:
This group is the result of a restructuring of a village bank, and they now form a unified group consisting of: Reina O., Leocadia S. and Genara C.. Mrs. Reina O. is the coordinator of the group and is very hard-working. She was born in Chuquisaca department and today lives in the Las Palmas neighborhood of Torno. She has her own home where she lives with her 2 children, 3 step children and her husband. The family business they have is selling natural medicines so they are constantly traveling. Her goal is to open a locale where she can attend to the general public in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for a natural medicines business

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo B. es un caballero muy esforzado que se dedica a su actividad agropecuaria en el municipio de El Sauce donde a diario se esfuerza grandemente para lograr salir adelante y suplir las necesidades de su familia.

Con pocos recursos inició su negocio y a lo largo que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de un novillo para llevar a cabo su actividad y así continuar brindando las condiciones de vida necesarias para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo B. is a very hardworking gentleman that works in farming in the town of El Sauce. He makes a great effort daily to get ahead and meet the needs of his family.

He started his business with few resources. Over time he has supported his immediate family made up of his two small children. The reason he is waiting in Ceprodel is because he requested a loan to buy a young bull to carry out his work. This way he could continue to offer his family the necessary conditions for living.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a young bull

loans.name: Neftalí

texts.es:
El señor Neftalí C. actualmente vive en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de Leñon donde se dedica a su actividad economica de ganadería con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su familia compuesta por su esposa y su pequeño hijo para brindarles un techo digno donde vivir y haya seguridad.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de un novillo y por esto es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así salir adelante en su actividad ganadera que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr. Neftali C. currently lives in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leñon where he raises livestock with the purpose of bettering the living conditions of his family. His family consists of his wife and young son and he wants to give them a decent place to live where there is security.

It is important to emphasize that today he has asked for the support of Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan for the purchase of young bull; for this purpose he hopes that his loan will be granted and then he will be able to forge ahead in his business that very much requires your support.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aurelio Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Aurelio M. hoy en día se dedica a atender su pequeña pulpería que hasta este momento ha logrado surtir con mucho esfuerzo brindando las condiciones necesarias para que la pulpería se desarrolle.

Es de importancia destacar que hoy en día la razón por la que él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito ya que requiere de este por la razón de que se le ha agotado su mercadería y requiere adquirirla para así continuar en su negocio que tanto necesita de su inversión para crecer.
texts.en:
Mr. Aurelio Martiniz runs a small general store. Up until now he has been able to stock the store. With great effort he has arranged the necessary conditions so that his store could develop. The reason he has come to Ceprodel for a loan is that his stock is depleted. He needs to get new stock to keep his business. His business really needs a loan in order to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for his small general store

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Corí Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua. 
Carmen es casada, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Carmen se dedica a la crianza de cuy, actividad que realiza en la ciudad de Huanta para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana, tiene 8 galpones y los vende a los recreos de la ciudad de Huanta. 
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alimento balanceado.
Los sueños de Carmen son ser una empresaria y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Corí Soncco Communal Bank, which means "Heart of Gold" in Quechua. Carmen, 25, is married with one kid. Carmen raises guinea pigs, which she carries out in the city of Huanta and does with the help of her sister. She has eight sheds, and sells the animals to recreation parks in Haunta.

Carmen needs a loan of 1,000 soles, money that will be invested in buying feed. Carmen's dreams are to be a businesswoman and to offer a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con la necesidad de mantener su hogar y con dos pequeños niños que debe brindarles el alimento, la señora Esperanza V. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de venta de comida y atoles ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio de El Sauce donde a diario se desempeña en esta labor.

Es importante destacar que la señora Esperanza ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a esta labor y ha logrado salir adelante, La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de su materia prima y así salir adelante en su negocio de venta de comestibles ambulantemente por las calles de su municipio.
texts.en:
In order to maintain her home with two little kids to feed, Ms. Esperanza V. works very hard to sell food items and "atoles" (maize drink) in the streets of her municipality of El Sauce where she daily carries out this work.

It's important to highlight the fact that Ms. Esperanza has dedicated a large part of her life to this work and has successfully been able to get out ahead. The reason why she's come to Ceprodel is to be granted a loan to purchase basic materials and to move forward in her business selling food items in the streets of her municipality.


Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials

loans.name: Betsi

texts.es:
Betsi es socia del Banco Comunal Corí Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua. 
Betsi es casada, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos, Betsi junto a su esposo tienen una imprenta y librería, tiene 2 locales que están ubicados en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, cuenta con 3 trabajadores.
Betsi necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tintas.
