loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela L. S. es una señora muy emprendedora que desde hace un año se puso a vender pan en las colonias. Ella pone su producto en un carro y lo va ofreciendo con una bocina y el cliente sale a comprar. Ahora ella requiere de ayuda para invertir y así tener mas ingresos en su panadería la cual es llamada “La Bendición”
Entre su esposo y ella elaboran el pan desde temprano para en la tarde salir a venderlo.
texts.en:
Gabriela L. S. is a very hard working woman who, for a year now, has dedicated herself to selling bread in residential neighborhoods. She and her husband make the bread early in the morning so that they can go out to sell it in the afternoons. She packs her bread onto a cart and goes around, using a horn so that her clients know to come out of their houses to buy some. Now, she needs help so that she can invest in her business and increase her bakery's income. The name of her bakery is La Bendición - The Blessing.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Winston

texts.en:
Winston P. is a rice farmer. He tills and plows the field all the time to provide enough food for his family. He is 32 years old and has no children. His wife, Aileen P., helps him manage their rice farm. Aside from rice, he also grows ducks. Today he has 400 ducks on his farm. He started this business 12 years ago. He has a very strong entrepreneurial spirit and wants to grow his business more.

He is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. He will use the loan to buy more ducks as well as farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will definitely help Winston have a better yield on his farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help alleviate poverty. They help people start and have their own business. They provide not only provide credit but also training and insurance coverage to all their clients to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and ducks

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. owns 1-hectare of land in her village. She grows rice and other crops like "camote," which is the Philippine name for sweet potato. She also raises chickens to support the needs of her family. She has 6 children and a husband, who spent his entire life, since he was just a kid, on the farm.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy quality rice seeds and fertilizers needed to increase her yield. This loan will truly help her family grow their business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help alleviate poverty. It helps people start and own businesses. They not only provide credit, but training and insurance coverage, too.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Enecito

texts.en:
Enecito S. owns 1 hectare of land, which he inherited from his parents. He is 39 years old and still single. He started tilling the farm when he was just 10 years old. They were so poor that he was not able to finish his studies. Instead, he helped his parents on the farm to raise their family and have enough food to eat. Now that he finally owns the farm, he wants to make it grow in honor of his parents. 

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy good quality rice seed and fertilizer to improve his yield. In that way, he can also save for his future family. The loan will greatly help Enecito grow his farm.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help alleviate poverty. It helps people start and have their own business. They provide all their clients like Enecito not only credit but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and Urea fertilizer.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro B. is a rice grower. He owns 3 hectares of land in the village. He is married and has five children attending school. He has been tilling their farm for 20 years now. He admitted that to farm is difficult and very hard work. "But if you love the soil, it will love you back", he said. "The land will provide your family the food and their other needs", he added. 

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will also go to buy pesticide to avoid insects that inflict disease in his rice. He is also thinking of other possible income areas to help his family as well.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help eradicate poverty. CEVI helps people start and have their business. They not only provide credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well to help their small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase farm input, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita C. owns a small piggery. She raises pigs to help augment her income. She has been into this kind of business for a long time. She said she was just a teenager when she began raising pigs and she could no longer remember the exact date. She has seven children and a husband who works on the farm. Aside from pigs, they also have rice. Together, they work very hard for their family needs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed for the pigs. The loan will truly help Margarita grow her piggery business. In this way, she can increase the size of her pig fence in the future.  

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help alleviate poverty. CEVI helps people start and have their own business. CEVI provides credit, training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida C. owns a small rice field in her village. She is 46 years old and has three children attending school. School is quite expensive nowadays and she is worried about where to get the money since they only have a little income. Her husband is a farmer. They both work on the farm to grow rice. Their harvest is intended for family use and the remainder goes to rice traders for additional income.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. The loan will truly help her increase her yield. In that way, she could better support her family.

CEVI is helping people start and have their own businesses. They help provide credit for entrepreneurs, as well as training and insurance coverage to help their businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros L. is engaged in rice farming. She is 42 years old and has 4 children. Their children's education is something that worriers her because it is quite expensive and is hard on their budget. She has a husband, Glen L., who is also a farmer. He has managed their rice farm for the last 10 years. Aside from rice, Milagros also grows vegetables in the backyard. When she and her children are not busy with the farm or school, respectively, they water their small vegetable garden. Their harvest is intended for the family, anything extra is sold in the village for additional income.

Milagros requests a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and other chemicals needed to increase her yield. She also thinks of venturing into other kinds of businesses that could help contribute to the family income.

CEVI helps uplift people from poverty. CEVI provides credit assistance to entrepreneurs, as well as training and insurance coverage to help grow their small businesses.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Aquino

texts.en:
Aquino N. raises pigs in his backyard. He is 23 years old and single. His parents taught him this business. At a young age, he realized that he needed to work hard to achieve his dreams. Aquino's small pig farm will help him achieve his dreams, even though he was not able to finish his studies. He failed his parents once, but this time he will prove to everyone that he can do better in society by having a business.

Aquino is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy piglets and feed for his pigs. This loan will definitely help Aquino grow his small pig farm. Aquino can buy more pigs, which will allow him to earn a significant profit for his parents and his future.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to eradicate poverty. CEVI helps people start and own a business. They provide credit, training, and insurance coverage to all their clients to help them grow their small businesses.

loans.use: Buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo S., 58, is a father of four children and now owns a farm. Earlier he used to only rent a farm. However, with hard work and perseverance, he has been able to buy a small parcel of land to till. He reserves his harvest mainly for family consumption, and the rest is sold to rice traders for additional income. Wilfredo is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI to buy fertilizers and herbicides. He will also use a part of the loan to start a new business.

CEVI gives people a chance to start and have a business of their own. It gives all its clients credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebbeca J. is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rebbeca is 37 years old and married to a teacher. She has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

Kiva's partner BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 38 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and her children all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Mary hopes to be able to continue to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is thirty-five years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has three children and all her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael Kachagwa is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur. He is married and has three school-going children. He runs a hardware shop at the Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells various items including color and cement. He purchases the items from the wholesale shops at the Kariakoo shopping center and retails to customers at Buguruni. The income generated from the business is used to meet the daily needs of his family. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost up his hardware business.

loans.use: To expand his hardware business

loans.name: Mwema

texts.en: Mwema H. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur. She runs a clothing shop at Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells both used and new clothes. She purchases business items from the wholesale shops in the Kariakoo shopping center and purchases used clothes from the small traders market at Karume. She also retails to customers at Vituka. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more business items for her shop

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel T. Michael is a Tanzanian businessman who runs a shop in Tabata. He sells a variety of items including serial crop products such as wheat flour, maize flour, ground nuts, cashew nuts, sugar and cooking oil.

He purchases from wholesale shops in the Kariakoo city business center and sells to retail customers in Tabata. He has been running the business for four years. He plans to run a wholesale shop once he gets enough funds. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to boost the business.

loans.use: To buy more items for his shop

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe S. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur who runs a clothing shop in the Tandika ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases some items from wholesale shops in the Kariakoo business city center and imports others from Zanzibar Island. He then resells on a retail basis to customers in Tandika. He has been in the business for six years.

He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000. to buy more items to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more clothing items

loans.name: Mwalami

texts.en: Mwalami Sadiki Mtumbuka is a micro-business man from Tanzania.  He runs a business of purchasing and selling chickens for broiling.  He purchases directly from small producers in wholesale and supplies to retail customers by order.  He temporarily keeps poultry in cages waiting for retail customers. He has been in the business for three years and is in need of 600,000 TZS to boost the business.

loans.use: To boost a poultry business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta L. owns a "sari-sari" store. Sari-sari is common in the Philippines. Typically it is a store, small or big, which displays various items like food, beverages, medicines, rice and other goods. Violeta is married and has 2 children studying. She admits that school is quite expensive nowadays. However, she thinks that she needs to support her children's education more for a better future. According to IBON Foundation INC., a research-education-information development institution that undertakes the study of socio-economic issues that confront Philippine society and the world today, the global economic situation is expected to continue deteriorating until 2010 and even beyond, and the Philippines is going to be severely affected by the worsening crisis. Violeta has never been afraid of the crisis. In fact, she is more inspired to do well in her business to support her family needs.

She is asking for a loan of Php 23,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy grocery items for her store. In that way, she believes, she could attract more customers and earn bigger profit.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help eradicate poverty. CEVI helps people start and have their own business for a living. They not only provide credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina A. is a Tanzanian small businesswoman with four school-aged children. She runs a clothing shop and also sells fresh fish. She purchases the clothing from shops in Kariakoo city business center, and sells them retail to customers at Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She also run a business of selling fresh fish to customers. She purchases direct from fishermen and stores it in a deep freezer waiting for customers. She has been in business for three years and has managed to employ two workers who help her to run the business. She needs a loan of Tshs800,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is a sari-sari (grocery) store owner. She lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, a town of 21,190 people. The place is agricultural and most livelihoods are from farming and livestock. Tessie is aware of the global crisis in most countries today including the Philippines. That is why she insists on having a business to earn a living for the family. She is 44 years old and still single.

She is asking for a loan of PHP23,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store, and this will help her store to expand.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start a business and fight poverty. They not only provide credit to their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia A. is a Tanzanian business woman who raises poultry. She raises both broilers and layers at Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. The broilers take only three months before maturity and layers take almost six months to give out the first product. She has been doing this business for three years. Income derived from the business is used to meet her family's daily demands. She needs a loan of Tshs1,000,000 to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To buy more chicks.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donata O. is a Tanzanian woman who has a small business. She runs a tailoring mart at Mbagala Rangi tatu Ward in Dar es Salaam. She makes different designs for both men's and women's clothes. Also, she makes school uniforms for school children. Donata also runs a poultry business of raising broilers and layers. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand her business by buying more products.

loans.use: To expand business.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema R. is a Tanzanian married woman who is an entrepreneur. She runs a business of tailoring at Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. She makes a variety of clothes in different designs for both men and women. She also makes school uniforms for school children. Her business is especially in demand during December and April. She has been in this business for six years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more materials.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en: Hamis S. is a Tanzanian businessman who is an entrepreneur. He runs two types of business at Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He runs a hardware shop from which varieties of hardware items are sold.  Also, he has a business of selling many varieties of bags, including school bags, at his bag shop. He has been in business for four years. He plans to expand the business by buying more products to meet his customers' demands. He needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more business products.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina K. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneurial woman. She runs a shop business at Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells different varieties of items, including food crop products such as wheat flour, sugar, cashew nuts, ground nuts, cooking oil, maize flour, and beans. She purchases the products direct from the wholesaler shops and producers. She has been doing this business for six years. She needs a loan of Tshs1,200,000 to buy more products.

loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. sells fabric and used clothing at Neizer in Elmina. Faustina has a junior high school education. She is single and has no children. Faustina has been selling used clothing since 1994. She is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. She has experienced an increase in demand from her customers, so her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to buy more fabric and thus increase sales.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward a house she wants to put up.

loans.use: To buy fabric and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent T. sells groceries like milk, Milo, canned products, soap and other goods near the Graphic house in Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Millicent has been selling groceries since 2004. She is responsible for assisting her husband with housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase sales and meet her customers' growing demands. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose E. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Rose sells clothing and fabric. She is a seamstress specializing in ladies' wear at Elmina chapel square, which she has done since 1990. Her husband is a painter. Rose uses her income to assist her husband with housekeeping expenses. Rose will use the loan to purchase a wide variety of fabrics and other sewing materials. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save toward a house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fabrics and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort D. has a senior high education and is the mother of three children. Her husband is a trader, and she assists him with the housekeeping expenses.

Since 2003 Comfort has run a restaurant in Adisadel village in Cape Coast, where she serves a variety of local dishes such as fufu (made from pounding together cassava and plantain). Her loan will be used to buy more spices, ingredients and food items for her restaurant. Comfort hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the completion of the family home.

loans.use: To buy more spices, ingredients and food items for her restaurant

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris T. sells fabrics and clothing in Pedu on the Cape Coast. Doris has received a senior-high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a trader.

Doris has been selling fabrics and clothing since 2002. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase sales of fabrics and other clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward a house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase sales of fabrics and other clothing

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel Y. is married and has 3 children. He has received schooling through tertiary level. Samuel sells rubbers; he is a tailor who is specialized making knitting at the satellite street near Elmina, which he has done since 1996. Samuel uses his income to providing food, clothing and other basic needs of the family. Samuel will use the loan as additional capital to enable him increase the sale of rubbers to meet the increase in demand by his costumers and also buy sewing materials, tools and implements to enhance his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to reinvest back for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: Samuel will use the loan as additional capital to enable him increase the sale of rubbers to meet the increase in demand by his costumers and also buy sewing materials, tools and implements to enhance his work.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. sells fish that she buys from the fishermen. She brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Ayisa in Elmina. Dora has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Dora has been selling fish since 1990. She is responsible for assisting her husband with housekeeping expenses. Her loan will increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: Her loan will increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en: Kojo A. is married and has 2 children. He has received no formal education. Kojo sells soft drinks at Bantama in Elmina, which he has done since 2000. His wife is a fish dealer. Kojo uses his income to provide food, clothing, and other basic necessities for his family. Kojo will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by his costumers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kojo plans to save towards a house he wants to build so that he can stop renting apartments.

loans.use: Kojo will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by his costumers.

loans.name: Wosila

texts.en: Wosila A. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through the primary level. Wosila sells food supplies like groundnuts and yams at the Abura market, which she has done since 1996. Her husband is a trader. Wosila uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Wosila will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies like groundnuts and yams to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Wosila plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Wosila will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies like groundnuts and yams to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy T. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Lucy sells slippers, shoes, saucepans, and clothing at Abura, which she has done since 2003. Her husband is a driver. Lucy uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Lucy will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of slippers, shoes, saucepans, and clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Lucy plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Lucy will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of slippers, shoes, saucepans, and clothing to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Hanatu

texts.en: Hanatu A. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Hanatu sells lining, threads, and other sewing materials at Abura, which she has done since 2004. Her husband is a trader. Hanatu uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Hanatu will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of lining, threads, and other sewing materials to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hanatu plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Hanatu will use the loan as additional capital to increase the sale of lining, threads, and other sewing materials to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu H. operates her own hair cream and cosmetics vending business at Abura. Her husband works as a trader. Zenabu opened her own business in 2007, and has been working ever since. She helps contribute to her household by paying and maintaining expenses. Zenabu is requesting a loan to expand her business and the range of her products, maximizing her outreach to potential customers.

loans.use: To expand her business and attract new customers

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita G. is married, and has three children. Her husband works as a trader. Rita sells a variety of bags, shoes and other footwear items at her own vending store. She began her own business in 2007, and has been working ever since. Rita contributes to the family budget, helps maintain expenses, and cares for the children. Rita is requesting a loan in order to increase the number of bags, shoes and other items she stocks to meet the increased demand from her customers. She hopes that this will help her business grow and increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her inventory in order to meet increased demand

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia manages a rolling store business. She sells vegetables that she used to sell in her village. Aside from vegetables, she also sells secondhand clothes in their village. Her weekly net income of PHP 750.00 was utilized for the school allowance of her children. She is now requesting a loan amount of PHP 7,000.00 that will be a big help in increasing her business capital and for business expansion. She wants to develop her business for it to progress and to meet the quality of life she desires for her family. “Believing that dreaming the impossible things in life is possible with God by having a deep faith in Him”, said Ofelia.

Ofelia is already 45 years old. Her husband Amado is a farmer in their rural village. They were blessed with seven children: Norberto - 27 years old, college level; Amado Jr. – 25 years old, college graduate; their twins Jeoffrey & Jeffrey - 23 years old, high school level; Anthony - 20 years old, high school level; Amelia - 17 years old, a high school student and Ana Mae - 9 years old, elementary student.

loans.use: To develop and expand a clothing and vegetable business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 38 years old and married to Duedy A., a farmer. The couple has three children: Deo, 20 years old, high school graduate; Jhon Rey - 17 years old, 1st year college; and their youngest is Romel - 9 years old, now in grade three. Her family resides in the rural area of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela.

Analyn has managed a hog raising business for almost a year. She is now planning to borrow from the lenders an amount of PHP5,000.00 in order to sustain the daily feed supply for her hogs. She hopes that her business will grow so she can further help her husband to support the needs of their family, especially the educational needs of their children.

“There is a reason for everything,” says Analyn. This simple quotation made her think of the possibilities of her ambitions in life, simply by believing and entrusting everything to the Lord.

loans.use: To purchase feed.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta J. is 38 years old and raises hogs in San Juan, Alicia, Isabela.  Her husband Teddy is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) and she was accompanied by their four children:  Charisma - 17 years old, second year college; Clarissa - 11 years old and Christel - 9 years old, both are studying at the primary level; and the youngest is Clifford - 5 years old.

Hog raising has been her business for a long time and served as her partner in supporting the education of her children while her husband is working abroad. She is hoping to expand her business and to accomplish this she would like to borrow from the lenders a loan amount of PHP 9,000.00. She will use the loan to sustain her business needs and buy feed and vaccines to maintain the health and growth of her hogs. She works hard for the education of her children and she was proud that by merely maintaining her hog raising business, she was able to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. She believes that through her hard work, she will become successful in business some day.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Perpetual N. is married and has two children. Her husband works as a commercial driver, while Perpetual operates her own vending service. She sells a variety of threads, lining, and other sewing materials at her own business, which she has owned since 2005. Perpetual is requesting a loan in order to meet the increased demand from her customers. She plans to reinvest her profits in order to expand her business and maximize her outreach to potential clientele.

loans.use: To meet increased demand from customers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is engaged in hog raising and direct selling businesses. Since her income from hog raising is only every four months, her income from direct selling is used for an allowance for her daughter and to feed her hogs.

Her eldest child had to stop studying due to lack of financial resources. She and her husband are doing their best to provide a better life for their family. This is the reason why she wants to borrow PHP5,000 in order to increase her business capital to improve her small businesses. She is hoping that through her businesses, she could send her son to school to pursue his studies for a better future.

Cecilia J. is 44 years old and married to Simon, a farmer. Their two children are: Ferdinand - 18, high school graduate and Nancy - 15 years old, a fourth year high school student.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
“My hog raising business is a big help to my family, especially to sustain our needs,” said Kristine, a 31 years old hog raiser in the village of San Juan in Alicia, Isabela. She was married to Andre, a farmer and village secretary. They have a five year old daughter named Lyka, a nursery student.

Kristine wants a loan amounting to PHP7,000 for her hog raising business. She wants to expand her business in vegetable and food vending to further sustain the needs of their family. Kristine longs for a comfortable and progressive life and is willing to work hard for the realization of her ambition in life.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla, age 37, is happily married to Claudio, a tricycle operator of their own motorcycle. The couple was blessed with two children: Clariza - 13 years old, high school sophomore and Claudio P. Jr. – 7 years old, an elementary student. Their family is living in a peaceful community in San Juan, Alicia, Isabela.

With their tricycle transport business, her husband is able to earn money for their family and able to support the education of their children. However, their income is not enough to sustain their daily needs. Perla wanted to borrow PHP 6,000 in order to help her husband financially.

She plans to invest her loan to sell assorted goods, which includes second hand clothes, kitchen utensils and other selling products for retail to earn an income. Perla wants to achieve all her dreams in life and give her children a quality education. She also hopes that she becomes successful in the business and has a good and spiritually transformed family.

loans.use: Sell assorted goods.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Since 1998, Fernando O. has been engaged in the hog raising business. He decided to maintain this kind of business because it is really a big help to his family, especially for the upcoming education of his three children. His regular income from his hogs also supports his farming activity, which produces income only twice a year.

To further improve his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 in order to purchase a supply of feed for his hogs. Fernando believes that through the support of the lenders, his business will progress.

Fernando is 33 years old and married to Alma, a housewife. They are blessed with three kids: Adrian is 5 years old and already in the nursery level; Aubrey is 3 years old; and the youngest is Ashley, who is 2 years old. They are happily living in the village of San Juan, in Alicia, Isabela, a rural area where rice farming is the major source of income of the residents.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his hogs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old and the mother of three children. Her husband Ruben is a jeepney driver (a jeepney is a four-wheel type of jeep). Their children are Joan, who is 17 years old and a second-year college student; Lea, who is 14 years old and a third-year high school; and Angelica, who is 6 years old and in grade one. They are currently living in a harmonious relationship in baranggay San Juan, in Alicia, Isabela.

Marissa's husband operates their jeepney from their village to the town proper. Sometimes their jeepney is used as a service, especially during harvest season--it brings their harvest from their farm to their house. Some farmers also rent their jeep during harvest season.

In addition to operating their jeepney, Marissa wants to start a small village store for additional income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to pursue her plan. This is also her way of assisting her husband to meet the growing needs of their family. She is glad that they also have their farm as a source of income twice a year.

loans.use: To open a village store

loans.name: Wosani

texts.en: Wosani H.  is married and has three children. Her husband works as a commercial driver, while Wosani operates her own groceries business. She sells a variety of food items at her own store, which she has owned since 1994. Wosani is requesting a loan in order to stock items such as milk, Milo, and other canned products to provide to her customers. She plans to reinvest her profits in order to expand her business and maximize her outreach to potential clientele.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and provide new food items

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia A. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Sophia sells porridge in the mornings to her costumers, who might not be able to eat breakfast before leaving their homes at Poly near Abura. Sophia has run her own business since 2005. Her husband works as a carpenter, and Sophia uses her income to assist her husband in the house keeping expenses. Sophia will use the loan as additional capital to enable the range of foods she offers, and expand her clientele. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sophia plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and production range

loans.name: Fedela

texts.en: Fedela A. N. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Fedela sells lining and other sewing materials and also mobile phone credit cards in Abura, which she has done since 2005. Her husband is a laboratory technician. Fedela uses her income to assist her husband in paying their household expenses. Fedela will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of lining and other sewing materials as well as mobile phone credit cards to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Fedela plans to reinvest the new profits into her business.

loans.use: To expand sewing material and mobile phone credit card inventory

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond N. is a photographer who goes to cover programmes and ceremonies with his video camera at a fee in Abura. Raymond has received a senior high education. He is married and has one child.

Raymond has been a photographer since 2004. He is responsible for providing food, clothing, and the other basic needs of his family. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him buy photography items to improve the quality of his services to his customers. He hopes to reinvest the new profits back into his business for the expansion of his photography work.

loans.use: To buy photography items to improve the quality of his services

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 18 años en una casa arrendada. Hace 3 años Isabel y su esposo decidieron abrir una vulcanizadora ubicada en una zona industrial de su ciudad, donde abundan el tránsito de vehículos de diversos tamaños, es por ello que Isabel ha visto el incremento de sus clientes, que son los conductores de los vehículos que acuden cuando las llantas de sus movilidades no tiene suficiente aire de compresión o si necesitan la reparación de la cámara interna de las llantas, y para ello tienen su principal herramienta de trabajo que es su máquina compresora y sus demás herramientas. La atención que brindan en su establecimiento es de 8 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde, ya que son horarios de más recurrencia de sus clientes. Ahora, junto con su esposo quieren dedicarse a la venta de llantas nuevas y de segundo uso. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está decidida a emprender un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de llantas al por mayor y venderlas en su vulcanizadora.
texts.en:
Isabel is 37-years old and lives with her husband and 18-year old son in a rented house. It has been 3-years since Isabel and her husband have opened up a vulcanization (rubber welding) business in the industrial zone of the city, where there is an abundance of transit vehicles of all sizes. It’s for this reason that Isabel has seen an increase in customers, that are conductors who need to fill their tires or replace the inner chambers. She has the best compression machine and other tools.

She provides great attention to her services from 8 AM to 6 in the afternoon, as they have a busy schedule of or reoccurring clients. Now, with her husband, they have decided to sell new and used tires. This is their second loan request through MFP and they are determined to excel with their community bank. The funds for this request will be invested in the purchase of wholesale tires and to sell their vulcanization machine.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a criar animales como ovejas y cuyes, desde hace 2 años y medio. Durante el día trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad, y por las tarde cuida de sus animales. Al fin de mes, toma a los animales que están con un buen peso y los lleva a vender a las ferias ganaderas de su región. Para Maria esta actividad no es absorbente, lo ve como una recreación, por el momento con las ganancias que obtiene puede solventar algunas de sus necesidades, pero más adelante no solo quiere dedicarse a vender sus animales, sino que también quiere tener su propio negocio de venta de productos alimenticios. Es la primera vez para Maria participa en un  banco comunal, por lo que es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella quiere aportar al desarrollo de su grupo y mejorar cada día. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales y con una mínima parte comprará los útiles escolares de su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and 3 children at her parent’s home. For the last 2.5 years, she has dedicated herself to raising raising sheep and guinea pigs. All day she works in the town center and in the afternoons she takes care of her animals. At the end of the month, she takes the animals that have good weight and sells them at the livestock markets in their area.

For Maria this isn’t a burdensome activity, she looks at it as a hobby and for the time being the profits she earns help her realize a few of her needs. She doesn’t only want to sell animals, but also wants to have a proper business selling food items as well. This is the first time Maria has participated in the community bank as it’s also the first loan request through the MFP. She wants to contribute to the development of the group to better it each day. The funds for this request will go towards purchasing a balanced diet for her animals and a small portion will goes towards purchasing school supplies for her youngest child.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a balanced diet for her animals

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su madre. Desde hace 10 años trabaja bordando fustanes en la comodidad de su casa, donde siempre dispone de algún ambiente para la realización de su trabajo, Cada día está pendiente de cada detalle de sus bordados, porque de ello depende el producto final, además siempre ha tenido la idea de entregar un trabajo bien hecho para garantizar el retorno de sus clientes, los que  actualmente confían en ella y es considerada una de las mejores bordadoras de su zona. Para Maritza ser reconocida de este modo la satisface mucho y la anima a continuar con este éxito personal, y lo económico también la motiva a continuar en esta actividad. Para el futuro está planificando expandir su mercado para conseguir más pedidos y hacer crecer su negocio. Es la primera vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las más entusiastas de formar parte de su banco comunal y está decidida a hacer un trabajo solidario. El dinero que solicita es para comprar fardos de tela de diversos colores y también hilos de bordar por conos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 27-years old and lives with her husband and 2-children at her mother’s house. For the last 10-years, she has been embroidering fustanes in the comfort of her home, where there is always a quiet place for her to work. Each day entails something different in the embroidery of her final product. She always gets an idea and delivers on a job well done to ensure that her clients return. In actuality, she has gained the trust of her clients and is considered the best embroiderer in the region.

For Maritza to be recognized in this way brings her great satisfaction and encourages her to reach her personal best. Even in this economy, she is motivated to continue with this activity. For the future, she is planning to expand into the market to generate more orders and grow the business. This is the first request for a loan with MFP and she is very enthusiastic about forming a partnership with the community bank. Maritza is determined to put forward solid work and the funds will go towards purchasing looms of cloth of different colors and also cones of embroidery thread.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase materials for embroidery

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Natalia tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo en casa de su suegra. Desde hace 2 años se dedica al bordado, actividad que realiza en la comodidad de su casa y de paso atiende a su hijo menor, esta labor no requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, y siempre gusta de combinar los colores en los fustanes que borda, para ella es un arte que cada día cultiva y desea mejorar. Además, que esta actividad es bien recompensada, ya que cada fustán dependiendo de su complejidad  puede llegar a costar hasta mil soles y eso es muy rentable. Según el tiempo de entrega de su trabajo puede llegar a bordar hasta 2 fustanes en un día. Para el futuro, Natalia quiere aumentar su producción, para lograrlo contratará a personas que sepan bordar tan bien como ella. Es la primera que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está decidida a ser una integrante muy activa en su banco comunal. Con el dinero requerido comprará telas e hilos de bordar grandes cantidades para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Natalia is 26 years old and lives with her husband in her mother-in-law's house. For two years now, she has an embroidery business which she administers from her home, and as it doesn't require a great physical effort, she is also able to care for her youngest son.

She likes combining colors in the fustians she creates; for her, it's an art that she cultivates and wants to get better at every day. Also, this activity is well-paid and depending on how complex, a fustian can sell for up to 1000 soles (3 soles = $1USD, approx.), which is very profitable. Depending on time of delivery, Natalia can make up to 2 fustians in a day.

For the future, Natalia would like to increase production by hiring people who can embroider as well as she can.

This is Natalia's first loan with MFP and plans on being a very active associate of the Communal Bank. With this loan, Natalia will buy a large quantity of fabrics and thread for embroidery, in order to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for embroidery

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo tiene 28 años, vive con sus padres en casa de ellos. Se dedica a ser conductor de una movilidad de transporte público desde hace 7 años, que decidió alquilar un auto y trabajar de manera independiente para generarse sus propios recursos económicos, desde entonces no ha parado de trabajar cubriendo una ruta establecida, ya que su auto está inscrito en una línea de transporte colectivo de su localidad y su horario de trabajo es desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Para Percy dedicarse a esta actividad fue asumir un riesgo que hoy celebra porque es independiente económicamente y está planeando comprase una movilidad propia para seguir progresando. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él fue invitado a formar parte de este banco comunal porque  es conocido como un joven responsable y puntual cuando debe dinero. La cantidad que está solicitando es para la compra de 4 llantas y el pago de la tarjeta de circulación expedida por su municipalidad.
texts.en:
Pablo is 28 years old, and lives with his parents in their house. He dedicates himself to being a public transportation driver, which he has done for 7 years. He decided to rent a car and work independently in order to generate his own income. Since then, he hasn’t stopped working an established route, as his car is registered with a collective transportation line of his locality. His schedule is from 7 am to 8 pm at night. To dedicate himself to this work was a risky decision that today he celebrates because he is financially independent. He plans to buy his own transportation to continue getting ahead. This is the first time he requests a loan with MFP. He was invited to become part of the cooperative bank because he is known to be a responsible young man, and punctual when he owes money. The amount he is requesting is for the purchase of 4 tires, and to pay for the operational permit issued by his municipality.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires and pay for his operating permit.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa de su hermana. Desde hace 19 años vende comida en una de las principales calles de la ciudad de Huancayo, y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Prepara los alimentos por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a la venta de sus platos, terminando el día tiene la satisfacción de haber realizado este trabajo, que en muchas veces llega a ser agotador por las largas horas de preparación de los alimentos y luego la limpieza de todos sus utensilios. Pero sus pocas horas de sueño y su esfuerzo tienen sus recompensas, pues las ganancias que obtiene son muy buenas. Debido a la buena sazón que tiene Paulina, sus clientes están aumentando y para el futuro desea arrendar un local para poder abrir un restaurante. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada por el trabajo que va a realizar en su grupo dentro de su banco comunal. La cantidad que está solicitando será invertida en la compra de nuevos platos y cubiertos, además de sacos de abarrotes que son los ingredientes básicos para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Paulina is 45 years old and she lives with her husband and three children in her sister’s house. For 19 years she has sold food in one of the main streets of the city of Huancaya, and her children help her with this on many occasions. Preparing food in the mornings and evenings, she is dedicated to the sale of her meals. At the end of the day she has the satisfaction of having performed this work but she is often exhausted by the long hours preparing the food and after cleaning all of her utensils. But her few hours of sleep and her efforts have their rewards: as her earnings are very good. Thanks to Paulina’s good cooking skills, her clients are increasing and in the future she would like to rent a place to open a restaurant in. This is the first time that she has had a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is very enthusiastic about the work she will carry out in her group with her communal bank. The amount that she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of new plates and serving dishes, in addition to bags of groceries which are the basic ingredients for the preparation of her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her food

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl vive con su madre y su hijo de 10 años en casa de sus padres. Se dedica al servicio técnico dental, realiza todo tipo de postizos dentales de diversas calidades y según la necesidad de sus clientes, actividad que viene ejerciendo desde hace más de medio año. Previamente se preparó estudiando para poder desarrollar esta actividad, y en la actualidad ha notado que tiene buenos logros por la calidad de los productos que realiza. Su trabajo le da mucha satisfacción, porque siente que es el oficio le permite desarrollar todo su potencial, razón por la cual está planeando abrir en los próximos meses su laboratorio dental en una zona céntrica de su ciudad. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos, así como a participar activamente en su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de los materiales necesarios para su oficio, como cera dental, yeso, moldes, entre otros, ya que necesita cubrir los últimos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Raúl lives with his mother and his 10 year old son in his parent’s house. He works as a dental technician, putting in all types of dental prosthetics according to the needs of his customers, a job he has worked at for more than 6 months. Previously he undertook studies to develop this skill, and now he has had success because of the quality of the products he makes. His work gives him a lot of satisfaction, because he feels that the job has allowed him to develop to his full potential and because of this he is planning to open his own dental laboratory in the center of the city in the coming months. This is the first time that he has had a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he promises to be punctual with his payments and also to actively participate in his communal bank. The money that he is asking for is for the purchase of the items necessary for his office and also for dental wax, plaster, molds, among other things, as he needs to cover his recent orders.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for the manufacture of dental prosthetics

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica al transporte desde hace más de 15 años, esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo, tienen 3 autos y sus 2 hijos mayores son los conductores de dos de ellos, brindando el servicio de taxi. Cada día, Segundina se levanta temprano para preparar los autos y revisar todo lo necesario, luego prepara el desayuno para toda su familia y cuida de sus hijos menores mientras controla la ruta de los autos. Esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingresos para la familia de Segundina, les permite cubrir los gastos y solventar la educación de los hijos menores. Su meta es adquirir nuevas carros, modernos que es lo que exige la municipalidad de su localidad para seguir funcionando. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las más activas de su  banco comunal y parte de la junta directiva de su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en el mantenimiento de sus tres movilidades, para que sigan  funcionando en perfecto estado.
texts.en:
Segundina is 41 years old and she lives with her husband and four kids in a house that they own. She has worked in the transport business for more than 15 years. This work she does together with her husband and they have three cars and their two oldest children are the drivers of two of them, providing taxi services. Every day Segundina wakes up early to prepare the cars and to go over everything that is needed, afterwards she makes breakfast for the whole family and caring for the younger children while she governs the routes of the taxis. This activity is the principal source of income for Segundina’s family, and it allows them to cover their expenses and provide for the educations of the younger children. Her goal is to acquire new, modern cars which are required by her municipality for continued operation. This is the third time that she has had a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is one of the most active people in her communal bank and is part of the board of directors of her group. The money that she is requesting is for investment in the maintenance of her three vehicles so that they continue working in perfect condition.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of her taxis

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan tiene 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a los bordados, trabajo que realiza en su  casa durante todo el día después de atender a sus pequeños. Luego de trabajar durante un mes, vende toda su producción, por medio de su hermana que se dedica a llevar sus bordados a quienes los solicitan, generalmente existe mayor durante las diversas festividades típicas de la zona. Susan ha notado que con el correr del tiempo los ingresos para su hogar se han ido incrementando debido al esfuerzo que realiza con sus bordados.  Es por ello, que para el futuro quiere seguir dedicándose a esta actividad produciendo cada vez más, y para ello también comprara un puesto de venta donde ofrecer sus bordados. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por su parte se compromete a ser una persona muy diligente en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en sus bordados, va a comprar telas y pagará una parte de lo que cuesta adquirir su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Susan is 20 years old and lives in her parents' house with her husband and their two children. She has been embroidering for three years, working from home during the day after taking care of her little ones. After working for a month, she sells everything she's made through her sister, who takes the embroideries to people who request them. There tends to be more demand during the region's various festivals. Susan has noticed that over time her household earnings have grown thanks to her embroidery work. Because of that, she'd like to continue this work in the future and produce greater quantities. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being responsible with her payments. She will use the requested loan for her embroidery, buying fabric and paying a portion of the cost of securing a market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her embroidery

loans.name: Jameda

texts.en: Jameda A. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received schooling through tertiary education. Jameda sells pastries at Abura, which she has done since 1994. Her husband is an accountant. Jameda uses her income to assist her husband in paying the household expenses. Jameda will use the loan to increase her stock of flour and other ingredients to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She plans to reinvest the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: For stocks of ingredients to increase bakery output

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: Gregoria es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 39 años todavía tiene muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando, vive con su esposo Teodoro de su misma edad y sus tres hijos; Ángel de 18, Walter de 17 y Alex 3 años, en la casa que consiguieron con mucho sacrificio. La tienda más concurrida del barrio El Carmen de la ciudad de Juliaca, la tiene Gregoria, quien lleva a su humilde localidad los abarrotes más necesarios y útiles para sus pobladores. Ella lleva en este negocio cerca de 5 años y lo que considera más difícil de su trabajo es permanecer todo el día en su negocio sin poder salir, ya que tiene que estar presente cada vez que alguien viene a comprar un producto, pero es muy feliz vendiendo sus productos y satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes. Para el futuro de su negocio, quiere ampliar su tienda y tener en almacén con muchos más productos, puesto que su barrio está creciendo. Es el tercer préstamo de Gregoria con MFP, sus primeros créditos los pagó puntualmente y sin problemas, es la socia más activa y solidaria de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querida. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead. At 39 years old, she still has a lot of energy to keep working. She lives with her husband Teodoro, also 39, and her three sons, Ángel (18), Walter (17), and Alex (3), in the house they managed to acquire through great sacrifice. Gregoria has the most frequented store in the El Carmen neighborhood of Juliaca, and she brings vital and useful groceries to her humble community. She has been in this business close to five years, and what she finds most difficult is having to be in her store all day without being able to leave, since she needs to be there whenever anyone comes to buy something. But she's very happy selling her products and satisfying her customers' needs. In the future, she'd like to expand her shop and have a space with many more products, since her neighborhood is growing. This is Gregoria's third loan with MFP. She paid her other loans punctually and without any problems. She is the most active and involved member of her communal bank, and is well-liked. She will use the requested money to buy more merchandise to stock her store better.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods to stock store

loans.name: Silvia Adriana

texts.es: La sra. Silvia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, trabaja desde hace tiempo en la institución, vive con su esposo y con sus dos hijos en edad escolar, ella ayuda con los gastos de la casa con esta actividad. Vende sus productos por la zona y a las sras. del colegio de sus hijos. Es una cliente muy responsable, invertirá el crédito en la compra de productos para el día del padre.
texts.en:
Silvia dedicates herself to cosmetics catalog sales, having worked with the institution for some time. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. Through her enterprise, she helps pay for the household expenses. She sells her products throughout the zone, and to the women from her children’s school. She is a very responsible client, and will invest the loan into buying products for Father’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and colognes for Father's Day.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married and has three children. She has received no formal education. Mary sells groceries like milk, Milo, canned products and other iems in Abura, which she has done since 1994. Her husband is a plumber. Mary uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses.

Mary will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase stocks of groceries like milk, Milo, canned products and others to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest back in the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To increase stock of groceries like milk, Milo, canned products and other items

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 42 años, es una mujer divorciada, que se dedica mucho al trabajo, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres con sus 3 hijos; Luís de 11, Carlos de 8 y Cristian de 5 y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. Incursionó en el negocio de la venta de medicina natural hace 2 años, con el pasar del tiempo sus clientes han ido en ascenso y cada vez vende más, ella sale a vender ambulatoriamente sus hierbas medicinales por la calles de Juliaca. Hermelinda disfruta del olor que las hierbas emanan cuando están en reposo, tiene pensado alquilar una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos con mayor tranquilidad y atender mejor a sus clientes, porque actualmente lo hace caminando y eso es lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo. Hermelinda quiere mucho a su familia, por ello quiere tener una economía estable. Son ya 4 préstamos a los que a accedido Hermelinda con MFP y es muy puntual en sus pagos, siempre está pendiente de no atrasarse, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y le gusta trabajar en equipo. Invertirá todo el dinero que solicita en incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprando más hierbas medicinales.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 42-years-old, divorced and very hard-working. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents with her 3 children: Luis is 11, Carlos is 8 and Cristian is 5. She wants very much to better herself.

She started selling natural medicines two years ago. Her customer base has grown over time and she continues to sell more and more, going out and selling her medicinal herbs in the streets of Juliaca. Hermelinda likes the fragrance of the herbs when they are resting and she is thinking about renting a store where she could sell her products in greater tranquility and provide better customer service. Her least favourite part of being a street vendor is all the walking around.

Hermelinda loves her family very much and wants to provide them with financial stability. She has already received 4 loans through MFP and is very punctual with her repayments, always making sure not to get behind. She is very happy with her communal bank and enjoys working in a team. She will invest all the money as working capital to buy more medicinal herbs.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel a sus 43 años, es una madre de familia muy preocupada por el bienestar de su hogar, vive en su propia casa con sus 3 hijos; Edith de 14, Cristian de 12 y Kelly de 8 años, a los que quiere dar una buena educación y una mejor vida. Su negocio es la fabricación de adornos, como perlitas de fantasía, lentejuelas, etc, vende sus adornos a bordadores y artesanos, a los cuales les da un muy buen precio por su trabajo. Isabel  gusta de vender sus adornos y más aun si acaba toda su mercadería, lo cual pasa con frecuencia. Lo difícil es trasladar sus adornos hasta los lugares donde los tiene que vender, ya que le es muy cansado y el transporte le sale muy caro. Ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y espera incrementar la cantidad de adornitos que fabrica, porque es conciente que solo así podrá incrementar su economía y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos. Isabel se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP, y está dispuesta a pagarlo por completo, para acceder a uno nuevo, confía plenamente en las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más materiales para fabricar sus adornos y así incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 43-year-old mother who is very concerned about the well-being of her family. She has three children named Edith, Cristian and Kelly, aged 14, 12 and 8. She would like to afford them a good education and a better life.

Isabel has a handicraft business; she makes decorations out of beads, sequins, etc. She sells her decorations to seamstresses and artisans who give her a good price for her work. Isabel enjoys selling her decorations, especially when all her merchandise sells out – something that happens frequently. The difficulty is transferring her material to all the places she needs to sell, because it's tiring and transportation is expensive.

She's had this business for 4 years and hopes to increase the amount of decorations she crafts as she is conscious of the fact that increasing her income is the only way to give her children a better education.

This is Isabel's second loan with MFP and she's prepared to pay it back in full. Isabel is well-loved by the associates of the Communal Bank and counts on their support. With this loan, she will buy more material to make her decorations and as such increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for her handicrafts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer trabajadora, que a sus 40 años es madre soltera, vive en una casa alquilada y quiere salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), tiene un pequeño lugar donde vende choclos, montada en su triciclo sale todas las mañanas muy temprano, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general acaba con todos los choclos que vende. Tiene 8 años en este negocio, el cual le a dado el dinero para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner una tienda, donde pueda vender más cosas y así mejorar su ingresos económicos. A Maria le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil caminar todo el día empujando su triciclo bajo el ardiente sol, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este es el tercer préstamo de Maria con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita planea comprar más choclos y arreglar su triciclo.
texts.en:
Maria is a single, hard-working, 40-year old who lives in a rented house and wants to move ahead in her life and increase her income. She sells corn in a small space at the Santa Barbara market, a big market in the city of Juliaca. She heads out on her 3-wheel bicycle, early every morning. She sells out of corn almost every day, as her kiosk is much frequented. She has had this business for 8 years and it has allowed her the means to feed her children and pay their studies. She worries, however, that in the future her expenses will increase and her income won't. That's why she wants to have a store in which she can sell more items and in turn, increase her income. This is her third loan with MFP and she hopes to pay it on time so as not to cause problems with her village bank. Maria likes talking to her clients, she enjoys it very much, but it's difficult for her to walk all day and pedal or push the 3-wheel bicycle under the hot sun. However, that won't deter her from success and she's determined to work hard to achieve it. This is Maria's third loan with MFP and she hopes to pay it all back on time. With this loan, she plans to buy more corn and fix her 3-wheel bicycle.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase amount of merchandise

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine Y. sells porridge in the mornings to her customers who might not take their breakfast before leaving their homes at Abura. She has been selling porridge since 2007.

Justine has received junior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is an auto mechanic. She is responsible for assisting her husband with their housekeeping expenses. 

Justine's loan will enable her to purchase additional food items for the preparation of the porridge to meet an increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items and meet an increase in demand.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa V., se dedica a la atención de su tienda hace 4 años, es ella quien reparte su tiempo tanto a su familia como a su negocio es un persona responsable y trabajadora, trabaja en nuestra institución desde el 2001 mostrando desde siempre puntualidad en sus pagos y seriedad en su trabajo, es la segunda vez que se le otorga un crédito Kiva. Es madre soltera tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa V. has had her store for 4 years. She divides her time between her family and business. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She has worked with our institute since 2001 always being punctual with her payments and seriousness toward her work. This is the second time that she is receiving a Kiva loan. She is a single mother with two school-aged children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise (oil, sugar, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es: Ninfa es una mujer de 36 años, sencilla y trabajadora, es madre de dos niños muy juguetones, vive en su casa propia a base de adobe. En la tranquilidad de su hogar, Ninfa tiene su tienda de abarrotes donde vende diversos productos a precios muy cómodos, a la cual sus clientes concurren frecuentemente en busca de los productos que más necesitan. En sus 5 años en este negocio, lo más difícil para Ninfa es llevar los productos hasta su tienda, ya que vive muy lejos, pero sabe que eso no es impedimento para alcanzar sus metas y hacer crecer más su tienda, ya que disfruta mucho de vender y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además que de esta forma poco a poco está saliendo adelante, forjándose un buen futuro. Es el primer préstamo de Ninfa con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará más productos para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a hard-working, 36-year-old mother of two playful children. She owns her own house made of adobe. In the comfort of her home, Ninfa has a grocery store and sells diverse products at competitive rates. Her customers frequent her store, looking for items they need the most. In the 5 years she has had this business, the most difficult part has been getting her merchandise to her store. She lives far away but she doesn't let that prevent her from reaching her goal of growing her business. Ninfa enjoys having her business and the more she works, the better she feels. Also, this way, little by little she is pushing ahead, forging a good future. This is Ninfa's first loan with MFP and she hopes to be punctual with her payments so as not to cause problems with her village bank, with which she is very happy. With this loan of 1000 soles (3 soles = $1 USD, approx.), Ninfa will buy more merchandise to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase amount of merchandise

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 31 años, vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres, es muy trabajadora y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. Es dueña del restaurante más concurrido de su barrio, siempre está muy alegre y recibe con una sonrisa a sus clientes diarios, disfruta de atenderlos y brindarles la mejor atención posible, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de su negocio. Norma lleva 6 años en esta actividad y espera posteriormente poder abrir una sucursal de su restaurante en una zona más comercial, donde pueda vender su comida a muchas más personas y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos, ya que actualmente tiene muchos clientes que vienen desde muy lejos a probar su deliciosa sazón. Lo complicado de este negocio es preparar diariamente comida para casi doscientas personas. Es el quinto préstamo de Norma con MFP, y se siente en la capacidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta de pertenecer. Este dinero le ayudará a incrementar su capital de trabajo, planea invertir todo el crédito en comprar las cosas que necesita para implementar más adelante un nuevo restaurante.
texts.en:
Norma is 31 years old and lives in the house her parents left her. She's a hard worker and is ready to excel in her life.

She is the owner of the most frequented restaurant in the neighborhood. She's always happy and greets her daily clientele with a smile; she enjoys serving them and giving them the best attention possible, as she knows the success of her business depends on them.

Norma has had this business for 6 years and in the future, hopes to open a locale in a more commercial area because already, many of her customers come from far away to try her delicious flavours. This would allow her to serve many more customers and, inevitably, increase her income. The difficult part of her job is to prepare meals for approximately 200 people a day.

This is Norma's 5th loan with MFP and she feels capable of paying it back on time because she trusts in her business and in the Communal Bank, of which she is happy being an associate.

This loan will help Norma increase her working capital. She plans on investing her gains in all the things she needs to implement a new restaurant in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and utensils in order to open her next restaurant.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es un joven de 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, a los que quiere mucho y tiene la responsabilidad de cuidar, él quiere mejorar sus ingresos para darles una mejor vida a sus padres. Oscar pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios y poner una tienda donde vende variedad de productos, trasladar los productos hasta su tienda es lo más difícil, pero sabe que es parte de su trabajo, disfruta mucho de vender y más si es a clientes conocidos, tiene ya 5 años en este negocio y tiene planeado para el futuro ampliar su tienda y hacerla más grande, donde pueda vender sus productos de manera más cómoda y les pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Aunque es muy joven, Oscar es conciente que tiene una responsabilidad con sus padres y es por eso que trabaja sin descanso, anhela darles una vida digna y feliz. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, nunca ha tenido problemas en su pagos, pues siempre ahorra para pagarlos a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querido, pues siempre llega muy puntual. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su tienda, invertirá todo el monto en ello.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young 20-year-old. He lives with his parents, whom he loves dearly, and has the responsibility of taking care of them. He wants to increase his income in order to give his parents a better life.

Oscar was able to finish high school and open a store where he sells a variety of products. The hardest part of his business is getting the merchandise to his store, but he knows it's part of the job. He enjoys selling, especially when it's to clients he knows.

He's had this business for 5 years and plans to expand the size of the store in order to sell his products in a more comfortable space and better serve his customers.
