Although he's very young, Oscar knows he has a responsibility to his parents and that's why he works without rest; he dreams of giving them a happy and dignified life.

This is Oscar's 5th loan with MFP. He has never had any problems with payments as he always saves enough to pay on time. He is a very loved associate of the Communal Bank and is always punctual. With this loan, Oscar will buy more merchandise to stock his store.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase amount of merchandise

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica F. sells foodstuffs at Abura. She has been doing so since 1990.

Monica has received primary level education. She is married and has 5 dependants. She is responsible for assisting her husband with their housekeeping expenses. 

Monica's loan will enable her to increase the foodstuffs she sells to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs to meet an increase in demand.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina es una mujer de 26 años, vive en su propia casa con su esposo Emilio de 30 años, tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida, es por eso que trabaja duro. Desde muy niña se preocupó por aprender las actividades ganaderas, lo que aprendió de sus padres. Ahora ella se dedica a la venta de fibra de alpaca, la cual vende en la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, la fibra que vende es de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual se vende rápidamente. A Reina le es muy cansado trasladar toda la fibra para venderla, eso es lo más difícil de su trabajo, pero sabe que tiene que hacerlo para tener ingresos económicos, con los cuales en el futuro pueda comprar un carro para trasladar con mayor facilidad la fibra. Tiene ya 4 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es la venta y conversar con sus clientes que siempre la buscan para comprarle. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha pagado sus cuotas a tiempo, y dice que ahora no será la excepción, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyarán y la guiarán, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con el dinero solicitado pretende comprar más fibra de alpaca para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Reina is a 26 year old woman who lives in her own house with her husband, 30 year old Emilio. She really wants to get ahead in life, and this is why she works so hard. Since she was very young she has concerned herself with finding ways to make money, which she learned from her parents. Currently she sells alpaca wool in a market in the city of Juliaca. Her wool is of a very high quality, so it sells very quickly. It is very tiring for Reina to take all the wool to market, and this is the hardest part of her work. But she knows that he has to do it to earn money, which she will eventually use to buy a car in order to transport the wool more easily. She has been doing this for four years, and what she likes best is selling and chatting with her customers, who are always seeking her out.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she always made her payments on time, and says that this loan will be no exception. She wants to eventually take out more loans which she will use to improve her business. She knows very well that in her communal bank, they will support and guide her, because she is a well-loved member of the group. With this loan she plans to buy more alpaca wool to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah B. sells local dishes known as Banku and Kenkey in Abura. She also fries fish to sell. Hannah has been doing this since 2008.

Hannah received no formal education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a sanitary officer. Hannah uses her income to assist her husband with their housekeeping expenses.

Hannah will use her loan to buy more corn to increase the sale of Kenkey and meet an increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits Hannah plans to reinvest in the expansion of her trade in the Kenkey business.

loans.use: To buy more corn to increase the sale of Kenkey and meet an increase in demand.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es una mujer que desea progresar en la vida, a sus 45 años es madre de 2 hijos Katherine de 24 años y Anthony de 14, a quienes cuida con mucho amor y dedicación, vive en su casa propia de manera independiente y quiere darle unos buenos estudios a sus hijos. Se dedica a alquilar habitaciones a las personas que desean tener un lugar seguro donde quedarse, es una dueña de casa muy alegre, le gusta su negocio porque se divierte mucho conversando con sus inquilinos. Lleva 6 años en esta actividad y lo más difícil de su trabajo, es tener que tratar con algunos inquilinos que no quieren pagar el alquiler de la habitación, aun así sabe que tiene que ponerle todas sus ganas y esfuerzo para salir adelante, puesto que quiere brindarles a sus hijos una buena vida y unos adecuados estudios. Adicionalmente, en un futuro cercano,  desea poner una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda vender diversos productos a sus vecinos y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Es el tercer préstamo de Sonia con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que siempre ahorra para poder pagarlas, en su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre está pendiente del bienestar de las demás socias. Sonia invertirá los mil quinientos soles que requiere en arreglar las habitaciones que alquila, para así poder subir el alquiler de sus habitaciones.
texts.en:
Sonia is a woman who wants to get ahead in life, and at 45 years old is the mother of two children: 24 year old Katherine and Anthony, who is 14. She takes care of them with a lot of love and dedication, and she lives in her own house, independently, and wants to give her children a good education. She rents rooms to people who want a safe and secure place to stay, and she is the owner of a very happy home. She likes this business because she really enjoys chatting with her tenants. She has been doing this for six years, and the toughest part of her work is dealing with tenants who don't want to pay the rent. She knows that she has to motivate herself and make a strong effort to keep moving forward, because she wants to give her children a good life and an adequate education. Additionally, in the near future, she would like to have a little grocery store where she could sell a variety of products to her neighbors and in this way increase her income.

This will be Sonia's third loan with MPF, and she is very punctual with her payments, because she always saves in order to make them on time. She is a very active member of her communal bank and she is always concerned with the wellbeing of the rest of the group. Sonia will invest the 1500 soles in fixing up rooms to rent in order to increase the rental rate of her rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to the rooms that she rents out

loans.name: Caracato Group

texts.es:
El grupo Caracato estuvo integrado por tres personas, todas se encontraban en la zona de Alto Obrajes y por la misma calle, la Sra. Victoria con su tienda, la Sra. Valentina con la preparación de comida y la Sra. Julia con la venta de mantas, asi trabajaron hasta la secuencia tercera, luego la Sra. Julia se retiro voluntariamente, quedando el grupo solo de dos personas, que hasta la fecha llegan a su novena secuencia.
La Sra. Victoria B. tiene dos hijas y una nieta, ella quedo viuda hace dos años, sus hijas le colaboran con los gastos del hogar, ya que ambas trabajan y estudian, además de la atención de la tienda, ella reparte masitas a los colegios y también salteñas que elabora, por lo que necesita más capital especialmente en esta época de clases, ya que su mercado son los establecimientos educativos de la zona.
En cuanto a la Sra. Valentina, ella trabaja como empleada del hogar en una casa de Obrajes desde hace 25 años, pero desde hace cinco ella radica allí y su actividad económica realiza fines de semana con la preparación de comidas buffet y otros pedidos que tiene por la zona, tiene dos hijos, que estudian en la Universidad, ella corre con todos los gastos de estudio, en cuanto a la alimentación y vivienda tiene costo mínimo por que la familia donde trabaja los consideran como parte de ella.
 Ambas señoras son muy amigas y trabajan bien con el crédito demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The Caracato group was made up of three people. All of them live in the Alto Obrajes area. Señora Victoria has a store, Señora Valentina prepares meals, and Señora Julia recently left the group, leaving it with two people. They are on their ninth loan. Señora Victoria B. has two daughters and a granddaughter. She was widowed two years ago, and her daughters help her with the home's expenses since both of them work and study. Besides attending to her store, she delivers pastries to high schools along with salteñas (a dish like empanadas) that she makes herself. She needs more capital, especially since it's the school year, since her market is near the educational institutions in the area.

Señora Valentina has worked as a domestic employee in a house in Obrajes for 25 years, but five years ago, she settled on her job of making meals on the weekends and other orders that she has from the area. She has two children who study in the university. She pays for all of their educational expenses. In terms of food and housing costs, they are minimal for her because the family she works for considers them part of their family. Both ladies are very friendly and work well with credit, demonstrating responsibility and punctuality with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital and purchase groceries

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian A. sells groceries like milk, Milo, and canned products at Abura. Vivian has received a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Vivian has been selling groceries since 2006. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her increase her sales of groceries to meet the increased demand from her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in groceries.

loans.use: To buy groceries like milk, Milo, and canned products to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes C. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon in Abura. Agnes has received a junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a teacher.

Agnes has been a hairdresser since 2008. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy a variety of hair products to meet the demand of her customers who come to the salon. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business to further expand her hairdressing business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of different hair products for her salon

loans.name: Edwin Patrick

texts.es: El sr. Patrick trabaja desde muy pequeño en el rubro de la platería, conjuntamente con su hermano y su papá que es el que le enseñó el oficio. Su taller es en la misma casa, y su trabajo es completamente manual, le dan distintas formas a la lámina de plata alpaca, como máscaras, arcángeles, y realizan también trabajos como cofres, soperas, cetros. El crédito será invertido en la compra de láminas de plata alpaca y plata 900, ya que tienen pedidos de cofres y arcángeles.
texts.en:
Patrick has worked as a silversmith from a young age, along with his brother and father who taught him the craft. His workshop is in his own house, and the work is entirely manual. They shape silver into a variety of shapes such masks and archangels, and also make items such as jewelry boxes, soup tureens, and scepters. The loan would be invested into purchasing sheets of alpaca and silver 900, as they have orders for jewelry boxes and archangels.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of sheets of silver.

loans.name: Mardonia

texts.es: Mardonia tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus hermanos. Sus padres son personas dedicadas a la agricultura, siembran mayormente alverjas, y ella aprendió los gajes de esta labor, ahora se ha convertido en ejemplo para sus hermanos menores. Hace 12 años abrió una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres y es la encargada de la administración y atención. Mardonia no se complica en sus labores, se levanta a 5.00am para ir a comprar el pan para vender en su bodega, la cual atiende hasta 10.0am, después acude a la chacra con sus peones y sus hermanos. Al realizar estas actividades de la agricultura y comerciante se siente muy complacida con la vida, ahora quiere incursionar con sus propios cultivos, y seguir incrementando los productos de su tienda hasta convertirla en rentable y auto sostenible. Mardonia es una de las clientes fundadoras de este su banco comunal, este es su 8vo crédito con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró puntualidad en sus pagos, es una secretaria muy eficiente que lleva el cargo por varios años consecutivos. El dinero que solicita es para surtir su bodega, asimismo comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos de alverjas.
texts.en:
Mardonia is 35 years old, single, and lives in her parents' house with her siblings. Her parents are very dedicated farmers who mainly grow sweet peas. Mardonia has learned the ins and outs of farmwork, and has become an example for her younger siblings. 12 years ago she opened a grocery store in her parents' house, and she is in charge of the store's administration and tending to customers. Mardonia doesn't complicate things too much, and wakes up at 5:00 am every day to go buy the bread that she sells in her store, which she attends until 10 am. Later, she goes to the fields with the laborers and her siblings. Doing all this work - attending her store and farming - helps her be very happy with life, and now she wants to start her own crops and continue adding to the products she has in her store until is becomes profitable and self-sustaining.

Mardonia is one of the founding clients of this communal bank, and this is the 8th loan she has requested from MFP. In allt his time, she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments, and is a very efficient Secretary in the group, a position she has held for several consecutive years. The money she asks for is to stock up her store as well as buy fertilizers for the sweet pea crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up her store and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos que trabajan fuera, él vive en su casa con su esposa. Hombre multifacético, está avocado a los distintos trabajos. Se dedica es a labrar la tierra en pocas cantidades, a la compra y venta de carros de segunda mano, que en temporadas le resulta rentable. Además tiene una bodega, donde no gana mucho, pero con sus ganancias cubre los gastos de alimentación diaria, y ha implementado un teléfono público, lo que le ha permitido ser más concurrida. Asimismo, realiza el transporte de las cargas de los agricultores a la ciudad en el auto que logró comprar hace un tiempo atrás. Todas estas actividades le han permitido cubrir la educación de sus hijos que ahora son profesionales, y que cada cierta temporada los visitan. Está feliz  por los trabajos que realiza, dice adaptarse a todo ello y nada le es difícil, mientras le produzca ganancias, él lo realiza. Guillermo en uno de los fundadores de este banco comunal, desde ese tiempo, 4 años, está en la presidencia, ya que le ratifican en el cargo constantemente por ser un buen líder, lo que demuestra en su cargo y con sus pagos puntuales. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar los productos de su bodega y comprar fertilizantes para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 59 years old, married, and has three children who all work in other places. He lives in his house with his wife. He is a multifaceted man who is skilled in a variety of jobs. He works the land in small plots and buys and sells used cars, which is sometimes profitable. He also has a store, which doesn't earn him much, but with his earnings he manages to cover the cost of his daily food and has installed a public telephone which has increased traffic there. He also transports crops for the local farmers to the city in a car he managed to buy a while back. All of these activities have allowed him to pay for his children's education who are now professionals, and they visit him every now and again. Guillermo is happy with all the jobs that he does, and says he has adapted and nothing is too hard for him and as long as he's making money, he'll keep on doing the same thing.

Guillermo is one of the founding members of his community bank and for four years has been the President, and is always elected because he is a good leader, which he demonstrates in his capacity as President and with his punctual loan payments. The money he is requesting is to increase the stock in his store and buy fertilizers to fertilize his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for his store, as well as fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Freol

texts.es: Freol tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y actualmente vive en la casa de tus tíos. Por ser numerosos hermanos, se fue a vivir con sus tíos a los 12, quienes le inculcaron el trabajo, la perseverancia y los buenos hábitos. A los 18 años sembró empezó sembrando 5 kilos de semilla de alverjas en terrenos de sus tíos, le resultó bien esa cosecha y la vendió a buen precio. Desde entonces se propuso incrementar sus sembrios, actualmente siembra alverjas, habas, verduras y flores en chacras alquiladas, pero siempre trata de darse tiempo para apoyar a sus familiares en los trabajos y cultivos de sus plantas, y del mismo modo son sus tíos muy condescendientes con él. En este año piensa sembrar 5 hectáreas de papa, Freol se siente muy feliz y orgulloso de ser campesino. Este es su 8va préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual en sus pagos, y nunca se descuidó de ahorrar mensualmente, del cual se siente muy feliz por pertenecer a este banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos, tanto de papa, verduras y flores.
texts.en:
Freol is a 31 year old single man who is currently living with his aunt and uncle. Because he had so many siblings, he went to live with his aunt and uncle when he was 12 years old. They instilled in him a strong work ethic, perseverance, and good habits. At 18 years old he began planting with 5 kilos of seeds for peas on his aunt and uncle's land, and got a good harvest his first year, which he sold for a good price. Ever since, he set the goal of increasing his plantings, and currently raises peas, beans, greens, and flowers in rented plots, but he always tries to give himself time to help his family in their own work and crops. His aunt and uncle do the same for him. This year he is thinking of planting 5 hectares of potatoes. Freol is very happy and proud to be from the country.

This is Freol's eigth loan with MFP, and throughout this time has shown himself to be a client who pays on time and never fails to save a little every month. He feels very happy to belong to this communal bank. The money that he asks for is to buy fertilizers for his crops, as well as potatoes, greens, and flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles A. sells mobile phone recharge credits in Abura. Charles has received a tertiary level of education. He is not married and has no children.

Charles has been selling mobile phone recharge credits since 2008. He is responsible for paying his rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him increase his sales of mobile phone recharge credits to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy additional mobile phone recharge credits to sell

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: El Señor Fidel trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año de 2006 en todo este tiempo siempre demostró  puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus créditos, cuenta con un minibús con el que trabaja todos los días, el es divorciado y vive en un pequeño cuarto, tiene una hija casada quien es su garante y siempre lo colabora. Trabaja desde la 06:00 hasta las 23:00 Todos los dias inclusive sabados y domingos. En este momento el vehiculo tiene varias fallas, por el mismo trajin a que lo somete diariamente.
texts.en:
Fidel has worked with our institution since the year 2006 and, over this time, has shown himself to be very punctual and responsible with his loan payments. He has a minibus that he drives every day; he is divorced and lives in a small room. He has a married daughter, who is his guarantor and collaborator. He works from 6 am to 11 pm every day, including Saturdays and Sundays. Currently, his vehicle has several malfunctions due to all the comings and goings he subjects it to on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia cuenta con 52 años de edad, vive durante 25 años con el padre de sus 5 hijos. De jovencita sus anhelos eran dedicarse a la gastronomía andina, pero este sueño se truncó al enamorarse de un agricultor y tenía un hijo en camino. Desde entonces se incrementaron sus   labores, se levanta a las 5.00am para preparar el menú  para los que cultivan la tierra, y después ella sumarse al trabajo, el cual ya se acostumbró. Ellos siembran mayormente maíz, pero en este años el precio del mercado no les ayudó y han perdido inversiones considerables, por ello que se han propuestos en cultivar alverjas, porque son ahora rentables, y de ese modo quiere revertir su situación actual. Florencia tiene anhelos de comprar sus propias chacras, lo cual seria una buena inversión y los próximos años se ahorraría el derecho de alquiler. Este es su 8vo préstamo consecutivo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo no ha caído en morosidad, pero nunca quiso recibir ningún cargo de la junta directiva, por carecer de educación. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de semilla de alverjas, de ese modo alternar sus sembríos, para que los altibajos de los precios del mercado no le afecten tanto.
texts.en:
Florencia is 52 years old, and has lived for 25 years with the father of her 5 children. When she was a little girl she dreamed of dedicating herself to Andean cooking, but this dream got cut short when she fell in love with a farmer and had a baby. Since then she and her partner have expanded their work, and she gets up at 5:00 each morning to prepare meals for the farmworkers, and afterwards she joins in the work, which she is very used to. They primarily grow corn, but lately the price of corn isn't very high and they have lost considerable investments. This is why they have proposed to grow peas, because right now they are more profitable, and this way they can reverse their current economic course. Florencia has dreams of buying her own fields, which would be a good investment and in future years she would save the part of her crop that usually goes to pay the landlord.

This is her 8th loan with MFP, and in all this time she hasn't been delinquent, but she's never wanted to take on any administrative role in her group due to her lack of education. The money she's asking for is to buy seeds for peas, so they can alternate their crops so the ups and downs of the market don't have such a big effect on them.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Hace pocos días atrás Félix cumplió 62 años de edad, es soltero vive en su casa con su hermana y sus sobrinos. Ahora que los años pesan siente nostalgia de no haber formado familia, y muchas veces siente que su trabajo no tiene un por qué, ni para quien sacrificarse tanto; pero a la vez está agradecido a Dios por darle una buena hermana y sobrinos que lo acompañan y apoyan en sus  cultivos. Viene sembrando alverjas, maíz, y un algo de papa en chacras de la comunidad y en algunas chacras que él ha adquirido en todo este tiempo de agricultor. Félix está feliz de labrar la tierra, ya que sus cultivos le dio bonanzas económicas, como también malos momentos por los precios bajos del mercado. Como ahora en los choclos que no los cosecha por los bajos precios del mercado, prefiere dejarlos en la chacra, para hacer que maduren y hacerlos secar en mazorcas, después desgranarlos y venderlos como maíz seco, solo así recuperará el dinero invertido en este cultivo. Félix está muy contento por ser un cliente de MFP, ya lleva 8 préstamo consecutivos, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, asimismo hace los mismo compromisos para este crédito. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de semillas de alverjas de tipo mejorada, por ser apropiado por el clima, y le resulta de muy buena producción.
texts.en:
Felix celebrated his 62nd birthday a few days ago, and is single living in a house with his sister and his nieces and nephews. Now that he's getting older he feels a little nostalgic about never forming his own family, and he often feels that his work is meaningless, and not worth all the sacrifice. At the same time, he thanks God for giving him a good sister and nieces and nephews that help and support him with his crops. He grows peas, corn, and a few potatoes in his community's public fields, as well as in some of his own which he has acquired in his years as a farmer. Felix is happy to work the land because his crops sometimes earn him a lot of money, but there are also bad times in which the low price of his crops means he earns very little. Like now, with the corn price so low he doesn't bother harvesting it, instead preferring to leave it in the fields so it ages, dries into corncobs, which he later breaks down and sells as dry corn. This is the only way for him to recover the money he has invested in this crop.

Felix is very happy to be a client of MFP, and has already taken out 8 loans. In all this time he as demonstrated himself to be punctual with his loan payments, and promises to do the same with this loan. The money he is asking for is to buy higher quality pea seeds (special seeds that are better for the climate) that give him a very good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pea seeds

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano cuenta 64 años de edad, es casado hace 30 años y tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales vive con tres de ellos. Sus actividades agrícolas se inician a las 5.00am y a eso de las 8.00am regresa a desayunar, al regresar a su chacra lleva a sus animales, sujeta a los toros y al burro en zonas de mucho pasto, para trabajar con tranquilidad, y su esposa lo alcanza con el almuerzo. Una vez terminado de comer, ambos trabajan con alegría, porque gracias a sus cultivos se han sustentado durante los años de su matrimonio. Feliciano siembra espinacas, coliflor, lechugas, etc, y cada fin de semana cosecha, su esposa es la encargada de llevar a las ferias dominicales de Tarma a vender. Esta dinámica de trabajo les ha permitido educar a sus hijos, que ahora trabajan en otras ciudades, pero aun su responsabilidad de padre es con sus hijos menores, por ello ahora se dirige a la ciudad para realizar las compras de sus uniformes escolares. En este 8vo préstamo del banco comunal llamado “Vamos al futuro huaracaino”, Feliciano acaba de ingresar como un cliente nuevo, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas a MFP, del cual está muy agradecido por tal oportunidad brindada. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de abonos de corral para sus siembras de hortalizas que todo este tiempo han le han permitido vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Feliciano is 64 years old, has been married for 30 years, and has 8 children, of which 3 live with him. His agricultural activities begin at 5:00 am. He goes home at 8:00 am to eat, then returns to his fields with his animals, and ties his bulls and the donkey in places with a lot of grass, so he can work peacefully. His wife later takes his lunch to him. Once he finishes eating, he and his wife work together happily, because their crops have sustained them over many years of marriage. Feliciano grows spinach, cauliflower, lettuce, etc. Each weekend he harvests, and his wife takes the crops to the Sunday markets in Tarma to sell them. This work dynamic has allowed them to educate their children who now work in other cities, but they still have parental responsibilities to their younger children, so they go to the city to buy their school uniforms.

In this 8th loan to the communal bank called "Onward to the Huaracayan Future", Feliciano has just become a new member, and he promises to make his payments on time to MFP, to which he is very thankful for the opportunity they have given him. The money he requests is for fertilizer for his fields to nourish his seeds, which have allowed him to live a comfortable life.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa tiene 55 años de edad, por más de 18 años vive con el padre de uno de sus hijos que estudia en la ciudad. Desde que era soltera se dedicó a los cultivos, en su afán de progresar y convertirse en una prospera agricultora y negociante, pero cuando quedó embarazada su trabajo en el campo mermó y tuvo que volcarse a los cuidados de su hijo y la labor de ama de casa. Pero ahora que su hijo ya es mayor, Clarisa está retomando sus labores agrícolas sembrando maíz, alverjas y otras verduras en las chacras que heredó de sus padres.  En esta temporada, ella y su hijo han sembrado mayormente maíz, pero no fue rentable por los bajos los precios del mercado. Ahora quiere incrementar sus cultivos en alverjas de semilla de alta calidad, resistente al mal clima y mejor cotizada en el mercado. Con estas miras Clarisa está contenta con sus labores agrícolas, anhelando la rentabilidad de sus cultivos, para de ese modo cubrir la educación de su hijo. Clarisa en una cliente muy responsable en sus pagos, esta es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, al cual le tiene mucha gratitud y cariño por permitirle trabajar. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos que tiene y para los que va a sembrar.
texts.en:
Clarisa is 55 years old and has lived with the father of one of her children, who studies in the city, for more than 18 years. Since she was single, she has been devoted to agriculture in her eagerness to progress and turn herself into a prosperous farmer and businesswoman. But when she became pregnant, her work in the field suffered and she had to turn to caring for her son and working as a housewife. Now that her son is older, Clarisa is returning to her agricultural work, planting corn, peas, and other vegetables in the fields she inherited from her parents. This season, she and her son primarily planted corn, but it was not profitable due to low market prices. Now she wants to expand production of higher quality peas, resistant to bad weather and more valued in the market. To this end, Clarisa is happy with her agricultural work. She hopes to have a more profitable crop so that she can afford to educate her son. Clarisa is a client who is very responsible with her payments. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she gives them much gratitude and affection for allowing her to work. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and manures for the crops she has and those she will plant.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia B. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high.

Sadia sells used clothing at Abura, which she has done since 2002. Her husband is a commercial driver. Sadia uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Sadia will use this loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sadia plans to reinvest back into her business and expand it further.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando está a punto de cumplir 48 años, viene viviendo por más de 20 años con la madre de sus 4 hijos. Ambos son agricultores, él acude a las 6.00am a la chacra y ella se queda preparando el almuerzo, pero a las 8.00am está llegando para ayudarlo en el trabajo diario, mientras sus hijos cuando están de vacaciones, son los encargados de alimentar o llevar al campo a sus animales. Al iniciar las clases Armando va a la ciudad a compras los útiles escolares, mientras que su esposa y sus hijos se ocupan de la chacra.  Ellos son especialistas en las siembras de maíz y hortalizas, y cada 15 días o al mes tratan de cosechar para enviar sus cargas a los mercados de la capital preferentemente, por ser más rentables que los mercados de Tarma. Y estas ganancias le permitieron comprar 2 hectáreas de terrenos regadíos, del cual se siente muy contento y satisfecho. Su meta a corto plazo es sembrar espinacas por su rápido desarrollo y su buena producción, y los precios al momento en el mercado son muy alentadores. Armando en un cliente responsable en su pagos de cada mes, asimismo en este préstamo  se compromete a seguir pagando como lo hacia, este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y está agradecido por la oportunidad y confianza brindada. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos sintéticos y semilla de espinaca para su próxima siembra, de la que cree, le resultará muy rentable.
texts.en:
Armando is about to turn 48 years old and has lived for more than 20 years with the mother of his 4 children. Both are farmers. He goes to the farm at 6.00 AM and she remains home preparing lunch, but at 8:00 AM she goes to help him with the daily work. When his children are on vacation they are in charge of feeding or taking the animals to pasture. Upon starting classes Armando goes to the city to buy school supplies, while his wife and children take care of the farm. They specialize is growing corn and crops and every 15 days or monthly they try to harvest to send their crops preferably to the market in the capital, as they are more profitable than the markets in Tarma. With these earnings they were able to buy 2 hectares of irrigated land, about which they feel very content and satisfied. His short term goal is to plant spinach because of its rapid growth and good production, and the prices today in the market are very high. Armando is a responsible client with his monthly payments, and with this loan he promises to continue paying as he has been paying. This is his 8th loan with MFP and he is thankful for the opportunity and confidence shown him. The money he seeks is to buy fertilizer, synthetic fertilizer, and spinach seed for his next planting, which he believes, will be very profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La sra. Lidia se dedica desde muy pequeña a la venta de pescado frito y sopa  de pescado conocido como “wallake”, en las mañanas vende junto a su mamá en el cruce de las villas, populoso sector de la ciudad de La Paz, y por la tarde en la calle Illampu, centro de la ciudad, vive con su hija que está en edad escolar, quien le ayuda en la preparación de la sopa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar la pieza en el lugar que su mamá le designó en la casa.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia, from the time that she was very small, has been selling fried fish and the Bolivian fish soup known as "Wallake". In the morning she is selling these with her mother at a busy crossroads in a populous area of the city of La Paz, and in the afternoons in Illampu Street in the city center. She lives with her school age daughter who helps her with preparing the soup. The loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials to finish the bedroom area that her mother fixed up for her in their house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace T. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Grace sells food supplies and fish. She buys the fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale in Abura, which she has done since 2005. Grace uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Grace will use this loan to increase her capital to buy food supplies and fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. Grace plans to reinvest her profits back into her business and expand it further.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La sra. Juana se dedica a la venta de pescado frito, tiene su puesto en la Av. 31 de Octubre cerca del cruce de villas, lleva 34 años con este oficio y es muy conocida por la zona, vive con sus hijos que ya son independientes, su hija le ayuda en la venta. Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando con la institución, y es una cliente puntual y muy responsable. El crédito será invertido en materiales de construcción para terminar su casita.
texts.en:
Senora Juana dedicates herself to selling fried fish from her stall on 31 de Octubre Avenue, close to a popular intersection. She has been in this business for 34 years and is very well known in the area. She lives with her children, who support themselves, and her daughter helps her with her work. This is Juana's third loan with this institution and she has always been a very punctual and responsible client. The loan will be invested into construction materials so that Juana can finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction materials

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Javier M.  de oficio transportista desde hace más de 10 años, trabaja en el servicio de trufi 1, taxi de ruta fija, tiene dos hijos pequeños, la esposa Sra. Graciela Condori trabaja mucho tiempo en la residencia de la Embajada Americana, vivian en casa an alquiler hasta hace unos tres años, ahora tiene casa propia y se encuentra para refaccionar el patio, en lo que invertiran el crédito, ademas la movilidad esta presentado algunas fallas.
El Sr. Javier M. es cliente de Emprender desde el año 2003, trabajó en grupo  Shaloom, integrado por tres personas, hasta el año 2005, posteriormente trabajo en crédito individual hasta el año 2007, y reingresa después de un año de descanso, con crédito individual con codeudor, no presenta deudas en otras instituciones ysegúbn su historial es una persona muy responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier M. has worked in the transportation field for more than 10 years. He works for the Trufi 1 service, a taxi with a fixed route. He has two young children and his wife Mrs. Graciela Condori has worked for a long time in the American Embassy residence. They lived in a rented house until three years ago and now they live in their own home. It is time to refurbish the patio, which is what they will use this loan for, and in addition mobility is causing some problems. Mr. Javier Machiado has been a client of Kiva partner Emprender since 2003. He worked with the Shaloom group, composed of three members, until 2005. He then worked with an individual loan until 2007, and he is now rejoining after a year-long break with this individual loan with co-signer. He has no other debts with other institutions and according to his history, he is a very responsible and punctual person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain his vehicle and fix his home

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro inició el negocio por la necesidad de progresar en un estado que no es el de el y ante las pocas oportunidades que se le presentaron en su momento, fue que decidio emprender su propio negocio en  mayo del 2007. Comenzó vendiendo refrescos y botanas solamente, pero se ha esforzado mucho para mantener su negocio y ahora vende productos de canasta básica, de limpieza, tiene videojuegos y esta pensando en un futuro contar tambien con la venta de  carnes frías o bien una carnicería.


El necesita un prestamo por MXN $3000 que pagara en 5 meses para  adquirir  mercancía que le permitirá tener un mayor inventario y tener todo lo necesario para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ramiro started his business because he needed to get by in a state that is not his own, and due to the very limited opportunities he was faced with at that moment, decided to begin his own business in May of 2007. He began selling soft drinks and snacks only, but he struggled hard to keep his business and now sells staple goods, cleaning products, and video games. He is thinking of selling meat, or even having a butcher's shop.

Ramiro needs this loan, which he will pay back in five months, to buy merchandise that will allow him to have a greater inventory and have everything he needs for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to increase his inventory

loans.name: Victoria Porfiria

texts.es: La sra. Victoria se dedica a la confección de polleras, Faldas para personas del campo, aprendió este oficio desde muy pequeña, y ella también les enseña la confección a sus hijas. Se compró su casita en la zona de Kupini, donde vive con sus hijas, su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Argentina, en el rubro de costura, y cada mes le manda un monto de dinero para los gastos de la casa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de tela.
texts.en:
Victoria dedicates herself to making “polleras”, skirts worn by the people in the countryside. She learned the craft as a young girl, and is also teaching it to her daughters. She bought her little house in the Kupini zone, where she lives with her daughters. Her husband is working in Argentina in the sewing trade, sending her money each month for household expenses. The loan would be invested toward the purchase of fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of fabric.

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Maria del Refugio inició el negocio por que le gustan las ventas ya que ella anteriormente trabajaba en un negocio similar. Comenzó el negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años  primero fue adecuando su domicilio para poder exhibir toda la mercancia de modo que pudiera tener enfriadores y exhibidores, y comenzo con la venta de  refrescos y botanas después fue incluyendo abarrotes y otros articulos que sus clientes le iban solicitando.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $8000 que pagara en 6 meses, ya que se descapitalizo debido a una enfermedad de un familiar, y tuvo que ocupar la mayor parte de las ganancias que habia obtenido a lo largo de los años por lo que va a utilizar este prestamo para volver a surtir sus productos y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria del Refugio started in business because she likes sales and she used to work in a similar business. She started the business about 5 years ago, first out of her home where she made some changes that allowed her to show her merchandise and having freezers and counters, so she began selling soft drinks and fajitas to which she later added groceries and other articles that her customers requested. She needs a loan of MXN $8,000 which she will pay back within 6 months, since her capital has been diminishing due to the illness of a relative, for which she had to utilize the major part of her profits. She will use this loan to replenish her stock and continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona inició el negocio como un pasatiempo para tenr una ctividad en que ocupar su tiempo libre, 
Comenzó el negocio hace 5 años haciendo galletas y empanadas para sus hijos, entonces algunas personas que las probaban y le empezaron a hacer pedidos, quienes tambien  la fueron recomendando, y fue como inicio con la  comercialziacion obteniendo mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 5 meses. Este credito lo necesita para surtir mercancia ya que ella necesita tener en estos momentos inventario de reserva, porque le pueden hacer pedidos grandes y en ocasione sno tiene suficiente materia prima, por lo que pierde ese pedido. Ademas desea publicarse en una revista local de negocios para asi darse a conocer en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Ramona began her business as a hobby to have an activity to occupy her free time. She began her business 5 years ago making cookies and turnovers for her children, then some people tried them and she began to take orders. Her customers then recommended her to others and in this way she began selling thereby obtaining increased income. She needs a loan for $4,000 MXN which will be repaid in 5 months. She needs this loan to stock merchandise that she needs to have on hand, because large orders can come in and if she doesn’t have enough ingredients she loses the order. In addition she wishes to publish about herself in a local business magazine so she can become better known in other areas.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. sells slippers in Kotokoraba, which is the heart of the Cape Coast. Felicia has received a senior-high education. She is married and has nine dependents. Her husband is receiving a pension. Felicia has been selling slippers since 1990. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the household expenses.

Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase her stock of used clothing to meet the increase in demand of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back in the expansion of her trade in slippers.

loans.use: To increase stock of used clothing

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan I. es un muy buen cliente que ingresó a nuestra institución el día 5 de junio de 2006 solicitando un crédito para apoyar su actividad de venta de ropa usada. Actualmente él trabaja con un crédito individual. Él y su esposa, la señora Leonor Juárez Mamani, trabajan mucho para criar a sus tres hijos con mucha dedicación y cariño. Ellos viven en la calle 6  de la zona Santa Rosa, popular zona de la ciudad de El Alto. Don Juan se dedica principalmente a la venta de ropa, como ser pantalones, chamarras y poleras. Y de esta manera Don Juan ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y correcta.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan I. is a very good client who joined our organization on June 5, 2006 when he requested a loan to support his business selling used clothing. Currently he is working with an individual loan. He and his wife, Mrs. Leonor Juárez Mamani, work hard to raise their three children with dedication and affection. They live on 6th Street in the Santa Rosa neighborhood, a popular area of the city of El Alto. Mr. Juan primarily works selling clothing such as pants, jackets and skirts. In this way, Mr. Juan has demonstrated that he is a very responsible and correct person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy secondhand clothing such as jackets and skirts

loans.name: Taeni

texts.en:
Taeni S. sells food supplies like groundnuts and plastic rubbers at Abura, and has done so since 2007. 

Taeni is married and has two children. She received no formal education. Her husband is a sanitary officer. Taeni uses her income to assist her husband with their housekeeping expenses. 

Taeni will use the loan to purchase additional food supplies and  plastic rubbers to meet an increase in demand of her supplies by her costumers. Taeni plans to reinvest the new profits in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies like groundnuts and rubbers to meet an increase in demand.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance D. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Her husband is a trader. Constance uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses.

Constance sells used clothing in Abura, which she has done since 2005. Constance will use this loan as additional capital to enable her to increase her sales of used clothing to meet the increase in demand from her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Constance plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in used clothing.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Leonor Jovina

texts.es: La señora Leonor ingresa a nuestra institución el día 26 de abril de 2007. Desde ese momento ha estado trabajando con créditos individuales, los cuales paga con puntualidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una tienda de barrio. Junto a su esposo, mantienen su hogar y a sus tres hijos con mucha dedicación y cariño. Ellos viven en la Zona Santiago II, calle 17 de la ciudad de El Alto. Uno de los anhelos de doña Leonor es ver a sus hijos profesionales y poder ampliar su negocio. Por todo esto ella es considerada una excelente cliente de buena actitud y muy responsable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonor became a member of our organization on April 26, 2007. Ever since this time she has been working with individual loans, which she pays punctually. She works selling groceries from a neighborhood store. She and her husband maintain their home and raise their three children with dedication and affection. They live in the Santiago II neighborhood, on 17th Street in the city of El Alto. One of Mrs. Leonor’s wishes is to see her children become professionals and another is to be able to expand her business. For all these reasons, she is considered an excellent client who is very responsible and has a good attitude.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries for her store (oil, rice, noodles, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en:
Ekow D. is married and has six dependents. He has received schooling through senior high. His wife is a seamstress.

Ekow sells car spare parts and other items like engine oil at Komenda Junction near Elmina, which he has done since 2006. He uses his income to provide food, clothing and other basic needs of the family. Ekow will use this loan as additional capital to increase his sales of spare parts, engine oil, and related items to meet the increase in demand from his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ekow plans to reinvest back for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy additional car spare parts, engine oil, and related items to sell

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette D. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high.

Antoinette sells food supplies like groundnuts, maize, and millet in Abura, which she has done since 2001. She also prepares beverages for sale. Antoinette uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses.

Antoinette will use this loan as additional capital to increase her sales of food supplies like groundnuts, maize, and millet to meet the increase in demand from her customers. She will also buy more millet for the production of beverages. With the new profits from her expanded business, Antoinette plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in food supplies.

loans.use: To buy food supplies like groundnuts, maize and millet to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. sells used clothing at Kissi in Elmina. Faustina has received a senior high education. She is a single parent who has two children. She is responsible for providing food, clothing, and the other basic needs of her family.

Faustina has been selling used clothing since 2005. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase her sales of used clothing to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane J. sells bags of maize in Abura. She is also a seamstress. Jane has received a senior high education. She is a single parent with one child. 

Jane has been selling bags of maize since 2007. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to buy bags of maize to meet the increase in demand by her customers and also use part to purchase more sewing materials like thread, needles and others to enhance her work. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and sewing materials, fabrics, needles and others for her sewing work.

loans.name: Eufrin

texts.es: El señor Eufrín C. Calderón ingresó a nuestra institución el día 9 de octubre del año 2006 solicitando un crédito para su apoyar su actividad de la venta de calzados. Desde ese momento él ha trabajado con créditos individuales donde ha demostrado ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Él junto a su esposa, la señora Saturnina Alborta Vera, mantienen su hogar y crían a su pequeño hijo con mucha dedicación y esmero. Ellos viven en la zona Villa Mercedes, lugar que se encuentra a una gran distancia de su negocio, pero ese no es un impedimento para que ellos sigan trabajando y esforzándose por mejorar su vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señor Eufrín C. Calderón became a client of this communal bank on the 9th of October, 2006. His first loan was used to develop his shoe selling business. Ever since then, he has received a number of loans and has always been very responsible with making his payments. He and his wife, Señora Saturnina Alborta Vera, run their household and raise their little son with a great deal of dedication and care. They live in Villa Mercedes which is quite a distance from where they work but of course, this does not stop them from working hard and pushing themselves so that they can better both their own lives and that of their son.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise: shoes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth T. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high.  She has sold clothing and made funeral decorations at Komenda Junction near Elmina, since 2001. Her husband is a trader. Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.  She will use the loan to increase her sales of clothing and funeral decorations to meet the increase demand of her customers.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save towards a house she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Increase the sale of clothing and funeral decorations to meet increasing customer demands.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina O. is married and has three children.  She has received schooling through junior high.  Faustina has sold fried yams and turkey tails at Abura, since 2001.  Her husband is a trader.  Faustina uses her income to assist her husband in house keeping expenses.  Faustina will use the loan as additional capital to increase her sales of fried yams and turkey tails to meet the increase in demand from her customers.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to save towards a house she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Increase the sale of fried yams and turkey tails to meet the increase in demand from customers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La señora Nelly H. Q. ingresó a nuestra institución el día 24 de abril del año 2003 con el grupo Solidario Yungueñitas solicitando un crédito para su apoyar su actividad de la venta de frutas. En un momento determinado él ha decidido trabajado con créditos individuales donde ha demostrado ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Ella es separada de su esposo y con esfuerzo y dedicación es madre y padre a la vez de sus hijos. Ellos viven en la zona Villa Esperanza, lugar que se encuentra a una gran distancia de su negocio, pero ese no es un impedimento para que ellos sigan trabajando y esforzándose por mejorar su vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Nelly H. Q. became a client of Emprender on the 24th of April, 2003 as a member of the Solidario Yungueñitas Communal Bank. Her first loan was used to develop her fruit selling business. Eventually, she began to receive individual loans and proved herself to be very responsible with her payments. She is separated from her husband, but with dedication and determination, she has managed to be both father and mother to her children. She lives with them in Villa Esperanza, which is a quite a distance from her business, but this is hardly enough to stop her from working hard and pushing herself to succeed - she is determined to better her life and those of her children

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit in bulk

loans.name: Iddrisu

texts.en: Iddrisu A. sells poultry at a farmer in Adisadel, near Cape Coast.  He has no formal education.  He is married and has four dependants.  His wife is a trader.  Iddrisu has been selling poultry since 1987.  His loan will be used to buy feed and drugs for his poultry, since that is his major challenge.  Iddrisu is responsible for providing food, clothing and other basic needs for his family.  He hopes to reinvest new profits to expand his business.

loans.use: Buy feed and drugs for his poultry.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. sells food supplies and groceries like milk, milo, canned products and more at the Elmina first port.  She has received a primary education.  Mary is a single parent with five dependents.  She has been selling groceries since 1991.  Mary is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.  Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase the sale of food supplies and groceries to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business to expand her trade.

loans.use: Increase the sale of food supplies and groceries to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah G. sells food supplies and fish which she buys from fishermen.  She brings fish home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at the Elmina first port.  Hannah has received a junior high education.  She is a single parent and has one child.  Hannah has been selling fish since 1998.  She is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.  Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy food supplies and fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.  Hannah hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business to expand her trade in fish.

loans.use: Increase capital to buy food supplies and fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. A. is 45 years old, married, and a mother of five children. Currently, three are in school. She is very hard-working and resourceful. She sells charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Abena obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Mampong and other some parts of the Brong Ahafo region. She purchases the charcoal from villages like Ejura and A in the Amantin in the Ashanti region, where she lives and sells them to her customers.

She plans to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to pay for her children's educational fees. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyamekye’. She is requesting a loan of $450 (600 GHS) to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: Buy a bulk supply of charcoal

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith A. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Edith sells ladies' underwear, and also bakes bread for sale at Kissi in Elmina, which she has done for the last year. Her husband is a taxi driver. Edith uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Edith plans to use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of ladies' underwear, and also the bread she bakes for sales to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Edith plans to reinvest in her business to expand her trade.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more ladies' underwear to sell and ingredients to make more bread to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian G. is married and has no child. She has received no formal education. Vivian manufactures palm oil for sale at the Elmina first port. She has had this business since 1992. Her husband is a fisherman. Vivian uses her income to assist her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Vivian will use the loan to purchase more ingredients for a mass production of the palm oil. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to save towards the completion of the house she wants to build with her husband.

loans.use: Purchase more ingredients for a mass production of the palm oil

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is divorced and has two children. All her children are in school. She asked for a divorce after the husband treated her badly on one sunny day. She now lives with her children at Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 39 years old. For the past 10 years, she has been selling ladies' and children's clothes, like dressing bags, and skirts, underwear, and slippers.

She is constrained by funds to run the business. She requests a loan of $500 (700 GHS). She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to increase the business. She believes the loan will help her purchase good-quality merchandise and a large quantity of goods to upgrade her inventory. She also plans to use the loan to pay for her children's education. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. Elizabeth belongs to a village bank called One Touch.

loans.use: Purchase good-quality underwear, dressing bags, and slippers to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena J. is 46 years old. She is widowed and the mother of five kids. Currently, all her kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business that provides her source of livelihood. She sells her goods in a community called Mampong. Their major occupations are crop farming, such as maize and groundnut, because the land where the people live is fertile. She has been selling yams for almost 12 years to support her family. She takes delivery of stock from farmers, who provide her with a direct supply of yams. This enables her to avoid the middlemen, who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices.

She is requesting a loan of $725 (1000 GHS). With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Abena belongs to a village bank called Good News.

loans.use: Buy yams in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu S. is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. She lives with the husband who is a pensioner and is also into farming. She has three girls and two boys. Three of the children are in school. Alimatu is resourceful and enterprising. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like diewuo. Diewuo is prepared from a powdered maize mix with dried cassava and is served with soup. It is enjoyed as a breakfast or lunch and is normally prepared by Muslims who live in the Zongo communities. 

She has a strategic business location, giving her favorable business sales. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and increase her income level. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like maize powder, cassava powder, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to facilitate her food production. She says thanks for your assistance. Alimatu belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyamekye’ which means ‘God who gives’. She is requesting a loan of GH 1000 to make her business progress.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like maize powder, konkonte powder, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy F. is 50 years old. She is married, with three children. Her first child has completed senior high school and  is working. The rest of her children attend school. She lives with her family in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. For the past 30 years Lucy has been taking care of her household and baking bread and pastries. She bakes bread and pastries and sells them to the villages around her. Demand for her products has increased as a result of constant supply and just in time delivery. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come in, there order is ready. She says the price of supplies is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. However, the daily demand of bread is still high. She says she bake 500 loaves of bread in a day together with other pastries. Lucy needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood etc to restock her inventory. She said your assistance would be much welcome and helpful to her. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. Lucy belongs to a village bank called ‘One touch’.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha S. is a 42 year old trader. She is married and a mother with six children. All her children are now in school and her husband is a teacher. She is a very resourceful mother whose hard effort helps support her family. Agatha supports her kids through the sale of used clothing, curtains and bed sheet. Selling of used clothing, curtains and bed sheets is a very big market in Ghana, as brand new cloths are very expensive for the poor. She has been in this business for a year now. The selling of used clothing has created a market for many women. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bed sheets and used towels sales. She will use this loan rent a store and to help her save for her children future. Agatha belongs to a village bank called ‘One touch’. She is requesting a loan of GHS500 to increase her business and restock her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Farzana Kosar

texts.en:
My name is Farzana K. and I am a citizen of a historical place named Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan. I have been a part of this city for the past 35 years. I am a widow and I have the responsibility of two daughters on my shoulders. My husband left me six years ago, then my brother and I started a shoe-making business.

We started taking orders from the shoe companies and now earn income from it. Now we’ve seven employees working with us in our shoe-making business and we pay them bimonthly. Through this business I was able to marry off my daughter.

I have successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva's partner). Now I am applying for the sixth time to buy material (leather, polish and nails) to expand my shoe-making business and to complete the orders of companies.

loans.use: To buy materials for shoe-making business

loans.name: Las Cucheritas Group

texts.en: The Las Cucheritas group has three members: Santos Julia G., the eldest at age 60 and group coordinator; Coralia D. L.

loans.use: Buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
В декабре у Бахтиера закончились погашения займа полученного им год назад. В бизнесе Бахтиера полученный займ внес весомый вклад - сейчас он выпекает больше лепешек чем прежде. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса Бахтиер подал новую  заявку на займ. Он планирует закупить оптом муку и уголь.
P.S. на фото жена Бахтиера
texts.en:
Last December, Bahtiyor finished repaying the loan he received a year ago. This loan brought a measurable gain to Bahtiyor’s business because now he bakes more flat bread than before. Bahtiyor would like to obtain a new loan in order to further expand his business. He plans to use this loan to buy flour and coal wholesale. P.S. The photo shows Bahtiyor’s wife.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of flour and coal

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.en:
The El Progreso Group is a lively batch of individuals who work together to cultivate land and sell the products they grow.  They got into this business because their parents worked together.  Now, with the help of their spouses, the members grow a variety of plants, including ayote (also known as pipián, a squash native to Central America), jacote (a tropical fruit also known as Red Mombin or Hog Plum), rice, mangoes and more.  El Progreso sells its products in the Bilas Orientales municipality of Masaya, as well as around the Masaya Market.  With its Kiva loan, the group would like to prepare and sow more land. 

Daniela D. S. O., 38, is the group coordinator.  She has a great sense of humor and a ten year track record of success in this field.  This is her group’s tenth loan with ADIM, and she states that the members have advanced considerably since they began borrowing.  The group has learned from past mistakes: one year, they lost a considerable amount of crop due to drought, and now diversify by planting a larger variety of drought resistance seeds.  The members of El Progreso would like their children to have the opportunity to work outsiD. of farming, as it is quite difficult work.  They all hope that through their efforts and with the help of loans, they can create a better future for their children.

loans.use: Cultivating land.

loans.name: Abduraim

texts.ru: Абдураиму 57 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Старшие дочь и сын работают на заработках в России и каждый месяц присылают в среднем по $500. Абдураим откладывает эти деньги про запас. Как и планировал Абдураим сейчас наступил момент когда нужно ремонтировать дом где проживает семья. Согласовав со своими детьми Абдураим начал закупать строительные материалы. Подсчитав расходы он обнаружил что денег немного не хватит. Поэтому он обратился в Микроинвест с которым уже давно сотрудничает.
texts.en:
Abduraim is 57 years old, married and has 4 children. His oldest daughter and son work in Russia and send home approximately $500 every month. Abduraim saves this money. Just as he planned, the time has come when he needs to repair his family home. After talking it over with his children, Abduraim began buying construction materials. However, once he added up his expenses, he realized that he would not have enough money. This is why Abduraim reached out to MicroInvest, which has been his long-time partner.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home repair

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: María Esther R. reside en ciudad Arce, junto a sus cinco hijos. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual tres de sus hijos le colaboran a hacer tortilla y a atender a los clientes. María Esther solícita un presta a través del cual pueda invertir más en su negocio,  ya que dentro de sus principales necesidades para mejorar su negocio esta comprar más leña, maíz y una plancha nueva para hacer las tortilla. A pesar que María Esther es una señora de edad avanzada, trabaja duramente para poder obtener una vida digna con todo lo necesario para ella y sus hijos. Es por ello que desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, de manera que pueda aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
María Esther R. lives in the city of Arce with her five children. She sells tortillas, and three of her children help her by making the tortillas and attending to customers. Maria Esther is requesting a loan to invest more capital in her business, and to meet some basic needs of the business such as the purchase of firewood, corn and a new iron to make tortillas. In spite of the fact that Maria Ester is elderly, she works very hard to provide a dignified existence, meeting all the necessities for her and her children. That is why she wants to improve the quality of her business in order to increase her sales and her family income.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mario Filadelfo

texts.es: Mario Filadelfo P. de 53 años de edad, reside en La Libertad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de 17 y 15 años de edad. El posee un negocio de venta de comida y junto a su compañera de vida trabajan arduamente. El lugar de venta está muy bien ubicado, debido a que todos los días llega una cantidad de personas bastante razonable e incluso en su mayoría son clientes frecuentes los cuales llegan a consumir sus alimentos todos los días. Mario solicita un préstamo para invertir más en su negocio y de esta manera tener muchos más productos alimenticios que ofrecer, ya que uno de los mayores deseos de Mario es el de obtener mayores clientes y poder darles todo lo necesario a sus hijas, ya que dentro de sus principales metas esta el poder brindarles una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Mario Filadelfo P. is 53 years old, lives in La Libertad with his life partner and two daughters ages 17 and 15. He has a business selling food, and both he and his partner work very hard. The shop is very well located, since they get very good foot traffic every day, usually repeat clients who come by to eat their meals on a daily basis. Mario wants a loan to invest more capital in his business so that he can have a greater variety of foods in order to increase his customer base, and thus be able to offer his daughters everything that they need, particularly a good education. de 53 años de edad, reside en La Libertad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de 17 y 15 años de edad. El posee un negocio de venta de comida y junto a su compañera de vida trabajan arduamente. El lugar de venta está muy bien ubicado, debido a que todos los días llega una cantidad de personas bastante razonable e incluso en su mayoría son clientes frecuentes los cuales llegan a consumir sus alimentos todos los días. Mario solicita un préstamo para invertir más en su negocio y de esta manera tener muchos más productos alimenticios que ofrecer, ya que uno de los mayores deseos de Mario es el de obtener mayores clientes y poder darles todo lo necesario a sus hijas, ya que dentro de sus principales metas esta el poder brindarles una mejor educación.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de más productos

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Клиент Бахриев Шерзод,27 лет, проживает в городе Душанбе, женат детей нет. Имеет высшее образования, работает в сотовой компании BABILON-M на должности,оператор. На получившиё деньги хочет купить мебель для своего дома.
texts.en:
Client Sherzod B. is 27 years old, lives in Dushanbe, and is married but has no children. He has a university education and works as a call agent for the Babilon-M mobile phone company. He wants to use a loan to buy furniture for his house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furniture Purchase

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta M. D. L. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango junto a su hijo menor. Ella posee una tienda la cual lleva por nombre “Bendición D. Dios”. Como madre soltera Marta debe trabajar muy duro para poder proveer a su hijo D. todo lo necesario y así mismo para mantener su hogar. Es por ello que ella desea mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, ya que no posee un lugar para colocar muchos D. sus productos, esta es la razón por la cual solícita un préstamo, para poder comprar dos estantes D. metal y una vitrina en la cual pueda colocar sus productos y puedan ser visibles para los clientes. Marta desea obtener estos estantes y poder aumentar sus productos, con el fin D. poder obtener más ganancias, las cuales contribuyan a su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Marta M. D. L. is 47 years old and resides in Soyapango together with her younger son. She owns a store by the name of “Blessing of God”. As a single mother, Marta needs to work very hard to be able to proviD. for her son everything necessary as well as to maintain her home, and for this she wants to improve the condition of her business. She does not currently have anywhere to place many of her products and for this reason she is asking for a loan to be able to buy two metal stands and a display cabinet in which she can place her products and they can be visible to customers. Marta wants to obtain these stands and be able to increase her products in order to be able to obtain more income which contributes to her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display stands for the store

loans.name: Rubidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Rubidia del Carmen R. A. de 30 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Colón junto a su esposo Carlos Márquez y sus dos hijos menores de edad.  Ella trabaja a diario haciendo visitas de casa en casa para vender productos por catalogo, ella posee dos años trabajando en la misma actividad, todo con el fin de poder colaborarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Rubidia solicita un prestamos,  ya que dentro de sus metas esta crecer en su negocio y de esta manera poder comprar mercadería como perfumes, cosméticos, estrés otros, todo con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y poder mantener a las ya existentes. Rubidia desea poder darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, es por ello que se esfuerza día tras día, ya que son estos su mayor incentivo para seguir trabajando a diario.
texts.en:
Rubidia del Carmen R. A. is 30 years old and lives in the city of Colon, along with her husband Carlos Marquez and her two young children. Rubidia works everyday going door to door to sell products from a catalog. She has been doing this work for 2 years, with the objective to help her husband with the household expenses. Rubidia is asking for a loan since one of her goals is to grow her business. With the loan she will be able to buy merchandise like perfumes, cosmetics, among other things, to be able to increase her sales.
