Rubidia's hopes are to be able to provide everything necessary for her children, that is why she works hard day after day, her children provide the biggest incentive for her to keep working everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Abdul Jamil

texts.en:
A. Jamil is the son of A. G.. He lives in District 16 in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has six children. He owns land in which he works hard to earn money and to achieve all the goals of his family members. 

He has been involved in agriculture since he was a child.  His father was a farmer and he learned how to work on the land from his father. He is very interested in farming and would like to progress well, so he wants to take an individual loan of 40,000 Afghani for the term of 12 months.

He would like to mention that this is the best process to support all entrepreneurs to help them expand their businesses and be good businessmen in the future.

loans.use: Progressing and buying additional farming tools

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru: Клиент Юсупов Амриддин 40 летий мужчина, проживающий в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Имеет среднее образования, женат, имеет 5-рых детей.Клиент занимается животноыодством  более 7 лет на полученные деньги хочет купить пару молодых телят.От продажи скотом, клиент будет иметь прибль, что поможет ему увеличить своё хозямство.
texts.en:
Client Amriddin Y. is a 40 year old man living in the Abdurahman Jami district. He has a high school education, is married, and has five children. He has practiced animal husbandry for over 7 years, and would use the loan to buy a pair of young calves. The income from sale of his livestock will help him expand his land holding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Himkat

texts.ru: Клиент Негматов Хикмат 65 летий мужчина, проживающий в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Имеет среднее образования, женат, имеет 5-рых детей.Клиент занимается животноыодством  более 10 лет на полученные деньги хочет купить пару молодых телят.От продажи скотом, клиент будет иметь прибль, что поможет ему, в дольнейшем заниматься животноводством и увеличивать своё хозяйство.
texts.en:
Client Hikmat N. is a 65 year old man living in the Abdurahman Jami district. He has a high school education, is married, and has five children. He has raised livestock for over 10 years and would like use the loan received to buy a pair of young calves. The income earned from sale of livestock will aid in his future animal husbandry work and help him to expand his land holding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Mohammad Wazir

texts.en:
This is M. Wazir, the son of F. M.. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is a married man who has  three children. He is a butcher, and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. He has been involved in his butcher shop for more than 10 years. There he works hard. He wakes up early in the morning to sell more and to have a high monthly income. 

He would like to expand his business and make his shop larger. That is why he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months.

He is grateful to the lenders who bring the opportunity for the entrepreneurs to support themselves and their families through Kiva's process.

loans.use: To expand his butcher shop

loans.name: Saymiddin

texts.ru: Клиент Юсупов Саймиддин 34 - ёх  летий мужчина, проживающий в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Имеет среднее образования, женат, имеет одного сына.Клиент занимается животноыодством  более 6 лет на полученные деньги хочет купить несколько молодых телят с дольнейшей перепродажей.От продажи скотом, клиент  имеет прибль, это прибыль поиогает ему содержать свою семью.
texts.en:
Client Saymiddin Y. is a 34 year old man living in the Abdurahman Jami district. He has a high school education, is married, and has a son. He has been practicing animal husbandry for over 6 years and would like to use a loan to buy a few calves for future resale. The income earned from sale of livestock will help him to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Mohammad Tamim

texts.en:
Mohammad Tamim is the son of S. H. S.. Right now he lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. During the war, Mohammad and his family were emigrated to Pakistan. After regression, they settled in their own house, which was destroyed. They tried so hard to live in that house because they did not have enough money to repair it well.

Mohammad was informed by one of his friends about the lending process, so he came to Kiva's partner AFS and requested an individual loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to repair his house and solve his problems.

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.ru: Клиет Юсупов Фазлиддин в возрасте 36-ти лет, проживающий в Абдурахмони Чоми.Женат имеет 3-их детей, образования среднее.Клиент занимается животноводствотм более 6 лет, у него имеется несколько бычков. На полученные деньги клиент хочет купить пару молодух телят. Клиет откармливает телят и продаёт, это помагает ему содержать семью.
texts.en:
Client Fazliddin Y. is 36 years old and lives in Abdurahman Jami. He is married and the father of three children, and has a high school education. He has raised livestock for over six years, and has several bull calves. He would like to use the funds received to buy a pair of young calves. Feeding then selling the calves will help him to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad R. is the son of Ata Mohammad. He lives in district 8, Kabul Afghanistan. Mohammad is 45 years old, married and has four children. He lives in a family of eight including his father and mother. Because he is the oldest member of his family he is responsibility of taking care of his father and mother.

Mohammad needs to build two more rooms to his house because it is very small. By building two new rooms, he can have a place for house materials, so he wants to receive an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months.

loans.use: Buying materials of construction

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Клиентка Бободжонова Зебунисо в возросте 51 год, замужем имеет одного сына, высшего образования не имеет. Проживает в городе Вахдат, клиентка занимается торговлей более 15 лет у неё имееется собственнуая торговая точка, которая находится, на центральном  рынке. Муж клиентки работает на томже рынке, охраником.На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар, в виде закупа материала.
texts.en:
Client Zebuniso B. is a 51 year old resident of the city of Vahdat, and is married and has one son. She did not complete higher education. She has worked in sales for over 15 years, and now sells goods from her own trading stall at the central market. Her husband works as a security guard at the same market. She wants to use the funds received to expand her selection of goods by buying fabric.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.ru: Клиентка Шаропов Хошим в возросте 33 год, женат имеет двоих детей,имеет высшее образования  по специальности экономист, по специальности не работает, зароботная платан в гос учереждениях низкая по этому клиент, зантмается бизнесом. Клиент проживает в городе Вахдат, клиент занимается торговлей более 10 лет у неё имееется собственнуая торговая точка, которая находится, на рынке Хаир. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар, в виде мужской одежды.
texts.en:
Hoshim S. is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has a bachelors degree in economics. Since his profession is not very well compensated in government agencies, Hoshim has his own business. He lives in the Vahdat region, where he has been working in trade for the past 10 years. He owns his own space at a market called "Hayir." He plans to use the loan to increase his inventory of men's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Bakhtawar

texts.en:
Bakhawar, son of Hjigullbar, lives in Jalalabad Nangrahar province. He has a mechanic shop and good experience in his business. Bakhawar has already successfully completed his first cycle loan and expanded his stock.

Still, he wants to expand his business with full success, so now he requests his second cycle loan to enlarge his shop to attract more customers and make good income to help his family.

Bakhawar is happy with this process of small loans and would like to thank all his lenders, Kiva and AFSG in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: Enlarge his mechanics shop.

loans.name: Djuma

texts.ru: Клиентка Ёрова Джумьа в возросте 46 лет, замужем имеет двоих детей, образования не имеет. Проживает в городе Вахдат, клиентка занимается торговлей более 8 лет у неё имееется собственнуая торговая точка, которая находится, на центральном  рынке, она продаёт домашними малочными продуктами. Муж клиентки находится на зароботках в России. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет отремантировать свою квартиру.
texts.en:
The client Djuma Y. is 46 years old, married and has two children. She has no education. She lives in the town of Vahdat and has been in the retail business for more than eight years. She has her own vendor spot which is located on the central market where she sells homemade milk products. Djuma's husband is a laborer in Russia. She wants to use the loan to renovate her apartment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate apartment

loans.name: Muhtabor

texts.ru: Клиентка Туйчибоева Мухтабор в возросте 55 год, замужем имеет двоих детей, высшего образования не имеет. Проживает в городе Вахдат, клиентка занимается торговлей более 10 лет у неё имееется собственный магазин, который находится, в городе Вахдате улица Туграл .На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар, в виде закупа продуктов питания.Увеличив товар, у клиентки увеличится ежедневный доход от торговли.
texts.en:
The client Muhtabor T. is 55 years old, married and has two children. She does not have high education. She lives in the town of Vahdat and runs a retail business for more than ten years. She has her own store which is located on the Tugral street in Vahdat. She wants to use the loan to increase her inventory and buy more food. By doing that Muhtabor will increase her daily income from her sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.ru: Клиентка Сангинов Абдумумин в возросте 53 год, женат имеет двоих детей,имеет среднее образования. Клиент проживает в городе Вахдат,у клиента имеется собственная столовая.Эта столовая находится в городе Вахдата, улица Сомониён чайхана Файзабад, этим видом деятельности клиент занмается, более 10 лет. На полученные деньги, клиентка хочет увеличить продукты.
texts.en:
Abdumumin S. is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has secondary education. He lives in the Vahdat town, where he owns a cafe. It is called "Fayzabad" and it is located on Samoniyon Street. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. He plans to use the loan to purchase additional ingredients.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional ingridients

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Клиент Махсунов Хамрокул в возрасте 53года.Проживает в городе Турсунзаде, женат имеет 6-ых детей, имеет среднее образования.Клиент занимается животноводством он покупает молодых телят откармливает и продаёт,этим видом деятельности, занимается более двух лет. На полученные деньги клиент хочет купить пару молодых телят.
texts.en:
Hamrokul Machsunov is 53 years old. He lives in the town called Tursun-zade. He is married and has 6 children. He has secondary education. Hamrokul is in the animal farming business - he purchases calves, feeds them, and later sells them at a higher price. He has been working in this business for the past 2 years. He plans to use the loan to purchase two calves to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Shirzi

texts.en:
Shirzi is the son of A. J.. He is 25 and lives in Kabul in a family of seven members. Shirzi is a farmer and he works on the land with his father.

He loves to work hard and to expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy more seeds and tools for his land.

Shirzi wants to state that this is the only one process that can support an entrepreneur to bring a new change in his business.

loans.use: Buy seeds and tools.

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Абубакр после окончания школы поехал в Россию на заработки. Проработав там несколько лет, он решил вернуться и стал заниматься бизнесом на местных рынках. Абубакру 29 лет, он женат, его жена нигде не работает и воспитывает 2 детей дома. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает давно, и приобрел репутацию отличного клиента. Абубакру необходимо получать займы, так как он отлично справляется с полученными займами и извлекает максимальную прибыль, которая расходуется им как для увеличения бизнеса, так и для покрытия расходов семьи. Абубакр и дальше собирается сотрудничать с МикроИнвест.
texts.en:
After finishing school, Abubakr went to Russia to make a living. Having worked there for several years, he decided to return home and became involved in his own business at local markets. Abubakr is 29 years old, married; his wife does not work and raises their 2 children at home. He has been partnering with MicroInvest for a long time and achieved a reputation of an excellent client. It is necessary for Abubakr to obtain loans because he has been repaying all of his loans and managing to receive maximum profits that he uses to expand his business and to support his family. Abubakr plans to continue his partnership with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia A. is married and has one child.  She has received schooling through junior high.  Anastasia has sold plastic bowls and other items at the Elmina first port, since 2008.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Anastasia uses her income to assist her husband with house keeping expenses.  She will use the loan to buy more plastic products for resale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Anastasia plans to expand her trade.

loans.use: Buy more plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is married and has four dependents.  She has received schooling through senior high.  Mary has sold food supplies and groceries like milk, milo, canned products and rice at the King of Kings in Elmina, since 2008.  Her husband is a driver.  Mary uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  Mary will use the loan to increase the sale of food supplies to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land to build a house so they can stop paying rent and to get a comfortable shelter for their family.

loans.use: Increase the sale of food supplies and  groceries to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Ayishatu

texts.en: Ayishatu A. sells clothing for babies and ladies wear at the sea shore in Elmina.  Ayishatu has a senior high education.  She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a teacher.  Ayishatu has been selling since 2008.  She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic family expenses.  Her loan will be used to meet the increasing demand of her customers.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her trade.

loans.use: Increase the sale of clothing for babies and ladies wear, to meet the increasing demand of customers.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica E. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Veronica sells soft drinks, rice and other items at Abrutu in Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Veronica uses her income for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Veronica will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of soft drinks, rice and other items to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Additional capital to enable her increase the sale of soft drinks, rice and other items

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort T. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Comfort sells soaps at Elmina, which she has done since 2007.  Comfort uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Comfort will use the loan as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of soaps to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of soaps to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame E. K. sells soft drinks and mobile phone recharge credits at Elmina. Maame E. has received a senior high education. She is not married and has no children. Maame E. has been selling soft drinks and mobile phone recharge credits since 2008. She is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her increase sales of soft drinks and mobile phone recharge credits to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Increase the sale of soft drinks and mobile phone recharge credits

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia M. is a trader. Cecilia’s husband is a carpenter and she has no children. She has no educational background. She sells gari at Elmina, which she has been doing since 2007. She uses cassava in preparing her gari.

She would use the money given her to expand her business. Cecilia would then use the profit she would gain from the business to cater for her family’s utility bills and other financial needs.

loans.use: She would use the money given her to expand her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. is a fish monger. Her husband is a carpenter and she has five dependents. She has received education through junior high school. Hannah goes to the shore to buy fish from the fishermen and sends it home for processing before selling it at the market, which is at Elmina. Hannah has been in this business since 1995. She would use the money she recieves to expand her business. She would then use the profit she gets to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: She would use the money she takes to expand her business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex E. is a trader. He is married and has four children. He has received a junior high school education. He sells fish in Elmina. He goes to buy fish from the fishermen at sea and sends it home for processing before selling it at the market, which is in Elmina. He has been in this trade since 1998. Alex would then use the money to buy more fish to sell. He would then use the profit he gains to pay his children’s school fees and use the rest to build a house for his family.

loans.use: Alex would then use the money to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Magdalene M. is a trader. She sells goods like maize and gari in Elmina. She has seven dependents and is not married. She has received an education through primary school. She uses cassava in preparing her gari for sale. Magdalene has been in this business since 1999. She would use the money she gets to expand her business, then use the profit she earns to further her children’s education and also use the rest to pay the utility bills of her family.

loans.use: She would use the money she gets to expand her business

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia I. is a trader.Her husband is a taxi driver and she has three dependents.She sells goods like plastic and aluminium bowls at Ankaful near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2008. She has received a junior high school education. She intends on using the money to buy more products to sell.She would then use the profit she gains to pay her utility bills and also buy land to build a house for her family.

loans.use: She intends on using the money to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Ghazala Abdul Jabbar Group

texts.en:
My name is Ghazala and I have been a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. I am a mother of three kids: two sons and one daughter. All of my kids are getting an education from a school located near the house. My husband's name is A. J.. He manufactures plastic bags and sells them in the market. I help my husband in his business. I also operate a business sewing clothes, because through this work I am able to pay the school fees for my kids. My family is very happy with the support I provide. I am applying for a loan to buy plastic beans to expand my husband’s business.

I am the group leader of five other women from my locale. Tahira baji and Zarina baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shahida baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Khatoon baji and Zahida baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy plastic beans for manufacturing plastic bags

loans.name: Nasreen M.tufail Group

texts.en:
My name is Nasreen and I a married lady. I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the past 12 years. My husband's name is M. Tufail. He runs a shop in the community where he sells woods. He chose this profession because there’s no gas available in the community and people come to him to buy wood. I am a mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Both of my kids are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. I am applying for a loan to buy wood to expand my husband’s wood-selling business.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my locale. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for vehicles to sell. Rani baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy wood to sell

loans.name: Bilquis Imtiaz Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Bilquis and I’m a married lady. I have lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 12 years. My husband's name is I. A.. He sell construction supplies in a shop in the community, and people used to come to him to buy the supplies. Mr. I. earns a good income through this business. But we are all aware of the economic crisis, and it's difficult for a single person to manage the expenses of a whole family. So I operate a business sewing clothes. This business allows me to pay off the school fees of my two kids. I am applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies for my husband’s business.

I am the group leader of five other women from my locale. Lubna nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Rukhsana shamim baji wants a loan to buy shawls for her business selling shawls. Maqsood begum baji wants a loan to buy biscuits and chips for her canteen. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food business. Shakila baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Sakina Iftikhar Ali Group

texts.en:
Sakina Baji is a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan.  Sakina’s husband, I. A., has run a catering business for six years.  She is applying for a loan to buy material (tent, table covers) for his catering business.

Sakina is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son.  All are enrolled in school and getting an education.  She operates a knitting clothes business in order to get income.  She gets orders from cloth shops and uses her income to pay the school fees of her kids.  

She is the group leader of this group.

Akeka Kosar Baji wants a loan to buy material (taps, pipes) for her sanitary business.

Suraiya Begum Baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit selling business.

Khurhseed Baji wants a loan to buy an embroider machine to embroider dresses. 

Maqsoodan Baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. 

Mussarat Baji wants a loan to buy shawls to sell.

This is a group loan.  Funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.   The members mutually guarantee each others loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy material for various businesses.

loans.name: Robella

texts.en:
Robella A. owns a small "Botica," a Filipino term for drug store, in her town.  She is 42 years old, married and has two children.  Robella humbly started her business using money she borrowed from her friend.  She thinks that health is wealth and to start a drug store in their town is a very interesting business.  Robella gains a reasonable profit from selling medicines and other drugs.  The income is what Robella uses to pay the tuition and and other school fess of her children.

Now, Robella is requesting a loan of Php 23,000 from CEVI.  She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of medicine for her store.  The loan will truly help her grow her business and support her family more.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help alleviate people from poverty.  CEVI gives their clients an opportunity to start and have their own businesses.  Aside from that, they not only give credit assistance to all their clients, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Add stocks of medicine to her drug store.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio M. manages the popular "Aimee Food and Snacks" canteen in his village. He has a wife and four children. He is 44 years old and previously worked as a medical representative.

"We bake cake and accept volume orders," he said. "My wife is a good cook and our business is doing so well because we ensure quality of food and service in our business," he added.

He is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. He will use the loan to buy grocery items and additional ingredients for his cake business. The loan will truly help him expand his business.

Anastacio is one of the thousands of clients helped by Community Economic Ventures Inc. to start and have a business. He is provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help his small business grow

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and ingredients for his cake business

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz B. is a seaweed farmer. She is 54 years old and has seven children. "I am not contented of just being a wife, stay in a house and wait for your husband to come" she said. "I want to do something else especially earn little income for my children," Luz added.   Her husband, Rodrigo Baaron Jr. manages their seaweed farm.   They grow and sell seaweed in their village.

Luz is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI.   She will use the loan to buy more seedlings for her farm.   The loan will definitely help Luz increase the size of their farm.   She is also thinking of venturing to another line of business to contribute well to their family income.

CEVI supports seaweed farmers to sustain their livelihoods.   They provide their clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to grow their small businesses.

loans.use: Buy seedlings for seaweed farm.

loans.name: Jamaima

texts.en:
Jamaima E. has a small boat that she and her husband, Erlando, use to fish for a living. Besides catching fish, they grow seaweed. She is 24 years old and has two children in school. Jamaima worked previously as a saleslady in one of the biggest malls in Bohol. She was not happy about her job and decided to get married instead and go back to her old barrio and manage a seaweed farm.

Jamaima is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 ($220 USD) from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a new pump boat engine. The loan will truly help the couple continue fishing and farming seaweed, and help them support their children and provide them a better future. CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. They provide not only credit but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy a pump boat engine for their fishing business and seaweed farm.

loans.name: Ahmadchon

texts.ru: Ахмадчон один из активных клиентов Микроинвест. Он начал сотрудничать три года назад и постепенно приобрел опыт работы с займами. Его деятельность включает в себя куплю продажу различного рода зерновых на местном рынке города: пшеницы, сечки риса, овса и тп. Его клиенты покупают эти виды зерновых для своих домашних питомцев. Благожелательное отношение Ахмадчон к своим клиентам помогает ему удержать их. Ахмадчону недавно исполнилось 54 года, его жена иногда помогает ему в его торговле по базарным дням. У Ахмадчона трое детей. Сейчас Ахмадчон подал заявку на новый займ и собирается закупить пшеницу и сечку риса.
texts.en:
Ahmadchon is one of the most active clients of MicroInvest. He began working together with the organization about three years ago and has steadily acquired experience with loans. His business is retail of different types of cereals on the local market: wheat, rice, oats and etc. His customers buy these cultures for their pets. Ahmadchon's kind disposition to his customers is what keeps them coming back. Ahmadchon has recently turned 54, his wifes is sometimes helping him with this business during the busy days. Ahmadchon has three children. At this time he applied for a new loan and wants to buy wheat and rice.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat and rice

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa V. lives with her two children and husband, Arvin V..  She is a 22 years old former "sales lady" in Tagbilaran Bohol.  

Jessa started her seaweed farm using her small savings of Php 5,000.  She is happy that her husband is highly skilled at planting seaweed.  This is how they feed and clothe their family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI.  Jessa will use the loan to buy seedlings and have their boat repaired.  The loan will definitely help the couple increase the size of their farm and continue their livelihood.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own businesses.  They give all their clients credit, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Buy seedlings and repair boat.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita G. is a 72 year old mother of eight who has been a member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Incorporated) for nine years.  She is applying for a loan to buy a second hand tricycle (a motorcycle with side car) and to repair a fishing boat.  Her previous loans were used to buy a motorized boat used in fishing.   The boat was managed by her son.   

She joined ASHI to fill the spot vacated by her daughter Jocelyn, who died because of a terminal ailment. Rosita’s long membership has really impacted her life and her family’s too.   She has been able to send all her children to college, and all of them are now degree holders.  Four have become seafarers.

The income is shared with the family and supports the education of her grand children, the children of her deceased daughter who she is now helping to raise.

She hopes that in the future, she could save more money to repair their house and to send her grand children to a university.

loans.use: Buy a used motorcycle with side car and repair a fishing boat.

loans.name: Cecilna

texts.en:
Cecilna B. grows seaweed. She is 29 years old and has two children.  Cecilna dreams to send all her children to college so that when they look for a job, they will be easily hired.  She has "sales lady" work experience.  Cecilna was not happy about her salary and decided to quit and mange a seaweed farm instead.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI.  She will use the loan to buy more seaweed seedlings to grow her farm.  Some of the loan will also be used to repair her boat pump and engine.

CEVI is helping seaweed farmers grow and increase the size of the farms.  CEVI provides its client not only with credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Buy seedlings, boat pump and engine.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva M. owns a small fishing boat. She is a 58 years old woman who fishes. Minerva has seven children who also help her fishing business. They are fishermen in their village. They spent their lives in the sea. Fish is what they use to feed and clothe their family.

Aside from fish selling, she grows seaweed. Her husband, Felix is the one who manages their farm. They work hard to provide for the needs and their children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. Minerva will use the loan to purchase a new pump boat. The loan will help them work as fishermen and seaweed farmers.

CEVI gives Minerva access to credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to help her small business grow.

loans.use: Purchase a new pump boat.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora M. and her husband catch fish for a living. She is 41 years old and has five children. Leonora has an old "banka" (boat), that they use to fish.

Their income from fish selling is what they use to feed and clothe their family. Aside from fish, they also own a small seaweed farm. They sell their seaweed together with their fish in the town market. They want to grow their business to support their children's growing needs.

Leonora is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy a new boat to fish. The loan will also be use to purchase more seedlings to increase the size of her seaweed farm. The loan will truly help the couple continue their work.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that help people start and have their own businesses. They give their clients not only credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase new fishing boat.

loans.name: Carolina Elizabeth

texts.es: Carolina Elizabeth P. R., reside en Ilopango junto a su compañero de vida y su  pequeña hija. A sus 26 años de edad y a pesar de ser una mujer muy joven, es una mujer que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora y honrada. Carolina posee una sastrería en la cual se encarga de coser ropa para hombre, a pesar que el negocio esta ubicado muy lejos de su casa, aproximadamente hora y media, logra obtener muy buenas ganancias. A pesar de esto Carolina necesita mejorar su negocio, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda comprar más tela para sus trajes, y de esta manera brindarles más productos a sus clientes y poder entregarles sus pedidos más rápido. Ella desea mucho poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de esta manera mejorar su estilo de vida pero en especial  el de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Carolina Elizabeth P. R. lives in Ilopango with her live-in partner and young daughter. She is 26-years old, and although very young, stands out as an honest and hard worker. Carolina owns a tailor's shop that makes men's clothing. Even though the business is far from her house, about one and a half hours, she earns a good profit. Still, Carolina needs to improve her business. Therefore she is requesting a loan, through which she can buy more fabric for the suits she makes, thereby offering more choices to her customers and finishing orders more quickly. She hopes to help her husband with household expenses and thus improve their quality of life, especially for her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for her business

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma A. O., reside en San Jacinto junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores de edad, ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa en el mercado del lugar, dicho puesto esta ubicado en muy buena zona comercial, ya que logra obtener una venta razonable, debido a que posee varios clientes fieles. Irma solicita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda invertir en el negocio, permitiéndole comprar más ropa y poder agregar otros productos a su negocio, de manera que pueda tener mayores ganancias ofreciéndoles más opciones a sus clientes. Irma desea poder brindarles un mejor futuro a sus tres hijos y es por ello que es conciente de trabajar arduamente por ellos, es de esta manera es que Irma desea mejorar su negocio, para brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma A. O. lives in San Jacinto with her husband and three young children. She has a business in clothing sales in the market of her town. It is located in a good commercial zone and she makes a reasonable amount of sales, due to her loyal clients. Irma is requesting a loan to invest in her business, allowing her to buy more clothing and to add more products to her business, so that she can have greater earnings and offer more options to her clients. Irma wants to be able to offer her three children a better future and this is why she works hard for them. This is how Irma wants to improve her business and offer a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more material for her business

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Mrs. Julie D., 36, is married and lives in Punta Blanca, Oroquieta City. Her husband is a fisherman and they are blessed with two children. Mrs. D. has a “sari-sari” store (general store). Their daily consumption is derived from the income of the store, which was started with a capital of only PHP 500. The friendly neighbors are her potential customers.

She became a member of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative in September 2008 and has completed loans already. She is happy because some of her dreams materialized because of Paglaum. She was able to buy appliances out of her income from the store.

Now she applies for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods and other commodities for sale. Her greatest achievement as a mother is to see her children finish their studies and have a comfortable life ahead in their chosen professions.

loans.use: To buy additional canned goods and other commodities for sale

loans.name: Josefa Avelina

texts.es: Josefa Avelina S., reside en La Coruña. Vive en la casa de su hijo y vive junto a el, su nuera y su nieto. Josefa posee una pequeña tienda, la cuál se ve muy beneficiada debido a que no se encuentran otras tiendas en el lugar, por lo cual los vecinos asisten únicamente a su tienda. Josefa solicita un préstamo para poder invertir más en su negocio, ya que desea poder comprar granos básicos y otros objetos de uso personal como jabón, papel higiénico, entre otros. Josefa desea  poder ampliar su tienda, de manera que pueda ser visitada  tanto por sus vecinos cercanos como por los más lejanos, esto contribuiría en gran manera a que Josefa obtenga mayores ganancias, ya que necesita mejorar sus ventas, debido a que solamente de esta manera podrá percibir mayores ganancias, de manera que pueda contribuir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Josefa Avelina S. lives in La Coruña. She lives in her son's house with him, her daughter-in-law, and her grandson. Josefa owns a small shop which has the great advantage of being the only one in the area, so the neighbors only patronize her shop. Josefa is requesting a loan that she will invest in her business, purchasing staple grains and items of personal use like soap and toilet paper. Josefa would like to be able to expand her store, so that it will be visited not just by nearby neighbors but also by people who live farther away. This would be a great help in increasing her earnings. She needs to increase her sales in order to earn more income and be able to contribute more to household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains for her store

loans.name: Donesa

texts.en:
Mrs. Donesa P., 26, is married and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is blessed with three children. For her, in order to survive in the present challenges, both husband and wife must work. Her husband is a collector for a lending institution. The only way for her to earn was to open a “sari-sari” (general) store while at home. It started with only a small amount of capital. Her goods were displayed on a table adjacent to their house.

Last September, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to avail herself of additional working capital. After paying her previous loan, she now applies for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store. In the future, she wants to expand her sari-sari into a grocery store. She also hopes that she will be able to send all her children to a decent school.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for sale

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio J. M., reside en colonia Santa Marta junto a sus dos hijas menores de edad y su esposa. El posee un negocio de ventas de cereales, granos básicos, frutas y verduras, entre más.  Su venta está ubicada en el mercado de San Jacinto, dicho negocio posee una muy buena ubicación, la cual contribuye a que tenga muchos clientes. Es por esto último que Juan Antonio solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda suministrar de más productos a su negocio, de manera que él pueda tener mucho más que ofrecerle a sus clientes frecuentes y así mismo poder obtener nuevos clientes, a través de los cuales pueda percibir mayores ganancia  a través de la cuales sea capaz de brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio J. M. lives in the department of Santa Marta together with his two young children and his wife. He owns a business which sells cereals, grains, fruits and vegetable among other things. His shop is located in the market of San Jacinto and said business has a very good location which contributes to the fact that he has many customers. It is for this reason that Juan Antonio is asking for a loan through which he can supply more products at his business, and thus can have much more to offer his frequent customers and also obtain new customers. From this he can make a greater profit and thus will be capable of providing everything his family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products for retail

location.town: Santa Marta, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús M. S., reside en Lourdes Colón junto a su compañera de vida y una hija menor de edad. Manuel posee un negocio de venta de ropa, miel y cocos,  el cual está ubicado en un lugar de mucha afluencia de personas. Su esposa trabaja en conjunto con él en el negocio, ambos son una pareja muy trabajadora los cuales tienen como referencia el ser personas muy responsables y esforzadas. Manuel de Jesús solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir mucho más en su negocio, ya que uno de sus mayores deseos es ver su negocio en muy buenas condiciones y con mayores productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, de esta manera el podrá mejorar la economía de su familia ya que este es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús M. S. lives in Lourdes Colon together with his life partner and a daughter, who is still a minor. Manuel owns a business where he sells clothing, honey and coconuts, which is located in a well travelled location. His wife works with him on the business, they are a hardworking couple and they are known to be very responsible and strongly driven. Manuel de Jesus requests a loan so that he will be able to invest much more into his business. One of his greatest dreams is to see his business in good shape and with more products to sell to his clients. He will be able to improve his family's finances, especially important because this is the only source of income for the family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es: Marta Elizabeth C. G., reside en Plan del pino en ciudad delgado, vive junto a sus padres y tiene como ocupación el ser estudiante de Administración de empresas de la Universidad Centro Americana de El Salvador. Ella posee una tienda llamada “tienda Martita” la cuál es administrada y atendida por ella misma, ya que sus padres se la entregaron a ella para que pudiera obtener el dinero para seguir adelante con sus estudios universitarios. En su negocio vende ropa, granos básicos, bebidas, embutidos, pollos, entre otras cosas más de primera necesidad, su tienda  posee muy buena demanda ya que es una de las tiendas más surtidas del lugar. Marta solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar tambos de gas para comercializarlos en el lugar, así como también productos de la canasta básica. Ella desea poder vender más en su negocio para que de esta manera pueda ser capaz de seguir pagando sus estudios, ya que su meta principal es el de llegar a ser una mujer profesional la cual pueda ayudar a sus padres en un futuro.
texts.en:
Marta Elizabeth C. G. lives in Plan del Pino in the city of Delgado. She lives together with her parents and she is a Business Administration student at the Central America University in El Salvador. She has a store called "Tienda Martita" that is run and owned by her. Her parents gave it to her so that she will be able to earn money to keep up her studies in university. She sells clothings, basic grains, drinks, coldcuts, chicken, and other primary needs items. Her store sees a great demand because it has the best selection in the region. Marta requests a loan so that she will be able to purchase tanks of gas to resell them in her store, and also to purchase other basic products. She wants to be able to sell more through her business so that she will be able to keep up with her tuition. Her primary goal is to become a professional and to later be able to help her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic needs products and tanks of gas.

location.town: Plan del Pino, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es: Norma del Carmen C. de 33 años de edad, reside en Zaragoza junto a su esposo y dos hijos los cuales son estudiantes de plan básico. Ella posee un negocio de venta de lácteos los cuales los comercializa de forma ambulante junto a su esposo, ya que este posee una pequeña camioneta la cual les sirve para repartir el queso en diferentes lugares del departamento de la Libertad, ambos poseen muy buenas referencias crediticias y además gozan de muy buena fama por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras. Norma tiene muy buenas ventas ya que posee clientes fijos los cuales compran siempre su producto. Ella solicita un préstamo ya que su deseo es el poder incrementar las ventas, debido a que desea que sus hijos continúen estudiando y teniendo una vida suplida de todas las necesidades básicas, gracias a l préstamo obtenido ella podrá comprar más queso el cual la proveerá de mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Norma del Carmen C. is 33 years old and lives in Zaragoza together with her husband and their two children, currently attending primary school. She owns a business selling milk products that she sells with her husband from door to door with the help of a small van. They distribute cheese to different regions of La Libertad. They both have good credit references and they are known to be hardworking and responsible people. Norma secures very good sales because she has steady customers who always purchase her products. She requests a loan so that she will be able t increase her sales. She wants to see her children continue their studies and she wants to provide them with all the basic necessities of life. Thanks to this loan she will be able to purchase more cheese that will provide her with greater earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese.

loans.name: Rozalina

texts.en:
"Skillful and determined woman" describes Mrs. Rozalina M., who is 47, married and living in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She has three children. Her husband is a farmer.

At first, Mrs. M. baked bread for her husband during snack time. Many of her neighbors who tasted her bread encouraged her to bake bread and sell it to them. Because she enjoys what she’s doing, she tried and it was successful. In order to have additional capital, she joined Paglaum Muti-Purpose Cooperative to take a loan.

As a member in good standing, she is on her 11th loan cycle already. Now she applies for a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy flour and ingredients for making bread. She plans to have mixing equipment someday and to expand her business into a bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga A. de 59 años de edad reside en la colonia San Juan, vive junto a su madre. Olga posee una pequeña tienda en la cual vende golosinas y bebidas, ella tiene 42 años de poseer su negocio, el cuál es su principal fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Ella posee una muy buena reputación por ser una mujer muy amigable, responsable y trabajadora, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en calle principal, factor que le beneficia en gran manera. 
Ella ha solicitado un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar otros tipos de bebidas y golosinas, ya que desea aumentar sus ventas y estos son los productos que más demanda poseen. Ella desea poder incrementar su negocio, con el fin de poder ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, de manera que puedan obtener una vida más feliz juntas teniendo todo lo necesario para el hogar.
texts.en:
Olga A. is 59 years old, and lives in the San Juan colony along with her mother. Olga has a small store where she sells snacks and beverages. She has had her business for 42 years, and it is the primary means of income for her household. She has a very good reputation for being a woman who is friendly, responsible, and hard-working. The business is located on a major street, a fact that is of great benefit to her. She has requested a loan with the aim of buying other types of beverages and snacks since she would like to increase her sales, and these are the types of products that are in most demand. She wants to grow her business in order to help her mother with the household expenses, so they can live a happier life together having all the necessities for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more snacks.

loans.name: Patricia Marilú

texts.es: Patricia Marilú G., reside en ciudad Arce junto a su esposo e hijos. Ella posee un negocio frente al Instituto Geriel, su venta de es pupusas, comida típica salvadoreña hecha de masa de maíz revuelta con queso, frijoles y chicharrón, así también vende refrescos y golosinas, ella posee una imagen muy limpia y ordenada y se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora. Patricia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir más su negocio, ya que a pesar que sus ventas son hasta cierto punto estables, no le es suficiente para todos sus gastos personas, es por ello que el mayor deseo de Patricia es el de poder aumentar sus ingresos para poder colaborar juntos a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, con el fin de brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijo.
texts.en:
Patricia Marilú G. lives in the city of Arce, along with her husband and children. She has a business in front of the Geriel Institute where she sells pupusas, a typical Salvadorean food made with corn meal, cheese, beans, and fried pork. She also sells beverages and snacks. She has a reputation for being extremely clean and neat, and stands out for being very hard-working. Patricia requests a loan through which she could better supply her business. Even though her sales are stable up to a certain point, her income is not always enough to cover her personal expenses. This is the reason why Patricia’s greatest wish is to be able to increase her income, so she can contribute to the household expenses with her husband. Her goal is to provide a better standard of living for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ni Kadek Ariani

texts.id: Dengan melihat keuntungan pada pinjaman pertama,Kadek Ariani sangat merasakan betapa ia sangat terbantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari.Semenjak Kadek mendapat modal, kadek lebih semangat untuk mengembangkan usahanya.Untuk itu kadek melanjutkan pinjaman modal yang kedua ini.Kadek berusaha karena ingin membantu suami yang hanya sebagai guru.gaji suami yang didapat dirasakan kadek tidak cukup,karena harga barang-barang sembako semakin hari semakin meningkat.Karena itu Kadek ingin selalu mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari/Kiva,agar bisa menambah bibit babi yang dipelihara semakin banyak.Agar keuntungan yang diterima lebih meningkat.Untuk sekarang ini aktivitas kadek tetap berusaha memlihara penggemukan.Dan hasilnya kadek sudah bisa membeli bibit dari keuntungan yang terdahulu.Kadek Sangat senang dalam menjalani usaha ini.semoga untuk kedepannya kadek bisa mengembangkan lebih baik lagi usaha dan bisa membantu Suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya.
texts.en:
Having seen the earnings from the first loan, Kadek Ariani felt extremely how she was able to assist in fulfilling the daily needs. Since Kadek received the financing, Kadek is more enthused towards developing her endeavor. For that Kadek commence the second financing loan. Kadek makes this effort because of her desire to help out her husband who is only a teacher. As Kadek feels that her husband’s teacher’s salary is inadequate, as prices of basic needs continues to rise each day. Due to that Kadek wish to continue to obtain loan from Dinari/Kiva, in order to add the piglets being raised gradually increase. Thus profit earned will increase further. For now Kadek will actively concentrate her efforts on raising pigs. And from the yield, Kadek already purchased piglets from prior profits. Kadek carries out this endeavor with ease, hopefully for the future Kadek is able to develop her endeavor better and ia able to supplement her husband fulfill the family’s need.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more piglets and feeds

loans.name: Edith Emelda

texts.es: Edith Emelda M., vive en la Colonia  San Felipe departamento de Ilopango; Edith tiene 50 años de edad vive con su esposo y tres hijos. Edith se dedica a su negocio que es una tortillera ubicada dentro de su misma casa; con los ingresos de esta tortillería Edith es un gran apoyo económico para la familia ya que asumen múltiples gastos,  ya que sus tres hijos asisten a la escuela. Edith es una mujer trabajadora y muy querida por los vecinos de la zona quiénes son sus fieles clientes, cabe mencionar que  Edith ya ha tenido créditos anteriormente y ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos. Ahora nuevamente  Edith solicita crédito para comprar materia prima para sus tortillas.
texts.en:
Edith Emelda M. lives in the suburb of San Felipe, in the department of Ilopango. Edith is 50 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. Edith has a tortilla-making business which she operates from her own house. With the income from the tortilla-making Edith is able to be a great economic help to her family, who have numerous expenses as her three children attend school. Edith is a hard-working mother, well-loved by her neighbours who are her loyal customers. It's worth mentioning that Edith has had previous loans and has been very responsible with the repayment. Now Edith is asking for a new loan in order to buy the raw ingredients for her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients to make tortillas

location.town: Colonia  San Felipe, departamento de Ilopango

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es: Rosa Aminta N. D. L., resiD. en la colonia nuestra Señora D. La Paz ubicada en el municipio D. Zaragoza, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como vigilante y sus dos hijas las cuales son estudiantes. Rosa Aminta posee una venta D. flores naturales en el mercado D. Santa Tecla en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en la compra D. más flores D. manera que más personas la busquen en el mercado y puedan comprarle sus hermosas flores, a pesar  que su negocio ha sido muy estable ella necesita percibir mayores ganancias las cuales contribuyan para solventar los gastos del hogar y los estudios D. sus pequeños hijos. Es por ello que ella solicita ayuda a través D. un préstamo, el cual le beneficie a ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Aminta N. D. L., lives in the suburb 'Our Lady of Peace' located in the municipality of Zaragoza, together with her husband who works as a security guard and her two daughters who are students. Rosa Aminta has a stall where she sells fresh flowers in the Santa Tecla market in the department of La Libertad. She is asking for a loan so that she can invest it in purchasing more flowers so that more people will seek her out in the market in order to buy her beautiful flowers. Although her business has been very stable, she needs to secure larger profits so that they contribute to covering the household expenses and the studies of her two small children. It is for this reason that she is asking for help in the shape of a loan, which will benefit her and all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more flowers

loans.name: Ni Ketut Wardani

texts.id: Setelah menjalani usaha dalam satu tahun ini,ketut Wardani yang memang sejak mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari,sudah merasakan keuntungan dari pemeliharaan sapi yang sekarang masih ditekuninya.Dari dua pasang sapi yang dipelihara sudah bisa menghasilkan anak sapi sebanyak satu ekor.sapi kecil ini dipelihara beberapa bulan setelah itu  dijual agar bisa membeli pakan dan mendapat keuntungan dari penjualan sapi ini.Ternyata hasil dari usaha ini sangat meringankan beban Ketut Wardani.Selain bisa membiayai kebutuhan sehari-hari,juga bisa membatu membiayai sekolah anaknya,walaupun hanya sedikit.Untuk pinjaman yang kedua ini ketut wardani lebih bersemangat dalam menekuni usaha ini.Keinginan ketut, untuk pinjaman yang kedua ini sapinya bisa beranak dan sehat.Dan Induk yang ada akan selalu dipelihara agar bisa menghasilakn banyak anak sapi.sehingga bisa mengembangkan usaha lebih maju.Walaupun dengan keringat lelah mencari rumput untuk memberi makan sapi peliharaannya. semangat yang ada pada diri ketut sangat besar.sehingga tanpa mengenal waktu ketut selalu berkeliling mencari makanan untuk sapi peliharaannya.Untuk kedepannya ketut ingin modal yang diberikan bisa bertambah.sehingga bisa membeli satu pasang Induk sapi.agar usaha bisa berkembang lebih maju.
texts.en:
After carrying out this endeavor for the past year, Ketut Wardini since receiving loan from Dinari, already benefit from earnings generated from raising cow which activity she currently is still diligent in. From the 2 pairs of cows raised already yield a calf; this calf was raised for several months thereafter sold to fund the purchase of supplies and generate earnings from the sale of the cow. Apparently the yield from this lighten significantly Ketut Wardini’s burden. Besides paying for daily needs it also pays her child’s education, although only a little. For this second loan, her cows are still producing and healthy. And the bull she has will always be raised in order to produce many calves until the endeavor develop more successfully. Even though through sweat and hardship seek for grass to feed the cows raised, Ketut’s enthusiasm has been huge until without realizing the time, Ketut always seek food in the surrounding for the cows. In the future, Ketut hopes the funding given will increase until sufficient to purchase a pair of bulls so that the endeavor will develop more successfully.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario M. P., reside en Lourdes Colón junto a su compañero de vida y su único hijo menor de edad. Ella posee una pequeña venta de dulces y otro tipo de golosinas, su negocio está ubicado frente a una cancha y un centro escolar, lo cual la beneficia ya que percibe ganancias gracias a la compra que los alumnos de dicho centro escolar realizan  en su negocio. Rosario solicita un préstamo con el fin de contar con el dinero para poder invertir más en su negocio comprando más golosinas y productos de primera necesidad. Todo esto ella lo desea con el fin de poder colaborar con los gastos del hogar con la finalidad de poder ver feliz a sus hijos y con la satisfacción de poderles brindar todo lo necesario para su hogar, poder brindarles una mejor alimentación y todo lo necesario para sus estudios.
texts.en:
Rosario M. P., lives in Lourdes suburb together with her partner and her only son who is still a minor. She has a small store selling sweets and other snacks. Her business is located in front of a playing field and a school, which helps her as she makes money thanks to the purchases made by the students from the school. Rosario is asking for a loan with the aim of using the money to invest in her business by buying more snacks and essential goods. She wants all this in order to contribute to the household expenses with the aim of seeing her children happy and being satisfied that she can provide them with everything necessary for their homes: she will be able to give them better food and everything necessary for their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase essential goods

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suweni

texts.id: Harga coklat memang tidak menentu.tidak membuat suweni kendor dalam menjalani usaha bertani coklat.Karena setelah diberi pinjaman yang pertama hasil buah coklat yang dihasilkan sangat memuaskan.Pinjaman yang pertama tersebut digunakan untuk membeli obat yang bisa membuat buah coklat tidak terserang penyakit.Sehingga bisa mendapat buah yang bagus dan hasil yang memuaskan. pemeliharaan kebun coklat selalu dilakukan sampai sekarang,agar jauh dari penyakit.setiap harinya Suweni pergi kekebun bersama Suami pada pagi hari sampai sore.selain merawat dan membersihkan juga kadang membawa buah coklat yang sudah matang.Hasil yang diterima semakin meningkat.sehingga keuntungan yang diterima juga lumayan.Untuk  pinjaman yang kedua ini akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit coklat.agar bisa lebih banyak mendapatkan hasil.Usaha ini sangat membantu kebutuhan keluarga Suweni.Semoga untuk kedepannya,Bisa mendapat pinjaman yang berkelanjutan.agar bisa lebih mengembangkan usahAnya.
texts.en:
The price for chocolate being definitely uncertain does not make it flexible for Suweni in operating as a cacao farmer. Because after being given a first loan yield from the cocoa bean was encouraging. The stated first loan was used to buy pesticides to prevent the cocoa beans from being infested. With the result of good beans and encouraging yield, tending to the cacao plantation usually conducted until now, so that is it safe from disease, every day Suweni goes to the plantation with her husband in the morning until evening, besides feeding and maintaining also sometimes harvesting ripen beans. Yield generated is gradually increasing until earnings attained are acceptable. For this second loan will be used to buy cacao seedlings so that more yield will be produced. This endeavor significantly assists meeting Suweni’s family’s needs. Hopefully, in the future, receiving subsequent loan will expand her endeavor.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cacao seeds

loans.name: Sonia Mercedes

texts.es: Sonia Mercedes G. D. M. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en la colonia Santa Isabel en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos los cuales  viven en casa propia. Sonia es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, la cual goza mucho D. poder mejorar la vida D. su familia a través D. su trabajo. Ella posee una venta D. pupusas (platillo típico salvadoreño, hecho con masa D. maíz revuelto con queso, chicharrón y frijoles), Así también posee una venta D. pollo y papas fritas en el mismo lugar. Sonia posee mucha suerte D. que su negocio este ubicado en la terminal D. Ahuachapán, lo cual le beneficia ya que posee muchos clientes. Sonia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más pollo y papas para poder ofrecer más a sus clientes. Ella desea invertir mucho en su negocio ya que este le ha beneficiado mucho en la economía del hogar haciendo que su estabilidad económica mejore, desD. el día que lo creo.
texts.en:
Sonia Mercedes G. D. M., 59 years old, lives in the Santa Isabel section of the department of Ahuachapán with her husband and two children in a house they own. Sonia is a very hard-working and responsible person, who gets much joy from being able to improve her family’s standard of living through her work. She has a business selling “pupusas” (a typical Salvadorean food maD. from corn meal, cheese, fried pork and beans). In addition, she also sells chicken and French fries from the same location. Sonia has been very lucky in that her business is located in the Ahuachapán terminal, which benefits her because she has many customers. Sonia requests a loan so she can buy more chicken and potatoes, to have more products to offer her customers. She wants to invest a great deal into her business since it has greatly benefited the household economically, helping to stabilize their financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicken and potatoes.

location.town: Colonia Santa Isabel, departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en:
Chhang C. R., 26, is a professional decorator of handicrafts living at home in the Takeo province. Since 2005, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothing to earn a living, and typically makes US$5 each day. Decorated dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and the price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer handmade to machine made. Her husband sells wood and earns US$20 in revenue every day.

In order to increase her profits, she is asking for a loan of US$500 to raise pigs. (She is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Ni Wayan Wenji

texts.id: Dalam satu tahun ini,setelah mendapat pinjaman pertama dari Dinari, banyak keuntungan yang diterima oleh wayan Wenji. Hasil penyewaan kerbau yang dimilikinya sangat meningkat. Dalam satu tahun hasil penyewaan yang diterima sebesar Rp.3.000.000.- Dari hasil menyewakan kerbau, ia sudah bisa membeli satu ekor kerbau lagi. Ini juga adalah keuntungan dari usaha Wenji. Dalam kesehariannya wenji yang sudah setengah baya ini selalu pergi kesawah untuk mencari rumput untuk kerbaunya agar kerbau yang dipelihara tetap sehat dan kuat. Suaminya juga sering ikut membantu Wayan Wenji kalau lagi tidak sibuk. Mereka sangat senang dalam menjalani usaha ini. Karena mereka ingin untuk pinjaman yang kedua usaha mereka lebih berkembang. Wenji berharap bisa membeli sepasang kerbau lagi agar keuntungan dari penyewaan dan hasil dari anak kerbau bisa meringankan beban rumah tanggannya sehingga perekonomian mereka lebih berkembang.
texts.en:
In this year, after receiving the first loan from Dinari, Ni Wayan Wenji made much profit. Revenue from leasing the buffalo she owns continued to increase. In a year lease revenue received amounted to Rp.3.000.000.- From the buffalo lease revenue, she is able to purchase another buffalo. This is also profit from Wenji’s effort. Everyday, Wenji who already partially repaid this goes to the rice field to collect grass for the buffalo so that the buffalo being reared will be healthy and strong. Her husband also partakes to assist Wayan Wenji if he is not busy. They are delighted in performing this effort. As they are desirous of a second loan to develop their efforts further. Wenji hopes to purchase another pair of buffaloes so that profit from lease and revenue from the young buffalo will lighten the family’s burden so that their economic condition more stable.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy buffalo

loans.name: Vilma Haydee

texts.es: Vilma Haydee C. B., vive junto a su esposo y sus nietos en el puerto de la libertad. Ella posee un negocio de venta de mariscos y otros alimentos en la bocana en la playa de San Diego, ya que su negocio esta cerca de la calle principal hay muchos buses los cuales se detienen para que las personas puedan comer en dicho lugar, situación que le beneficia en gran manera a Vilma. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder invertir en su negocio, ya que pronto será la temporada de vacaciones y es el tiempo en el que ella tiene muchos más clientes, es por ello que ella desea invertir más para tener más platillos que ofrecer a las personas. Vilma tiene  mucha necesidad de poder mejorar los ingresos familiares, ya que son personas muy humildes las cuales trabajan a diario por una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma Haydee C. B. lives with her husband and grandchildren in the port of La Libertad. She has a business selling fish and other food at the channel of San Diego beach. Since her business is close to the main street, there are many buses that stop so people can eat there. This greatly benefits Vilma’s business. She requests a loan with the aim of investing in her business, since it will soon be vacation season and it’s the time of year when she enjoys the most customers. It’s for this reason that she would like to have more dishes to offer. Vilma has a great need to improve the family’s income. They are very humble people who work on a daily basis to improve their lives and that of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more food.

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn B. is a 41 year-old mother of five, who has been a member of ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Incorporated) for eleven years. She sells fish every day around her village to support the needs of her family.

She applied for this loan to buy a sidecar for a motorcycle and to make a down payment on a motorcycle. Rizalyn will use some of her loan as additional capital for fish vending.

Rizalyn hopes that in the future, she could get a stall in the market to sell her fish and get a transport vehicle, to increase her income, and to avoid her walking every day. During times of good catch, they could also use the vehicle to sell fish in other places to maximize their income.

Rizalyn dreams of sending her children to school and to build a better house.

loans.use: Buy a sidecar and make down payment on a motorcycle.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S. is 23 years old and lives with her brother and mother in the Takeo province. She stays at home and weaves silk scarfs to earn a living. Every day, she is able to make US $5 of profit.

Her brother is a worker in the Ministry of Plantation, and he makes US $2 per day.

Kong S. is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase silks to weave scarfs. (Kong S.,is on the left, pictured with her mother.)

loans.use: Purchase silks to weave scarfs.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en: Mrs. Emeliana P., 62 years old, lives in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 7 children. Her greatest desire is to continually support her family through her nipa weaving business. In order to have additional capital, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2008. Recently, she applied for a PHP 7,000 loan to buy additional nipa. She plans to open a “sari-sari” store someday for added income.

loans.use: To buy nipa leaves for nipa weaving

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng R., 50, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Takeo province. She makes and sells rice noodle to earn a living and is able to make approximately US $5 eveR. day.

Her husband has a water pump and he services farmers. On average, he makes US $6 in revenue per day. Two of their children are construction workers and one is in school.

Meng R. is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to operate a motor-taxi business. (Meng is pictured with her husband).

loans.use: Operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Розиков Хабибулло проживает в Гиссарском районе. Женат Имеет четверых детей. Имеет среднее образование. По профессии шофер. Но работает в сфере бизнеса . Имеет магазин рядом с домом , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 25 лет. Его бизнес позволяет населению пользоваться его услугами, так как они живут далеко от центра и им тяжело выезжать за продуктами. В данный момент бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи , поэтому получение кредита является единственной возможностью увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Habibullo R. lives in the Gissarkiy region. He is married and has 4 children. He has secondary education. He is a driver by training, but he primarily works in trade. Habibullo owns a grocery store which is located very close to his house. He has been in this business for the past 25 years. His store offers convenience and helps local residents to obtain groceries close to their home without needing to go to the center of the city. Currently, this business is the single source of income for Habibullo's family. For this reason, this loan will significantly help him by giving him the opportunity to increase the inventory. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Zahida Yanet

texts.es: Zahida Yanet G. D. de 23 años de edad, reside en La Libertad, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa alquilada. Ella posee una panadería y pastelería, tanto Zahida como su esposo gozan de muy buena fama por ser personas muy trabajadoras, las cuales brindan muy buena atención a sus clientes. Ella también realiza preparación de eventos y tiene servicio a domicilio. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo, para poder invertir en su negocio, ya que vale la pena debido a que tiene muchos clientes, así también desea surtir más su negocio ya que es la única fuente de ingresos de la familia. Zahida es una mujer que trabaja mucho por sus hijos para que estos obtengan lo mejor, y solo mejorando las ganancias de su negocio podrá lograr darles un mejor estilo de vida a su familia, es por ello que necesita invertir más en su negocio y poder percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Zahida Yanet G. D., 23 years of age, lives in a rented house in La Libertad with her husband and two children. She owns a bakery, and her and her husband are known to be hard workers who provide a great deal of attention to their customers. She also does event planning and household services. The reason she requests a loan is to invest in her business, which is worthwhile because she has many customers. She would also like to better supply her business since it is the only source of income for the family. Zahida is a woman who works hard to provide for her children, and only by increasing her income will she be able to offer them a better quality of life. It’s for this reason she needs to invest in her enterprise to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for the bakery.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Darmini

texts.id: Sejak lama Darmini sudah menggeluti usaha ini.Dari dahulu warung darmini selalu ramai dikunjungi pembeli.Dalam satu tahun setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari/Kiva,warung darmini semakin banyak menerima omset penjualan dalan satu hari.modal pertama digunakan untuk menambah  barang dagangannya.Sehingga hasil penjulan meningkat dan keuntungnan tersebut digunakan untuk membeli barang dagangan lagi.Warung Darmini sangat maju pesat dengan modal awal yang diberikan Dinari.Sampai sampai sekarang usaha warung bisa ditambah dengan menjual lontong dan es.yang dulu tempat menjula lontong agak kecil,sekarang sudah lebih besar.Setiap harinya Darmini dengan tekun menjaga warungnya.Dan Setelah dari pasar Darmini langsung berjualan diwarungnya sampai malam.Darmini sangat senang menjalani usaha ini.karena Darmini sudah menerima keuntungan yang lumayan.Untuk kedepannya Darmini ingin modal yang diberikan akan digunakan memperluas warungnya.sehingga pelanggan juga bisa bertambah.Dan Darmini ingin Barang dagangnnya semakin brtambah.
texts.en:
Since a while ago Darmini had already been handling this venture. From previously, many customers always visit Darmini’s stall. In a year from receiving the loan from Dinari/Kiva, Darmini’s stall increasing receive more sale in a day. The first funding was used to increase the variety of goods for sale. Until revenue from sale increase and the gains used to buy more trading goods. Darmini’s stall has been thriving rapidly with the earlier funding provided by Dinari. Until now the stall business is added with cooked rice in banana leaf and ice, previously places that sells cooked rice in banana leaf are small, now much larger. Every day, Darmini diligently attend to her stall. And after returning from market, Darmini immediately attends her stall till night. Darmini is delighted in operating this venture, as Darmini already generated moderate gains. Darmini intends to use the given funding to expand her stall so that it can accommodate more customers. And Darmini intends to increase the variety of goods for sale.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make larger store

loans.name: Anonymous
