loans.use: Enlarge his farming business.

loans.name: Mikocheni A Group

texts.en:
Balbina Victory, age 43, is single with three children ages 23, 17 and 14. She sells newspapers in Sukari House, right in the city centre of Stannic Bank, and after that she sells food. She works from 5am to 6pm daily. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $231.

This will be Balbina’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the two loans to increase stock by buying more newspapers and food and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase capital by increasing both businesses.

Balbina will share this loan with Subgroup A of the Mikocheni A group. The subgroup has eight members, who run cafes, general stores, clothing sales, snacks, tie and dye. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Balbina is 3rd from right, back row in green.

loans.use: Buy more newspapers and food stock.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.ru: Бадалов Самандар проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 28 лет, женат , но детей пока нет. Кроме его жены с ним живут его родители. Семья большая , поэтому для того, чтобы обеспечить семью всем необходимым , ему приходится много работать. В данный момент он работает частным таксистом. Обратился за кредитом для того, чтобы произвезти ремонт автомашины. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Samandar B. lives in the Gissar region. He is 28 years old, married, but does not have any children yet. His parents also live with him besides his wife. The family is big and this is why he needs to work a lot to be able to provide his family with necessities. At this time he works as a taxi driver. He is asking for a loan to make repairs on his car. He can pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Mrs. Elena S. is 47 years old, married and lives at Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. With PHP 3,000 starting capital, Elena and her husband strived hard for their "lechon" (roasted pig) & meat-dealing business. Having good sales, the couple decided to acquire a stall in the public market where they can display their meat. In order for them to expand their business, they acquired a loan at Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in July 2007. Being a member in good standing, applying for a loan has been so easy. Elena applies for PHP 40,000 to buy pigs for sale including feed. She plans to buy a rice field and coconut land someday if they have promising sales.

loans.use: To buy pigs for sale and feed

loans.name: Uldosh

texts.ru: Улугов Юсуфали житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 43 года. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование средне-специальное. По профессии шофер. Работает частным таксистом. Опыт работы ужен около 20 лет. Работает по маршруту Душанбе-Гиссар. Кредит необходим для того, чтобы закупить автозапчасти. Таким образом он сможет сделать своевременный ремонт машины. Полгасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Uldosh U. lives in the Gissar region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has four children. He has a secondary-specialty education. He is a driver by profession. Uldosh works as a private taxi driver. He has around 20 years of experience. Uldosh works on the route Dushanbe-Gissar. A loan is necessary to purchase spare auto parts. This will allow him to make modern repairs to his car. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix car.

loans.name: Ni Luh Deli

texts.id: Sudah satu tahun ini,Deli merasakan keuntungan yang lumayan, sejak mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari/Kiva.Dari dua pasang sapi yang dipelihara sudah bisa menghasilkan anak sapi sebanyak satu ekor.sapi kecil ini dipelihara beberapa bulan setelah itu  dijual agar bisa membeli pakan dan mendapat keuntungan dari penjualan sapi ini.Ternyata hasil dari usaha ini sangat meringankan beban Deli.Selain bisa membiayai kebutuhan sehari-hari,juga bisa membatu Suami dalam membiayai sekolah anaknya,walaupun hanya sedikit.Karena Suami Deli hanya seorang petani.Untuk pinjaman yang kedua ini Deli  lebih bersemangat dalam menekuni usaha ini.Keinginan Deli, untuk pinjaman yang kedua ini sapinya bisa beranak dan sehat.Dan Induk yang ada akan selalu dipelihara agar bisa menghasilakn banyak anak sapi.sehingga bisa mengembangkan usaha lebih maju.Walaupun dengan keringat lelah mencari rumput untuk memberi makan sapi peliharaannya. semangat yang ada sangat besar.sehingga tanpa mengenal waktu Deli selalu berkeliling mencari makanan untuk sapi peliharaannya.Kadang juga Sapi peliharaannya dibawa untuk mencari rumput sendiri.Untuk kedepannya Deli ingin modal yang diberikan bisa bertambah.sehingga bisa membeli satu pasang Induk sapi.agar usaha bisa berkembang lebih maju.
texts.en:
It has already been a year since Deli experienced good gains, since receiving loan from Dinari/Kiva. From 2 pairs of cows being raised, would result in bearing calves, one was born. This calf will be reared for several months after which will be sold in order to buy feed and for gains from selling this calf. Apparently, revenue from this effort will lighten Deli’s burden substantially. Apart from paying for the daily needs, it also assists her husband to support the child’s education, although it is only little. As Deli’s husband is just a farmer. For this second loan, Deli is even more enthusiastic in this effort. Deli’s wish, for this second loan, her cow will be healthy and reproduce. And the mother cow will always be reared to reproduce many more calves, thus this venture will develop to be more successful. Even though this will require more effort to collect grass to feed the cows being reared. Her spirits is high until not noticing the time Deli usually searches the surrounding for food to feed the cows. Sometimes the cows will be herded to seek grass themselves. For the future, Deli wants the funding to increase to sufficiently to purchase a pair of mother cows so that her venture will be more successful.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Боймуродов Файзулло проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 26 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Уже 10 лет занимается производством национальных сундуков. Бизнес приносит доход. В данный момент наступил сезон по реализации данного вида продукции , поэтому Файзулло решил получить кредит и использовать его для покупки материала. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Faizullo B. lives in Gissar. He is 26 years old, married, and has two children. For ten years he has been working making traditional chests. This business provides his income. This is the season for this kind of production; therefore, Faizullo has decided to take out a loan and use it to buy materials. He can pay off the loan in six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is 47 years old, single and resides at Bagakay, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She enjoys tilling her rice field which became a source of income. Emma has been a member of Paglaum under its microfinance program since October 2007. She has promptly repaid her loans and applied recently for PHP 5,000 as her 3rd loan.  The amount will be used for chemicals and fertilizers. She hopes to have an abundant harvest and to save enough for her future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ni Putu Karyawati

texts.id: Karyawati sudah satu tahun  beternak babi.Keuntungan sudah diterima.Dari pemeliharaan yang dahulu yaitu  2 ekor babi penggemukan.Dalam satu tahun Karyawati menjual Babi penggemukannya sebnayak 2 kali.Modal pertama sudah bisa berkembang dan sudah dibelikan bibit kembali.juga keuntungan yang sebagian digunakan untuk membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari.Dalam kesehariannya Kayawati dengan tekun memberi makan dan menyiram kandang sebanyak dua kali.kadang juga Karyawati mencari makanan camilan untuk babi peliharaannya.Suaminya juga kadang membantu Karyawati.Untuk pinjaman yang kedua Karyawati ingin menambah bibit babi agar bisa mendapat keuntungan lebih banyak.Dan Usaha Karyawati bisa tetap berkembang dengan penambahan modal yang berkelanjutan.
texts.en:
Karyawati has been rearing pigs for a year. Profit already made. From the prior rearing of 2 pigs. In a year Karyawati sold grown pigs twice. The first funding already develop and purchased piglets again and a portion of the gains is used to assist her husband in fulfilling the daily needs. Everyday, Karyawati diligently provide feed and wash the pen twice, and occasionally Karyawati seek food for the pigs reared. Her husband also occasionally assists Karyawati. For the second loan Karyawati intends to increase the piglets in order to achieve bigger gain. And Karyawati’s venture will continue to grow with availability of additional funding.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita D. is a resident of Bagakay, Sibutad, in the province of Zamboanga del Norte. She is 50 years old, married and blessed with one kid. She has a small Sari-Sari Store at her residence which started from a little capital. She's been a member of Paglaum under the microfinance program and has made use of the credit services for her Sari-Sari Store. At present she is applying for a loan to buy additional inventories of canned goods, bottled items and basic commodities. 
Anecita smiles at the thought of owning a mini grocery store someday.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married. He and his wife have one son named Nikita, who is 5 years old. Sergei sells women's clothing. His monthly profit is about 3,000 UAH.

Sergei has been in this business for 7 years. He sells clothing at different markets in the Kherson area. Instead of waiting for clients from the area to come to him, he goes out to small markets and provides clothing for many people there. Sergei is a very entrepreneurial and hard working person. He wants to develop this business even further. His business is the only source of income for his family.

Sergei would like to borrow 9,500 UAH to increase his assortment of clothes. He hopes that more variety will increase his sales and help him take better care of his family.

loans.use: To buy more varied clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: B. Sarah is the leader of Gwokale group in Jinja. She is a business lady who runs a retail shop as her business, as well as keeping goats and sheep for a living. This is the 5th loan Sarah is taking from Pearl Microfinance, and she says the previous loans have helped her to expand her shop, increase the number of animals that she keeps, and have also enabled her to buy a plot of land on which she plans to build houses to rent. Sarah needs a loan to help her buy more of her shop products. In her shop she has sugar, muffins, soap, cooking oil and many other things for sale.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more products.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Mrs. Roberta B. is 33 years old, married and a resident of Mobod, Oroquieta City. They are blessed with 2 children. Because it is hard for the family to survive without a stable income, she decided to engage in selling. She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with capital she borrowed from Paglaum. Their primary customers are their neighbors. Successfully, she was able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of her family.

Roberta became a member of Paglaum Cooperative in November 2000. She was able to avail herself of three loans and repaid them religiously. Now, she applies for a loan of PHP 5,000 to finance the purchase of additional stock for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita M. is a 32 year old mother of two. Her husband drives a tricycle taxi (motorcycle with sidecar). His income alone isn’t enough to support the family, so Julita helps by raising pigs.

Julita is applying for a loan to establish a business buying and reselling palay (rice grains). She wants to increase their income. She dreams of expanding her business in the future into an agricultural supply store with a transport vehicle. She looks forward to building a better house, reclaiming their pawned items, and most of all, sending their children to college.

loans.use: To buy and resell palay (rice grains).

loans.name: Merta Nadi Group

texts.id:
Kelompok Merta Nadi sudah mendapatkan pinjaman modal usaha dari Dinari sebanyak dua kali dan mereka merasakan manfaat yang baik dari kerja sama tersebut. Anggota sebelumnya berjumlah sebelas orang dan sekarang dua diantaranya berhenti karena merasa sudah cukup mampu dalam mengelola usahanya dengan modal yang dimiliki sendiri. Dalam situasi yang serba sulit saat ini kelompok juga merasakan dampaknya, baik itu dari kenaikan harga pakan maupun harga bibit, sehingga mereka harus berusaha keras mengatur keuangan dalam mengelola usahanya supaya tidak mengalami kerugian. Untuk mempertahankan keuntungan yang mereka peroleh selama ini yang berkisar Rp 600.000 sampai Rp 800.000 dalam waktu enam bulan, mereka mensiasati dengan cara mencari waktu yang tepat saat menjual babi yaitu pada waktu menjelang hari raya keagamaan dimana harga babi biasanya lebih tinggi daripada hari-hari biasa. Dengan cara inilah kelompok mampu mempertahankan kestabilan usaha mereka. 
	Melihat  dari situasi yang ada pada saat ini dimana tidak semua anggota bisa mandiri menjalankan usaha dengan modal sendiri maka kelompok memutuskan untuk tetap melanjutkan kerja sama dengan Dinari, yaitu dengan mengikuti program ternak babi dengan jangka waktu enam bulan dengan pembayaran dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman, dengan harapan usaha bisa lebih berkembang dan sedikit demi sedikit memupuk modal dari keuntungan yang diperoleh sehingga bisa mandiri pada suatu saat nanti.
texts.en:
The Merta Nadi group had already received venture-financing loan from Dinari twice and they derived great benefit from this co-operation. Previously the members were 11 people and now two among them stopped because felt already able to manage their venture with their own funding. In this precarious situation, at this moment the group feels the impact, whether from the increase in cost of supplies or cost of piglets, thus requiring stringent changes in managing the venture’s finances so as not to incur losses. To maintain the profit they already attained till now of fluctuating from Rp.600.000 till Rp.800.000 in the time of 6 months, they strategize with ways to find the precise time to sell the pig that is during the religious festival when the price of pork is usually higher than ordinary day. With this method the group is able to maintain the stability of their venture. Viewing the current situation where not all members is independently able to operate venture with their own funding thus the group decided to continue to work with Dinari, that is by following the pig rearing program for a period of 6 months with the repayment occurring at the end of the loan period, with the hope that the venture will develop and gradually nurturing the funding from the gain earned until they become self-sufficient at a later time.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita K. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Rita is 30 years old and is married, her husband being a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah sells fabrics and has been in this business for the past three years. She is 46 years old and married with a child. Deborah needs the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more fabrics to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is currently in the business of selling at her shop and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Agnes is 47 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adijatu

texts.en: Adijatu is 37 years old and married with four children. She resides in Lagos State with her family. She sells tailoring materials like zips, thread, etc. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Nyanial

texts.en:
Nyanial Y. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice and cabbages and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Nyanial is 22 years old and is married to a soldier. She has one child and her child does not yet go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi sells crates of drinks in retail to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. Bummi is 44 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer D. is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Amer is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her milk-selling business

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike rents out canopies, chairs, cooking pots, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. Nike is 48 years old and married with two children. She needs the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more chairs and canopies to rent out to her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and canopies

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah K. is currently in the business of selling cassava flour and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Deborah is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business selling cassava flour

loans.name: Bulya Rose Group

texts.en:
Bulya R. is 30 years of age; she is married with four children, ages 11 to three years. She rents a single-roomed house and that’s where she stays with her family. Her house has neither water nor electricity. She also takes care of additional family members in her house. She has three meals a day and her greatest expense in a month is for food.

Bulya R. sells necklaces and she does her business door-to-door. She works six days a week. She gets about 20 customers a day; she mainly sells to women and she sells on a retail basis. She started her business selling vegetables but later on, changed to selling necklaces.

The main challenge she faces in her business is that since she has to walk, she gets very tired at the end of the day. She has worked with MCDT for 4 years and she has received loans for 8 years now. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because it was the only institution that could lend her money without collateral. She has worked with her group for one year now. And she wants to use this loan to increase her stock.

Bulya R.'s aspiration is to expand in her business and be able to rent a room to sell her necklaces.

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 46 years old and married with three children. She sells kerosene and eggs. She has been in this business for a long time. Lydia needs the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Apuu

texts.en:
Apuu M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Apuu is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her green vegetable business

loans.name: Mrs. Phin Dim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank has sixteen members and is located in Prachum Angk Village, Kandal Province. The members will use their loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Phin D. is the village bank president, as selected by the members. She is 36 years old and the mother of five children; three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two attend a local school. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She cultivates in the dry season, but faces a problem because her field has infertile soil, which affects crop production. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for the field and fuel for her water pump so she can make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Sim Thea, is a construction worker who also works to support the family.

Note: Mrs. Sok Chanry, who is a group guarantor, is also presented in the picture with the village bank members.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Nine members have EoT loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and fuel to make rice field more productive

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: Modupe sells foodstuffs in retail and wholesale. Modupe needs the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. is currently in the business of petty trading and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Mary is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one child. He owns a retail business selling various construction materials. He has been in this business for 6 years and has been able to develop it to have three sales locations at the market. Sergei always tries to have a large assortment of goods as this is the key factor that increases his sales. He is a hard working and honest person. His clients value his honesty and come back for repeated purchases.

Sergei would like to receive a loan of UAH 13,000 to enlarge his inventory. He would spend additional income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Ret R., 37, is a villager living in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. She is married with four children who are students. She currently plants potato and cucumber crops, which she sells to buyers at a high price three months after she begins planting them. To help support more food for the family, her husband sells firewood.

She is requesting her second loan. She used the first loan to buy a motorbike so she can use it to deliver her produce to sell at the market. She plans to use this second loan to buy firewood in bulk to sell and to buy more fertilizer for her crop growing.

loans.use: To buy firewood and fertilizer

loans.name: Risikat

texts.en: Risikat O. sells foodstuffs, drinks, provisions and frozen food.  She has been in this business for the past 24 years.  Risikat is 44 years old and married with four children. She travels to Republic of Benin to buy her frozen food (turkey, chicken and Fish) and she goes to the market twice a month.  Risikat has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and the loans have tremendously increased her business.  Risikat needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more frozen food (turkey, chicken and fish) and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni R. is currently in the business of selling beer and soda and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Poni is 20 years old and single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.  

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan.  The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house.

loans.name: Modinotu

texts.en: Modinotu is an advanced woman, 52 years old, a widow with five children.  Modinotu sells clothes, shoes and bags and she learned this business from her mother from childhood.  She has been in the business for the past 20 years. Modinotu needs a loan of N140, 000 to purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Birungi Monica Group

texts.en:
Mugoya V. is 31 years of age and is married with four children aged 13 years to 9 months. She rents a one-roomed house. She also stays with her two sisters. She has three meals a day.

She has a retail shop where she works seven days a week. She receives about 20 customers a day and she has run this business for 6 years now. Prior to this she had tried tailoring. Her main challenge is rent for her place of work.

She has been with MCDT for three years now and she has received three loans. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because of the loan interest rates they charge. She will use this loan to pay for tuition for her children. She will also use part of it to increase her stock.

Her aspiration is to pay tuition for her children till they complete their education.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children and to increase on her stock

loans.name: Mrs. Men Meach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of sixteen members and is located in Peam Sala Village, Kandal province.

Mrs. Men M. is 64 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed in a garment factory. She owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates rice for a living. Aside from farming, she sells fish. Her husband, Mr. Savoeurn Bork, helps her in both business activities. Her fish business is going well and she would like to expand it. She is asking for a loan to purchase more fish to resell. She hopes that through this loan, she will be able to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher A. is 30 years old, married and lives with his wife and their three children in Gaza City, Palestine. Zaher has been working as a farmer for ten years. He grows different kinds of vegetables.

Zaher approached Kiva's partner, Ryada, because he wanted to purchase more farming aids, such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities, in order to manage his crops appropriately. He hopes that his increased profit will allow him to better support his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more farming aids such as herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells drinks and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. Florence has one small freezer; she was able to buy it with the loan that she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. In order to further increase her business, she is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and one deep freezer.

Florence is 43 years of old, married with five children. She is very optimistic about her business and the prosperity of her family. She appreciates the loan that has been given to her by both organizations (Kiva and LAPO Microfinance). She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and a freezer

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en: Vitaliy is a single man who has been selling fishing supplies at the central market in Nikopol for the last five years. There is high demand for his goods and low competition in this area of business. Vitaliy enjoys selling his goods and serving his customers. He is a responsible and honest man, whose customers speak well of him. Spring is the high season for fishing and Vitaliy would like to offer a larger variety of stock to his customers. He would therefore like a loan of 13000 UAH to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria P. has been a retailer (grocery) for years in Kiburiao. With this business, she was able to send her children to school and be able to respond to her family’s daily needs. Today, in addition to retailing, she has opened up a little eatery (only on tabo-tabo, a regular barangay market day which falls every Wednesday) to increase her business income. Recently, she received a loan amount of PHP 8,000 to meet her request for additional capital.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stock

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela sells bags of cement and bricks. She has been in this business since 2003. Angela needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell.

Angela is 39 years old and married with three children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom V. is a local fisherman, aged 48. He relies on fishing in and around Tunle Sap Lake and the public pounds in the village. He normally uses net tools for fishing. He can generate an average revenue of $4 per day to help be responsible for his family’s foods needs. Besides this he also cultivates a rice crop.

His wife's name is Thon, 44. She sells the fish she gets from her husband's fishing in the market. The family has five children: four are single and one is married and lives away from the family home.

Prom V. is asking for a loan to buy more fishing tools for his business operations. They live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian K. is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Lilian is 39 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house

loans.name: Adeniye

texts.en:
Adeniye lives in Iyana Orile in the Lagos state of Nigeria. She sells dry gin in her shop. Adeniye has been in this business for the past six years. Adeniye is 55 years old and married with four children.

Adeniye has been borrowing from Kiva's partner LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and the loans have boosted her productivity and profitability. Adeniye is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more dry gin to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more dry gin to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores A., at 50, has been a cosmetics (Avon Products) retailer through sales leader for five years and another one year as a direct selling agent whose credit limits are PHP 2,000 and PHP 6,000 respectively. With the PHP 11,000 re-loan from HSPFI, she will be able to target the category of direct seller by purchasing Avon Products for sale.

Although her husband is a soldier, she strives hard to contribute to the tuition fees of her children’s schooling at the city of Cagayan de Oro, taking nursing studies. She is dreaming that she could have her own display center of all purchased Avon products for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace U. has a business selling milk. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

Grace is 36 years old. She is married. Her husband is a cattle keeper. They have 4 children, who all go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, Grace hopes to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations, with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Mrs. Ruby S. is a resident of Laredico, which is 5 kilometers from Quezon, where commercial gasoline stations are found. Mrs. S. decided to open a gas station in Laredico to serve the people there. The majority of people work and ride "habal-habal," or on a passenger single type motorcycle.

Mrs. S.'s husband sells electronics in their neighborhood.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000 so she can purchase gasoline to sell. She will also use the loan to pay for a subscription to a network service that lists her as a retailer. This will be her first loan from HSPFI, a KIVA partner.

loans.use: To purchase gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Kofoworola

texts.en:
Kofoworola has a restaurant where she sells drinks, juice and pepper soup. She has been in this business for the past 15 years.

Kofoworola lives in Orile, in the Lagos State of Nigeria. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past year.

Kofoworola is 43 years old. She has 3 children.

Kofoworola needs a loan of N140,000 so she can purchase more drinks and pepper soup spice. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and pepper soup spices to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita A. is engaged in rice farming. She is 39 years old and all of her three children are studying. She depends mainly on her harvest to be able to pay all the tuition and book fees of her children. Her harvest is intended for family use and the rest is sold to rice traders for additional income. She wants to establish a new store. However, she doesn't have enough capital to start a new business.

She is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. Some of her loan will also be used to start a sari-sari (general or variety) store. Her loan will definitely give her a better harvest. She hopes someday that she will be able to buy more farmland. In that way, she will have more rice to sell for the future of her children.

CEVI supports Carmelita in her business. Now, she enjoys having the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her eatery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy rice seeds to grow and fuel to support the field to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Fawusat

texts.en: Fawusat sells drinks and wine. She is 50 years old and is a widow with 5 children. Fawusat is very enthusiastic about the well-being of her family and the prosperity of her business. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more wine and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and wine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea C. is a 48 years old mother of five children; four of them are living in the family home under her care and the other is married.  (Chea C. was not available for photographing.  The picture is of her husband.)

Chea wants her son to have a suitable business to invest in.  She is applying for a $1200 loan as capital in order to purchase a new motorcycle belong to her son to begin as a taxi driver.  

Chea presently is a building worker for a small firm in the Siem Reap province.  She is married to Mr. Seang, age 43, who is a motorcycle taxi driver.  

The family lives in Siem Reap province, in Cambodia.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle for son.

loans.name: Ekatte

texts.en: Ekatte O. sells engine oil and eggs. She needs a loan of N150,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell.  Ekatte is 48 years old and married with four children.  She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.  Ekatte is a LAPO client.

loans.use: Purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Mrs. Adelaida T., 41, has been a loyal client of HSPFI for many years. She wants funds amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase trays of eggs, bags of rice and assorted RTW (ready-to-wear) for her established customers.  Her neighbors are sugarcane planters, banana and pineapple plantation workers in their village. Adelaida is maximizing her stock due to the entry of various plantation workers.

loans.use: Purchase trays of eggs, bags of rice, assorted items for sale.

loans.name: Chabb's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chabb Choek is a group leader of five in Peam Sala village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy them. She would use the rest of the loan to buy corn to boil for selling in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Meach Bit, sells boiled corn in the local village. Mrs. Chabb Choek is 43 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom help their father with his business while the other three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to cultivate and corn to boil for selling in the local village

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is 35 years old and married with five children. She sells bricks. She needs the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more bags of cement and sand to make more bricks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement and sand to make more bricks to sell

loans.name: Olushola

texts.en: Olushola sells drinks, pepper soup, and dry gin (Ogogoro) in her shop. Olushola is 52 years old, married with 3 children. Olushola has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. Olushola lives in Oke-koto in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks, wine, and pepper soup spice to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup

loans.name: Mrs. Chanry Sun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people who all live in Peam Sala village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan and they will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Chanry Sun is a village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice. Aside from owning this plantation, she is a fruit seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell. Additionally, she would use the rest of the loan to buy fuel for her pump to water her field when it is infertile. Her husband, Mr. M. Kea, helps her in both business activities.

Mrs. Chanry Sun is 37 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while three others are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is four years old.

Mrs. Koemly S. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell and fuel for her pump to water her field

loans.name: Pilar And Conrado

texts.en:
The couple, Pilar and Conrado, have been balut processors and at the same time hatchery operators for 10 years at Laligan, Valencia City. They are duck raisers and want to sell the fresh processed eggs for as much as PHP 10.00 and hatchery on order; selling day-old duck chicks at P 30.00 per bird.

They own a traditional balut processor or incubator where they can put the ducks' eggs with a capacity of 10,000 eggs. Their long term vision is to own a semi-sophisticated incubator to increase their services (hatchery) and balut processing.

Balut is a processed fresh duck egg, incubated for 1-18 days. This is a nutritious delicacy, preferably designed for aged people. They are requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000.

loans.use: To purchase fresh eggs for hatching and balut processing

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a nurse by training and she also has a store where she sells medicine to people in her community. She has been in this business for a long time. Abigail is 46 years old and married with three children. Abigail needs the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells drinks, ready-made, and also rents DVD plates. Toyin learned this business in 6 months and she has been in it for the past 8 years. Toyin opens her shop from 7am to 11pm, from Monday to Sunday. Toyin is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Agege and she is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks, CDs, and DVD plates to sell and to rent. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, CDs, and DVDs to sell or rent

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike sells clothing materials and fabrics. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more clothing materials to sell. Nike is 40 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sell.

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en:
Dupe sells industrial chemicals and drinks. She learned her business in 3 months and she has been in this business for the past 8 years. Dupe is 45 years old and she has 5 children. Dupe lives in Agege and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years.

Dupe’s business has been improving greatly, especially for the past 3 years when she started borrowing from LAPO Microfinance. Dupe is requesting the loan amount of N140, 000 to enable her to purchase more industrial chemicals and drinks to sell. She is very grateful for the loan given to her by LAPO Microfinance and Kiva. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and industrial chemicals to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes N. is a typical grocery retailer in their place at Laligan, Valencia City, Southern Philippines. She has applied for a 4th loan amounting to Php 14,000 to purchase additional stocks of grocery items. She started this project last year, utilizing the vegetables harvested from their garden until she could purchase other items which were frequently requested by her local customers. Someday she dreams of having her own storehouse where she could keep palay (newly harvested rice grains).

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhon Chum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan consists of eight people located in Sramaoch Haer village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Sokhon C. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from owning this plantation, she is a weaver. In her weaving business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy raw material to weave for her customers. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to enable her to buy it. Mrs. Sokhon C. is a 52-year-old widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy raw material to weave for her customers

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Mr. Sar P. is an ice-cream seller in Kraing Raong village in Takeo province. Since this business is going well, he wants to sell it door to door so he decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport his ice-cream. His wife, Mrs. Som Yang, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living.

Mr. Sar P. is 33 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study because that child is four years old. Mr. Sar P.’s wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport his ice-cream to sell door to door

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en: Omolola is 42 years old and married with four children. She is a LAPO client. She sells fabrics and has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more fabrics to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and cream. Flora is 43 years old and married with four children. She is a hardworking woman. Flora needs the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Kishwar Sultana Javed Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Kishwar sultana baji is a 36 year old married lady and a citizen of Arifwala, Pakistan for the last 5 years. Kishwar baji completed her education up to the 8th standard and left her education because, due to her mother’s illness, her presence became essential at home. Kishwar baji was married at the age of 18. Her husband’s name is J. I. and he runs a movie-making business. He has been in this profession for the last 6 years. Kishwar baji is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. All of her children are getting an education from a school located near the house.

Kishwar baji operates a clothes sewing business. She takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. With the income she pays off the school fees of her children. Her husband bears the household expenses. Kishwar baji’s brother-in-law also lives with her family. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw. Kishwar baji is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her brother-in-law, so that he earns the whole amount of his fares.

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji and Farida baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Shazia parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Olatunbosun

texts.en: Olatunbosun is a fashion designer and she also sells clothes. She has the advantage of customers' buying clothes from her shop, while she will also sew it for them. In this way, Olatunbosun increases her productivity and profitability and she is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their financial support. Olatunbosun has been in this business for the past 8 years. She needs the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more clothes and one industrial sewing machine. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Rashidan Zafar Haider Group

texts.en:
Rashidan Baji is a 48-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband's name is Z. H., a shoe seller by profession, who has been in this business for the past 5 years. Rashidan Baji is the mother of three sons. Her elder son runs a small hotel in the food market and attracts customers with his Punjabi foods. The next runs a vegetable selling business. Her younger son works in a private office as an telephone operator on a monthly wage. Rashidan Baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a clothes knitting business. She knits clothes and sells them to the cloth markets to earn an income. She saves her income in a community bank and plans to marry off her elder son with her savings. She is applying for a loan to expand her second son’s business by buying more vegetables.

Rashidan Baji is the group leader of three another women from her locality. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switch boards and switches) to sell. Maqsoodan Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Khursheed Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma Baji is a very determined lady and operates a clothes sewing business. With the income she was able to buy an electric sewing machine to grow her business.

She has been a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 2 years. Her husband's name is M. A. who has a motorbike rental business. Presently he has two bikes, which he rents per hour. Uzma Baji is applying for a loan to buy another bike to expand her husband’s motorbike rental business.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for rent business

loans.name: Moriamo

texts.en: Moriamo is 39 years old and married with 3 children. Moriamo sells clothes. She acquired the skill from her mother and she has been in the business for the past 15 years. Moriamo travels to Ogun state twice a month to buy clothes. Moriamo has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. Moriamo is requestin the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells cooked foods in a high school in Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. Esther is 43 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a teacher. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Mumtaz Akbar Ali Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is 50 years old and a married lady who has resided in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 25 years. Her husband's name is A. A., a butcher by trade. He has been running a butcher shop in the community for the past 5 years.

Mumtaz baji is the mother of five kids: three daughters and two sons. All of her kids are getting an education. Mumtaz baji has a wish to give her kids a good education. For completing that wish she operates a decorative embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses on order which she takes from the cloth shops, and in so doing she earns income. She uses her income to pay school fees and to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy goats for her husband’s butcher shop.

Mumtaz baji is the group leader for another three women from her locality. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit -selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goats for butcher shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 44 years old and married with three children. Mary sells drinks, juice, and rechargeable phone cards. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha sells apples, detergent, and sachet water in her shop. Aisha has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO Microfinance client. Aisha is 46 years old and married with 5 children. Aisha lives in Agege and she is requesting the loan amount of N 140,000 to purchase more apples and detergent to sell. She thanks all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more apples and detergent to sell

loans.name: Bashiran Ghulam Rasool Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is 44 years old and a married lady citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Bashiran baji completed her education up to 8th standard and couldn’t study further because she belongs to a poor family. Bashiran baji’s husband's name is G. R., a butcher by trade, who has been running a butcher shop in the community for the past 5 years.

Bashiran baji is the mother of six kids: five sons and one daughter. Her first four kids are daily wage laborers. The others are enrolled in a school and getting an education. Bashiran baji is applying for a loan to buy goats for her husband’s butcher shop.

Bashiran baji is the group leader for two other women from her locality. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goats for butcher shop

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Madame K. abla est mariée à un monsieur qui est soudeur, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’avédji, elle à 6 enfants,  elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de denrées alimentaires, c’est cette activité qui lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.  Le crédit qu’elle demande à WAGES va lui permettre d’agrandir son stock avec 4paniers de tomates, 4 paniers de poissons, 10 bidons d’huile de palme, 6 paniers de Gombo.
texts.en:
Ms. K. Abla is married to a gentleman who is a welder. She lives with her family in the Avédji district and has six children. Her income-generating work involves selling foodstuff. It’s a business that enables her to assist her husband with household expenses. The loan from WAGES that she’s asking for will allow her to increase her inventory of goods with: four baskets of tomatoes, four baskets of fish, ten drums of palm oil, and six baskets of okra.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
"My name is Naheed and I have been a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. My husband's name is S. A. and he runs a tea stall in the food market. People come to him for taking tea and for making chit chat because my husband’s behavior is very friendly with the customers." 

Naheed baji supports her husband by sewing clothes. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. Her husband is very happy with her behavior. She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients (tea, sugar, and milk) for her husband’s tea stall.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for tea stall

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia baji is a wife of M. A. and they live in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. They have been in this city for the last 10 years. Razia baji’s husband has been a butcher by profession for the past 6 years. Customers are attracted to his shop due to his good behavior and good measurement of meat. Razia baji is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats) for her husband’s butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy goats for butcher shop

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. O. sells sarongs and the demand for her sarongs is high. She wants a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 42 years old and married with three children. Tina sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for a long time. Tina hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en: Foluke sells provisions like noodles, milk, detergent, bathing soap, etc. She hopes to expand this business. Foluke is 40 years old and married with a child. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: E. Ayaba est une résidente du quartier d’agoè atsanvé, elle exerce dans la restauration mais sa spécialité est la vente de riz, très tôt le matin les travailleurs et surtout les écoliers achètent chez elle avant d’aller à l’école. Elle est très connue parce que sa cuisine est très appréciée dans son quartier. Son stock de produits de première nécessité qu’elle utilise pour la cuisson est épuisé, elle sollicite à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 4 cartons de poulets, 8cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers produits. Elle est mariée et a 04 enfants.
texts.en:
E. Ayaba is a resident of the Agoè Atsanvé district. She works in the restaurant business, but her specialty is in selling rice. Very early in the morning, travelers and especially school children buy from her before going to school. She is well-known because her cooking is highly appreciated in her district. Her stock of essential ingredients she uses for cooking is exhausted. She’s requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy: five sacks of rice, four boxes of chickens, eight boxes of pasta, and various goods. She is married and has four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, chicken, and pasta

loans.name: Oluwatosin

texts.en: Oluwatosin is a trained nurse and she sells medicine. She is 54 years old and is a widow with four children. Oluwatosin needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Kishwar Sultana

texts.en:
My name is Kishwar sultana and I am a married woman and the mother of four daughters. I have been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 35 years. I completed my education up to the 5th standard but couldn’t read more because my parents couldn’t afford my education expenses. I married a man whose name is M. A. and he has a government job and works as a security guard on monthly wage.

I manufacture thread-chain which I sell to the goldsmiths and they use it to tie up the jewelry. My daughters help me in the making of thread-chains. I’ve successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy more thread to expand my thread-chain making business.

loans.use: To buy thread for making thread-chains

loans.name: Yasmeen Begum

texts.en:
My name is Yasmeen begum and I am 33 years old and married. I own a two-room brick house in Lahore, Pakistan, and have resided in it with my family for the past 20 years. My husband's name is S. R.. He is a driver who drives a vehicle named Mazda, picking people up from different areas and dropping them to their required places. He charges Pak Rs. 10/- for each passenger.

I am a mother of five kids: three sons and two daughters. All of my kids are getting an education from a local school. I have successfully completed my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva's partner). Now I am applying again for a loan to repair my husband’s vehicle because his vehicle’s engine is creating problems and if it doesn’t get fixed in time the engine seizes.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Oluwatoyin

texts.en: Oluwatoyin sells kerosene and she has been in this business since 1993. She is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Oluwatoyin is requesting a loan of N140,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She is very happy with the loan that was given to her by Kiva and prayed that God will continue to bless and provide for the (Kiva lenders). She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
My name is Khalida and my age is 44 years. I have been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 3 years. I am a widow and I bear the hardships to support my family. I started sewing clothes but I did this work for only three years because it is a time-intensive profession and I hadn’t a sewing machine in good condition.

Now I have started to manufacture thread-chains and sell them to the goldsmiths. This work gives me good earnings and I can easily manage my household expenses and pay off the school fees of my five children. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy more thread for expanding my thread-chain making business.

loans.use: To buy thread for her thread-chain making business

loans.name: Iqra

texts.en: My name is Iqra and I’m a 21 year old married lady.  I have resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years.  I got education till 10th standard and then got married to a man whose name is Zulfiqar Ali.  He is a movie maker.  He makes movies of different occasion e.g. (birthdays, marriages).  He has been in this business for the past 10 years.  Iqra B. successfully repaid her first loan.  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another movie camera for her husband.

loans.use: Buy movie camera for husband.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: My name is Parveen A. and I am a citizen of a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 40 years.  I am an uneducated lady because I belong to a poor family and my parents were not in a position to send me to school. My husband died at the age of 60 of a heart attack.  I am a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughters.  My eldest son drives an ox cart for delivering items (crops, fertilizer) from one place to another and my younger son is a loader by profession.  My daughters help me in my thread chain making business.  We collect the orders from the goldsmiths because they used the thread chain to tie up jewelry.  We make 12 dozen thread chains in one week and earn good income.  I have successfully repaid my five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now I am applying for a loan to buy an ox for my younger son so that he will be able to do his loading work easily.

loans.use: Buy an ox for son's loading business.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad baji is 51 years old married lady and a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the last 35 years.  Arshad baji’s husband name is S. A. who has a spare parts selling business. He runs a shop near to the bus stand, and he earns good income on daily basis. Presently, he is out of stock and need to be completed the order of his customers. Arshad baji is a mother of one son, age 17 who is studying in 10th standard. Arshad baji successfully repaid her five loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more spare parts to complete the order of his customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana K. is 48 years old married lady and a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 30 years.  She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses.  Farzana got married with Mr. Afzal Goga who runs a scrap business in the community.  He buys old stuff (wooden cupboards, plastic bottles) at cheap rates and sells them to the factories and earns income.  Farzana is the mother of eight kids: five sons and three daughters.  My first two sons work in a factory on a monthly wage. The next is involved with his father’s scrap business.  The next younger has a lath business.  The others are getting education from a local school.  Farzana successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

loans.use: Buy scrap for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en: Sumera is a 27 year old married lady and a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 27 years.  Her husband name is S. A. who has a rental motorbikes business.  He rents his motorbikes and charge the people per hour. Presently he has two motorbikes.  Sumera is the mother of one son who is just one year old.  Sumera manufactures thread chains by taking orders from goldsmiths. She prepares 6 dozens thread chains in a week and earns good income.  She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another motorbike for her husband’s motorbike rental business.

loans.use: Buy another motorbike for her husband's rental business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more pumpkin seeds to plant

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou D. est âgé de 38 ans et  vit avec ses 2 enfants et son épouse dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative  de la république du Mali).
Très tôt, Monsieur Mamadou D.  commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment la réparation de bicyclettes qu’il a appris auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de 10 ans, Monsieur Mamadou D. maîtrise parfaitement son activité.
Pour améliorer son entreprise il décida d’associer la vente des pièces détachées à son activité de  réparation de bicyclettes.
Monsieur Mamadou D. décide  alors d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. 
Il compte utiliser ce deuxième prêt pour acheter un lot important de pièces détachées,les plus demandées lors la réparation des bicyclettes.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente à Bougouni dans son garage où il répare les bicyclettes. Sa clientèle est composée de propriétaires de bicyclettes et de réparateurs.
Avec ce prêt, Mamadou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage construire une maison, agrandir son entreprise et  subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D., age 38, lives with his two children and wife in a monogamous family in the Hérémakono Nord district of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Early on, he started earning an income, notably in repairing bicycles that he learned how to do from his uncle. With ten years of experience, he has perfectly mastered his business.

To improve his enterprise, he decided to include the sale of spare parts. So he decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his second individual loan. The preceding loan has been correctly repaid.

He intends to use this second loan to buy a major batch of spare parts that are the most in demand when repairing bikes. Supplies are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali), and sales are made in Bougouni in his garage, where he repairs bikes. His customers are composed of bike owners and repairmen.

With this loan, Mamadou intends to realize a monthly of profit of 50,000 francs CFA that he envisions using to build a house, to expand his enterprise, and to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike is a LAPO client. She sells juice and drinks. She requests a $825 loan to purchase more juice to sell. She is 38 years old and married with three children. She thanks everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more juice to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a LAPO client. Josephine owns a boutique where she sells sarongs and other clothes for men and women. She requests a loan of $825 to purchase more clothes to sell. Josephine is 38 years old and married with a child. She says thank you to LAPO microfinance and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells tailoring materials and is also a fashion designer.  She has been in this business for the past 8 years. Mary is 35 years old and married with 4 children and lives in Badagry. Mary is very energetic and business focused. Mary needs requests a loan of $550 to purchase more tailoring materials and an industrial weaving machine. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and an industrial weaving machine

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells palm oil retail to her customers. The demand for her palm oil is high and she hopes to fulfill it. Mary requests a loan amount of $700 to purchase more palm oil to sell. Mary is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere sells foodstuffs. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She promises to pay back promptly. Chinyere is 33 years old and married with a child. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace rents out VCD’s and she also sells tailoring materials. Grace needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more VCD’s and tailoring materials to sell. Grace is a LAPO client. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCD and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat is 38 years old and married and with three children. She sells medicine to people in her community. She is a LAPO client. She requests a loan of $950 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 54-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Bouj Al Barajneh in the Beirut suburbs. He has owned a taxi since 1996, servicing Beirut and the surrounding area. Today Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to perform maintenance on his taxi.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells used clothes and shoes. She travels to Cotonou to purchase her goods and sells them in Lagos, Nigeria. Grace requests a loan of $950 to purchase more used clothes and shoes to sell. Grace is 42 years old and married with a child. She says thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Simbiat

texts.en: Simbiat is 45 years old and married with five children. She sells kerosene and foodstuffs like rice, garri, yam etc.  She has been in this business for a long time.  Simbiat requests a loan of $550 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and she promises to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 32-year-old married woman with three young children, living in Al Shwaifat in Mount Lebanon. She owns a used home electrical equipment shop in her village. Today, Najah wants to borrow $1,000 in order to buy inventory at a very good price, so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To buy inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oyubola

texts.en: Oyubola is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She owns a poultry farm where she rears poultry birds. Oyubola requests a $550 loan to purchase poultry feed and more birds.Oyubola is a hardworking woman and she hopes to expand her business. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and more birds

loans.name: Geannice Melissa

texts.es:
Melisa es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Melisa es conviviente y tiene 21 años, Melisa tiene un restaurante llamado OKEY que esta ubicado en un local alquilado, cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan en la atención y cocina. Además Melisa es cantante de música vernacular, y canta en diferentes eventos, compromisos.
Melisa necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y como parte de pago de la grabación musical.
Los sueños de Melisa son ampliar su negocio y ser una artista de renombre.
texts.en:
Melisa is a member of the Communal Bank Trigales which means 'wheat field'. Melisa lives with her partner and is 21 years old. She has a restaurant called "OKEY" which is located in a rented space, shared by two people who help her with attention to customers and with cooking. Also Melisa is a singer of native music and she sings at various events, on engagement. Melisa needs a loan of 1750 soles, money she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and for part of payment for musical recording.
