Melisa's dream is to increase her business and to be a renowned artist.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar and to make a musical recording

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth owns a poultry farm where she rears poultry birds. She is 40 years old and married with four children. She requests a $550 loan to purchase poultry feed and more birds. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and more birds

loans.name: Daria Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Olinda es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Olinda vende cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito, además Olinda es jefa de zona de la empresa Oriflame, tiene a su cargo a varias vendedoras.
Olinda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos variados.
Los sueños de Olinda son ampliar su negocio y sus hijos estudien en colegios particulares.
texts.en:
Olinda is a member of the Banco Comunal Trigales. Olinda is 26 years old, has 2 children, and lives with their father. Olinda sells cosmetics by catalog. She sells to friends and family. Her sales are on credit. Olinda also works for the Oriflame business. She is a region manager and is in charge of several sales women. Olinda needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy various cosmetics. Olinda’s dreams are to expand her business and have her children study in private schools.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various cosmetics.

loans.name: Sidikat

texts.en: Sidikat sells salad ingredients at the Ojo market in Lagos. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. Sidikat is 32 years old and married with a child. Sidikat has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and these loans have helped increase her business tremendously. Sidikat requests a loan of $425 to purchase more vegetables to sell. She says she will be able to meet customer demand and thus her family's needs with the Kiva loan. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to make salad

loans.name: Morilat

texts.en: Morilat sells foodstuffs and is happy with her business because she makes a good profit. She requests a loan of $700 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Morilat is 42 years old and married with 3 children.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. She started this business in 2007. She requests a loan of $950 to purchase more drinks to sell. Grace is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Nike-Air Group

texts.en:
William Y., 33, is married with one daughter who is 11. He owns a butcher shop in Temeke, a suburb of Dar es Salaam. He works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $431.

This will be William's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has had this business since 2007 and wants to use the new loan to buy more meat.

William will share this loan with his group, Nike-Air. The group has 15 members who are tailors, food vendors, and egg and chips sellers. They hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, William is second from the left in a white shirt.

loans.use: Buy more meat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells foodstuffs, provisions and drinks. She has been in the business for 3 years. Elizabeth is 34 years old and married with 2 children and lives in Badagry, Nigeria. Elizabeth is requesting a $700 loan to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Shinuna H., age 41, is married with nine children. She makes chapati, fries fish and makes local pancakes in Tageta, a suburb of Dar es Salaam. She started 20 years ago and works from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $308.

This will be Shinuna’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She plans to buy more materials for her business and wishes to maybe open a shop that sells clothes in front of her house.

Shinuna will share this loan with her group Iringa. The group has 15 members who do tailoring, food vending, fish and charcoal. They hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Shinuna is in the middle in red.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica sells women's shoes and slippers and also rents out DVDs. Jessica is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She requests a $700 loan to purchase more women's shoes and slippers to sell.  She says thanks to everyone that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more women's shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline sells good used clothes to her customers. She travels to Cotonou to purchase her goods to sell in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more good used clothes to sell. Roseline is 38 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 52 años, es divorciado y tiene dos hijos, actualmente vive con su hija menor. De la nobleza de Alfredo se aprovechó su ex pareja, quién lo convenció de que le ayude a financiar su viaje a Argentina para trabajar allá y mejorar su economía, pero pasaron lo años y ella se olvidó de él y de su pequeña hija. Desde entonces él asumió todas las responsabilidades de su educación y cuidado. Ahora está muy contento porque su hija acaba de cumplir 14 años y ya le apoya en lo que él necesita. Su oficio es de albañil, Alfredo nos cuenta que ya puede irse a su jornada sin preparar antes el almuerzo, porque al regresar ya tiene sus alimentos listos y es atendido por su hija. Pero, él lamenta mucho no poder pagarle estudios superiores, por lo que quiere poner una bodega a la que se pueda ocupar su hija, para que vaya aprendiendo a ser independiente y le sirva como base para el resto de su vida. Alfredo es un cliente muy responsable y siempre paga su cuota un día antes de la fecha programada, por lo que se ha ganado el reconocimiento de los demás integrantes. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, del cual le tiene mucha gratitud. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas y otros productos comestibles para hacer realidad su proyecto de su futura tienda.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 52 years old. He is divorced and has two children. He lives with his younger daughter. Alfredo’s ex wife took advantage of his good heart. She convinced him to pay for her trip to Argentina to work and make more money. But the years passed and she forgot about him and their small daughter. From then on he assumed all of the responsibilities for his daughter’s care and education. He is very happy that she just turned 14 and now lends him support when necessary. He is a bricklayer. Alfredo can now go about his workday without preparing lunch before he leaves. His daughter has their food ready and taken care of. But, he is very sad that he is unable to pay for her higher education. He would like to start a grocery story for her to run. She would be learning to be independent, and this would serve as a strong base for the rest of her life. Alfredo is a very responsible customer, and he always makes his payments the day before they are due. This is his 3rd loan with MFP for which he is very grateful. The loan will be used to buy candy and other food to make his future store a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to start a store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor cuenta con 24 años de edad, vive hace 4 años con la madre de sus dos hijos en una casa que le dieron a cuidar. En pareja se dedican al tejido de mantas, las cuales venden de acuerdo al grosor y la combinación de colores. Hace un año, unos clientes le solicitaron tapices, y Víctor cumplió con el pedido, pero él prefiere elaborar mantas, ya que los tapices requieren de mucho tiempo en la combinación de colores, y dice ganar igual. Lo que él desea es aumentar su producción para incrementar sus ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia. Víctor viene trabajando por 3ra vez consecutiva con MFP, en todo este tiempo no ha tenido problemas de morosidad, asimismo hace compromiso de seguir con la misma puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de un nuevo telar, para que su esposa ya no solo le apoye, sino produzca sus propias mantas, y ambos capten mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Victor is 24 years old and has lived for 4 years with the mother of his two children in a house that was given to them to look after. The couple works in the weaving of blankets which they sell according to their thickness and combination of colors. For a year, some customers have asked for tapestries and Victor satisfies these requests, but he prefers to produce blankets because tapestries require a lot of time and color combinations, and earn the same amount. What he wants is to increase his production to increase his income for the benefit of his family. This is Victor's 3rd consecutive time working with MFP, and in all that time he has not had problems with bad debt, and he has made a commitment to continue with the same timely payments. The money that he is asking for is for the purchase of a new loom, so that his wife can offer support, producing her own blankets, and so they can gain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new loom

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, actualmente están viviendo en la casa de su tío. Desde que tenía 15 años ayudaba a su padre en su oficio de artesano, su padre tejía mantas y frazadas, y ahora él viene realizando esta actividad. Se levanta a las 3.00am para avanzar con sus tejidos, y durante el día se dedica a la venta de ropa, pero solo durante las diferentes campañas en el año, para aprovechar la demanda, porque lo que a él le gusta es tejer. Esta actividad le ha permitido sustentar los gastos de su hogar, pero también tuvo épocas donde pasó malos momentos por la falta de venta de sus tejidos. Actualmente, lo que el produce durante la semana su esposa lo vende de forma ambulante los jueves y domingos a las ferias de la ciudad. Pero los anhelos de esta pareja es contar con un puesto propio para evitar que los estén moviendo de un lugar a otro durante sus ventas. Este es el primer préstamo de Víctor con MFP, y hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente todas las cuotas mencionadas en su cronograma de pagos; además espera colaborar, en la medida de sus posibilidades, para el buen funcionamiento de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de lanas procesadas y sintéticas para sus tejidos, con otra parte comprará uniformes escolares para vender, debido a la demanda por el inicio de clases.
texts.en:
Victor is 40 years old, is married, and has 5 children. They are living in his uncle’s house. When he was 15 he started helping his father in his work as an artisan. His father wove blankets, and now Victor is doing the same. He gets up at 3:00 a.m. to work on his weavings. During the day he sells clothes. He only sells during certain times of the year when he can take advantage of the demand because what he likes is weaving. This has allowed him to pay the home expenses, but he has also had some bad times when his textiles did not sell. Now his wife sells what he makes. She works as a street vendor at city fairs on Thursdays and Sundays. The goal this couple has is to have their own stand to avoid being moved from one place to another during their sales. This is Victor’s first loan with MFP. He promises to make all of his payments on time. He wants to work together as best as he can to help his community bank. The loan is to buy processed wool and synthetics for his weavings. Because there is high demand at the beginning of classes, he will also buy school uniforms to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 14 años y es madre de dos hijas. Desde muy jovencita se dedicaba a los tejidos, arte heredado de su padre y que con mucha perseverancia le ha permitido ser una mujer autosuficiente en su economía. Por ello, cuando la abandonó su primera pareja supo cubrir los gastos de su casa; pero ahora el amor le ha vuelto a sonreír, y desde entonces la felicidad se quedo en su hogar. Ambos producen frazadas y ponchos, a la semana realizan de 4 a 5, y últimamente está teniendo pedidos de otra ciudad. Pero Verónica no depende solo de los pedidos, sino que cada cierta temporada ella viaja con sus prendas a los lugares donde son mejor cotizados, y esto convierte su actividad en un negocio rentable. Por ello está muy feliz, su meta inmediata es hacer entablar el piso de su casa, para que trabajen abrigados durante las madrugadas. Verónica es una cliente que no tuvo problemas de pago en sus créditos anteriores, este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, su dificultad es que por estar de viaje en la venta de sus productos ha faltado a algunas reuniones de su banco comunal, pero siempre deja alguien encargado para que realice su pago y le informe de lo convenido. El dinero que solicita ahora es para la compra de pellejos de carnero, para la elaboración de frazadas.
texts.en:
Verónica is 33 years old, lives with her significant other of 14 years and is the mother of two daughters. Since she was very young Verónica has been knitting, an art that she inherited from her father and with much perseverance has made her a financially self-sufficient woman. For that reason, when she left her first significant other she knew how to cover the cost of her house. Now love has returned and made her smile again and since her home has been happy.

Both Verónica and her significant other produce blankets and ponchos, completing between 4 and 5 each week. Recently she has had orders for her products from another city. But Verónica does not only depend on orders, with each season she travels with her products to the areas where they are most sought-after, and this makes her business profitable. For that she is very happy and her immediate goal is to construct the floor of her home so that she and her significant other can work in the mornings in warmer conditions.

Verónica is a client that has not had problems paying back her previous loans, this is her 3rd loan with MFP. Her difficulty is that she travels to sell her products and has missed some meetings of her communal bank. But she always leaves someone in charge of making her payments and is informed of what happened. The money that she solicits now is for the purchase of sheepskin to make blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheepskin.

loans.name: Madafu Group

texts.en:
Masha M. age 40, is married with three children ages 18, 16 and 12. She sells re-conditioned radios, TV decks and fridges. Masha started her business in 2005 and works daily from 4am until 9pm. Masha is able to earn a monthly profit of around $615.

This will be Masha’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wishes to get a loan in order to increase her capital and buy more stock of all items sold in the small shop in her house.

Masha will share this loan with her loan group, Madafu, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Mashais is in the middle with a red dress and covered head.

loans.use: Buy more used electronic equipment

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es: Valerio cuenta con 40 años de edad, es casado desde hace 20 años y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 de ellos ya trabajan pero viven en su casa. Desde que se casó aprendió a tejer tapices, frazadas y mantas, y hace 3 años su cuñado le enseñó a tejer bonitas mantas de diversos colores y grosores. Desde entonces empezó a dedicar más tiempo a la elaboración de esta prenda, ya que es más comercial. Durante el mes de marzo vienen de otras ciudades sus compradores, quienes se dedican a vender este tipo de tejidos a los turistas que visitan sus ciudades durante la semana santa. La idea de Valerio es producir de 5 a 6 docenas y luego viajar a esos lugares para vender a los turistas directamente, pero como sus pedidos se incrementan en esos meses le es imposible realizar el viaje, y cuando quiere tejer durante otros meses cercanos a esta fechas, no puede porque no cuenta con el capital suficiente. Pero, Valerio no se hecha para atrás en esta meta y seguirá produciendo para aumentar sus ganancias y poder viajar los siguientes años, por el momento seguirá tejiendo y su esposa ofreciendo a sus demás clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, acaba de ingresar a su banco comunal, y está muy contento por la bienvenida que le dieron los otros integrantes, asimismo hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para proveerse del material necesario, como lanas procesadas y polvos para teñir las lanas de los colores que desee.
texts.en:
Valerio is 40 years old, has been married for 20 years and has 4 children, of which 2 are working but still live in his house. When he married, he learned to make tapestries and blankets and 3 years ago his brother-in-law taught him to make beautiful blankets with diverse colors and with thickness. Since then he started to spend more time making clothing, which is more commercial. During the month of March, his buyers, who sell these types of textiles to tourists during Holy Week, have come from other cities. Valerio's idea is to make 5 or 6 dozen and then travel to sell to the tourists directly, but his orders have increased recently and it is impossible to make the trip. When he wants to make textiles during other months close to holiday dates, he can't because he doesn't have sufficient capital. However, Valerio has not given up this goal and continues to producing in order to increase his earnings and have the ability to make the trip in the coming years. For the time being, he and his wife will continue to make textiles and offer them to other clientes. This is his first loan with MFP (field partner), he just became a member of the community bank, and he is very happy for the welcome that the other members gave him. He ahs also made a commitment to pay his share on time. The money he is asking for is for providing necessary material, such as processed wool and dying powders of the desired colors for the wool.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materiales for making blankets

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells cosmetics. She is a LAPO client. She is 32 years old and married with no children. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Dada

texts.en: H. has a shop where she sells textbooks. She has been in this business for the past three years. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more textbooks to sell. H. is 35 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, tuvo 3 hijos con su primera pareja, quien murió. Ahora tiene 2 con su actual compromiso. La artesanía es una de las habilidades que heredó de sus padres; cuando vivía su primer esposo ella preparaba los hilos para que él pueda tejer con mayor rapidez. Ahora con su pareja actual, ambos tejen, Rosa se levanta a las 3.00am para avanzar con sus tejidos y apartir de las 5.30am se dedica a su otro negocio, que es un restaurante que abrió hace 3 meses, al que aún no se acostumbra, ya que lo más le gusta es tejer, pero la necesidad económica les obligó a buscar nuevas fuentes de ingreso, debido a que la artesanía es muy rentable en ciertas temporadas, pero para cubrir los meses donde la demanda baja decidieron empezar a vender comida.  Y es justamente en el mes próximo de abril, en semana santa, cuando sus artesanías les dejan muy buenas ganancias. Rosa es la presidenta de su banco comunal, en este cargo dice sentirse muy bien, y está demostrando ser una cliente muy responsable, tanto en los pagos de sus cuotas con el sus funciones dentro de su grupo. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP. El dinero que está solicitando lo derivará a la compra de materiales para su artesanía, asimismo comprará un saco de arroz y un balde de aceite para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and has had 3 children with her first husband, who has passed away. Now she is responsible for 2 of the children. Craftmenship is one of the abilities that she got from her parents. When she lived with her first husband,, she prepared the threads so that he could weave with the best speed. Now with her partner, both make textiles. Rosa wakes up at 3am in order to make her textiles and at 5:30am, she works at her other business, a restaurant that she opened 3 months ago. She isn't used to running the restaurant, and what she likes best is to make textiles. However, economic necessity obligates her to make new sources of income, since craftsmanship is only profitable at certain times. To cover the months of low demand, she started selling food. It is just next month, the month of April during Holy Week, that craftsmen make the best earnings. Rosa is the president of her communal bank, in this she is doing well, and she is proving to be a very responsible member with her payments and her functions in the group. This is her third loan with MFP (field partner.) The money that she is asking for will be used for buying materials for her craftsmenship, a bag of rice and a bucket of oil for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materiales for making blankets and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Modinut

texts.en: In a popular junction called Cele bus stop located along Alaba International Road, you can find the food canteen of Modinut M.. Modinut is very popular in this locality where she sells cooked food because she has been there for the past 12 years. She is 45 years old and married with three children. Modinut wants to add the selling of drinks to her business, thereby increasing her profitability. Modinut needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Nelda

texts.es: Nelda cuenta con 38 años, vive con el padre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a hilar la lana de carnero, después teje medias de lana apropiadas para el intenso frió de las alturas, y si le hacen pedidos de chompas demora unos 15 días, pero cobra entre 80 o 90 soles. Pero su especialidad son las medias de lana de cordero, cada par lo vende de de 15 a 20 soles dependiendo el tamaño. Esta actividad le resulta rentable, y más aun cuando su pueblo tiene días festivos o en semana santa. En el lapso de estos cinco años ya ha hecho clientela, pero su meta es llevar sus prendas al mercado de la ciudad todos los domingos para que aumenten sus ventas. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en cada uno de sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando en esta oportunidad, es para la compra de pellejos de carnero y lanas trasquiladas, para convertirlas en hilos y le sirvan como capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Nelda is 38 years old and lives with the father of her 3 children in their own home. For the past five years she has worked spinning sheep’s wool. After spinning the wool she knits wool socks that are appropriate for the intense cold of the mountains. If people ask for sweaters it takes her 15 days to make them, but she charges between 80 and 90 soles. However, her specialty is making wool socks that she sells for 15-20 soles, depending on the size. This is a profitable activity for her, especially during holidays or Holy Week. In these five years she has built up a client base, but her goal is to take her products to the Sunday market in the city to increase her sales. This is her third loan with MFP and in this time she has proven to be very responsible with her payments. The money she is asking for is to buy sheep skins and shorn wool, to convert them to thread.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheepskins for making wool

loans.name: Fatimon

texts.en:
After visiting Fatimon’s business place, it was observed that all the shops in the community that sell sarongs (clothes) are her customers. Fatimon travels to Togo to buy her fabrics and she supplies traders both in her community and outside her community. The left over fabrics she will shape and sell in her shop.

Fatimon is a vibrant person with five children and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks all that made the loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es: Nazario está a punto de cumplir 30 años, es soltero, aun vive en la casa de su madre en compañía de su hermana. Todos sus hermanos se fueron a Lima en busca de un mejor porvenir, y le han propuesto irse con ellos, pero él prefiere apostar por el arte de labrar la tierra, como él llama a la agricultura, ya que le gusta mucho esta actividad. Años atrás solo sembraba en chacras temporales (regadas por la lluvia), y sus cosechas eran en los meses abril a mayo. Pero quiso cambiar esa realidad alquilando chacras de regadío y cambiado todas las semillas de acuerdo al tipo de tierra. Han pasado más de tres años y por fin está viendo los frutos de su esfuerzo. Ahora sus cosechas son  cada dos o tres veces por año, y cree haber aprendido las técnicas para convertirse en un gran agricultor. Sus metas próximas son de sembrar en la costa, debido a que cuenta con una buena cantidad de semillas especiales para ese clima, así incrementará su producción, con ello sus ganancias y convertirá su labor en una actividad muy rentable. Hace un año Nazario fue el presidente de su banco comunal, y cumplió muy bien con sus funciones, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para sus nuevas siembras en chacras costeñas.
texts.en:
Nazario is about to turn 30, he is single, and still lives in his mother's house along with his sister. His other siblings all left for Lima to look for a better future, and have proposed that he go with them, but he prefers to stay and work the land, as he refers to agriculture, since he really likes this activity. Many years ago he only farmed small plots of land (watered by the rain), and his harvests were in the months of April and May. But he wanted a change from renting land and changed all the seeds according to the type of land. More than three years have passed and he is finally seeing the fruit of his labor. Now his crops are harvested two or three times a year, and he believes he has learned the techniques to become a great farmer. His upcoming goals are to farm on the coast, since he has a large quantity of seeds especially for that climate. In this way he will increase his production which will increase his earnings and make his work a very profitable activity. Last year Nazario was the president of his community bank, and he completed all his tasks very well. This is his eighth loan with MFP and in all this time he has shown responsibility in his payments. The money he is asking for is for buying chemical fertilizers for planting his new coastal crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery cuenta con 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja durante 14 años y tiene 7 hijos, viven en la casa que heredó en sus padres. Mujer de varios oficios; se dedica a criar cuyes, al tejido, a la venta de comestibles y también tiene algunos cultivos. Pero la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a sus tejidos artesanales, donde pone toda su imaginación y creatividad. Con su herramienta fundamental, que es su pequeño telar y un cuadro o fotografía para guiarse de los colores y detalles del dibujo, confecciona sus tapices. Ahora, también está tejiendo chompas para niñas y niños de madejas gruesas, lo cual le resulta muy rentable, y con la venta de sus tapices, puede vivir con tranquilidad y cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Este arte textil los heredó de sus padres, y se siente muy orgullosa, con anhelos de tejer tapices en cantidades mayores para la Semana Santa, donde su pueblo es muy visitados por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Mery es la presienta de su banco comunal, este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de materiales para sus tejidos, con el afán de captar mayores ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mery is 42 years old and she has lived with her husband for the past 14 years. She has 7 children. They live with her in the house that she inherited from her parents. She makes a living by doing a variety of activities. She makes money by raising guinea pigs, weaving, selling food items and she also has a few crops. She makes the most money by selling her weavings and through her weaving she is able to express her creativity and imagination. Her most important tool is her loom and the drawings that she uses to guide the colors in her weavings. Recently she also began knitting sweaters out thick yarn for girls and boys. She is able to make a profit by selling her knitted items and by selling of her woven tapestries. The money that she makes allows her to live with tranquility and to cover the costs of her childrens' educations. Mery's parents taught her how to weave and knit and this makes her feel very proud. She wants to be able to weave a greater quantity of tapestries so that she can sell them during Holy Week. Her town receives many visitors and tourists that come from all around the world. Mery is the president of her communal bank. This will be her third loan with MFP and she has always made her payments on time. The money that she is asking for will be used to buy materials for her weavings so that she can increase her income and improve the quality of life for her family.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her weavings

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Morenike

texts.en: Morenike is a struggling young woman who she sells jewelry by hawking all day from Monday to Sunday, from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m., in order to make more sales and increase her profit. Morenike is 39 years old and married with four children. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos, gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo de ambos ya cuentan con una casa propia. Juntos se dedican a la producción de papa y arveja en terrenos agrícolas alquilados, una vez pasada la siembra su esposo se va a la selva a trabajar de peón y ella se queda en su comunidad al cuidado de sus cultivos, para controlar su normal desarrollo. De esta forma puede detectar a tiempo los males o plagas que puedan acechar a sus siembras, de ocurrir esto, de inmediato le comunica a su esposo para fumigar y contrarrestar los males. Martha está muy feliz con sus cultivos, está esperando que su menor hijo mayor tenga una edad apropiada para quedarse al cuidado de sus hermanos mientras ella se dedique a los trabajos agrícolas y no tener que esperar a su esposo. En esta temporada quieren incrementar sus siembras, porque en su anterior producción tuvieron muy buenas ganancias. Martha viene solicitando su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo demostró pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además siente que su obligación moral, comprometida con su asesora de crédito, es de no faltar a ninguna reunión de pago. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y orgánicos para abonar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Martha is 32 years old and lives with her common law husband and their 4 children. Thanks to the efforts and hard work of both her and her husband they now have a home of their own. They work together, cultivating potatoes and beans on rented farmland. Once the harvest is over, her husband leaves to work as a laborer in the jungle and she stays in their community to care for the fields, to make sure the crops develop normally. She watches any plagues or problems with the crops that could affect their harvest and if she sees anything, she contacts her husband to fumigate to counteract the problem. Martha is very happy with her crops. She is waiting for her oldest son to be old enough to care for the other children so she can dedicate her time to her agricultural work and not have to wait on her husband. This season they want to increase their harvest, because last season they had good earnings. This is Martha’s 8th loan with MFP and in this time she has always been punctual with her payments. She believes she has a moral obligation to not miss any payments, since she is committed to this creditor. The money she is asking for will be used to buy chemical and organic fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene 53 años, desde hace 5 años vive con su segunda pareja (se separó de la primera) en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Heredó de su padre el oficio de artesano, del cual se siente muy orgulloso, su especialidad son las mantas y frazadas a base de lana de carnero; durante su primera relación no puedo desarrollar esta actividad por falta del apoyo de su pareja, ya que para producir una frazada o manta se necesita una persona dedicada a ovillar los hilos para facilitar en el avance del trabajo. Pero su cónyuge actual es una mujer muy emprendedora, y le está motivando a reiniciar sus tejidos en sus horas libres, ya que ella trabaja vendiendo comida en el parque de su pueblo. Desde entonces Mario ha armado su telar y piensa entrar con fuerza en el mercado, ya que creatividad y paciencia es lo que le sobra. Tiene anhelos de convertirse es un artesano de gran trayectoria como lo fue su padre. Él es un cliente muy responsable un cada una de sus cuotas en su banco comunal y es siempre puntual en cada una de las reuniones que cita el asesor de crédito. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de diversos materiales que requiere en su taller, con el que iniciará su carrera para convertirse en un gran artesano.
texts.en:
Mario is 53 years old and has lived with his second wife for the past five years (he is separated from his first wife), in the home that he inherited from his parents. He also inherited a career as an artisan from his father, which he is very proud of. His specialty is blankets and comforters made of sheep’s wool. During his first marriage he could not develop this activity because he did not have his wife’s support—when making a blanket or comforter another person is needed to wind the thread in order to advance the project. His current wife is an entrepreneurial woman who has motivated him to begin weaving again in his free time. She works selling food in the park in their town. Mario has set up his weaving station and he hopes to enter the market in a strong way—he has lots of creativity and patience. He hopes to become a great artisan like his father was. He is a very responsible member of his community bank and is always punctual with his payments. This is his third loan with MFP. He will use the money to buy a variety of materials needed for his workshop, which he is starting to advance his career as an artisan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Weaving materials

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 50 años, es casada desD. hace 35 años y madre D. 6 hijos, D. los cuales uno D. ellos vive en su casa. Por más D. 35 años tiene una panadería, tiempo suficiente para ganar la experiencia necesaria para este oficio, ella y su esposo se levanta a las 2.00am para amasar 12 kilos D. la harina, luego trozar la masa mientras el horno se calienta a base D. leñas, una vez caliente el horno se hornean los panes a pulso. Por el alza del precio D. la harina, últimamente no les está resultado muy rentable, por ello quiere comprar una máquina amasadora, para que con ella puedan realizar mayor cantidad D. panes, ya que a mano se hacen bollos con más harina y mayor peso, pero las personas no pagan más, entonces con la máquina tendrán más panes con la misma cantidad D. harina.  Luzmila dice que su trabajo es muy pesado, sobre todo por tener pocas horas D. sueño, pero lo bueno es que tiene ganancias diarias y venden todos sus panes, además D. los pasteles, queques u otros bocaditos que hacen los fines D. semana, y durante los primeros días D. noviembre sus ganancias se triplican, debido a la festividad donD. se preparan unos biscochos típicos D. mucha demanda llamados “huahuas”. Luzmila, en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual en sus pagos, este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y no ha caído en morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para la máquina amasadora que tanto necesita, comprará sólo una D. segunda mano, porque no les alcanza para una nueva.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 50 years old, married for 35 years and the mother of 6 children. One of her children lives at home. For more than 35 years she has ran a bakery, which is more than enough time to gain necessary experience for this job. She and her husband get up at 2:00 am to knead 12 kilos of flour. While the oven is being heated by firewood, she separates the dough into pieces, then bakes the loaves of bread. Because of the high price of flour, her business has not been very profitable lately. She wants to buy a kneading machine so she can make more bread. When making bread by hand, she uses more flour, which weighs more, but the customers do not pay more. With a kneading machine she can make more bread with the same amount of flour. She can also make cakes and other baked items on the weekends. During the first few days in November her sales triple due to a holiday where she makes and sells a typical sweet bread called “huahuas.” This is her 3rd loan with MFP and Luzmila has always been on time with her payments—she has never procrastinated on making a payment. The money will be used for a kneading machine that she really needs. She will buy a used one since she can not afford a new one.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kneading machine for bread
